Post ID:3602
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-03-01 10:36:34
Subject:April 2nd-ProLibertad, Puerto Rico Teach In for Action!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@hotmail.com
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

El Coqui Libre March Newsletter can be downloaded at: 
http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclMarch2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

SAVE THE DATE!! SAVE THE DATE!!  SAVE THE DATE!!  SAVE THE DATE!!  SAVE THE 
DATE!!

WHILE THER EXISTS CHALLENGES, THERE IS LIFE, AND AS A CONSEQUENCE WE CAN BE 
CREATIVE EVEN IN THE URNS OF HELL!!--Oscar Lopez Rivera, Puerto Rican 
Political Prisoner

Saturday April 2nd, 2005  from 9am-5pm
John Jay College for Criminal Justice
445 West 59th St.
(Btwn. 9th-10th Avenues)
Lecture Hall 1311-N


Attention all Activists, Artists, Youth, Students, Community Members and 
People who believe in Freedom and Justice!!  The time is now to free the 
Puerto Rican Political Prisoners!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign and the Puerto Rican/Latin American Studies 
Department of John Jay College of Criminal Justice invite you to attend a 
special Teach in for Action for Puerto Rico and the Puerto Rican Political 
Prisoners!!

April 2005 marks the 25th anniversary of the incarceration of the Puerto 
Rican Political Prisoners!!  It is now time to reorganize our campaign and 
bring in new energy into this work;  WE NEED YOU!!

Come to the Teach In for Action and hear about how you can help the campaign 
to free the Puerto Rican Political Prisoners, get an update on what is 
happening in the Puerto Rican Independence Movement, hear from Don Rafael 
Cancel Miranda and other Puerto Rican Activists!!

Teach In for Action Program:

Rev. Luis Barrios, Puerto Rican/Latin American Studies Department of John 
Jay College of Criminal Justice
Frank Velgara, ProLibertad
Possibly Don Rafael Cancel Miranda
Possibly Luis Rosa

Workshops at the Teach in for Action:

Culture as a Weapon for Freedom and Change!!
Youth Caucus-Young People UNITE!!
Making Freedom happen; Working to Build a Movement to free the Puerto Rican 
Political Prisoners!!

There will be food, Cultural presentations and a lot of networking!!

For more information please contact ProLibertad@...



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

Subject:Despierta Boricua/El Coqui Libre March 2005
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
ProLibertad@...
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

El Coqui Libre March 2005 is out, please download a copy of our newsletter
at:

http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclMarch2005.pdf

Check out the latest edition of our newsletter, email the link to friends,
family and fellow activists!!  Circulate it throughout events and meetings!!
______________________________________________________________________________

Despierta Boricua is back this Week!!

Despierta Boricua is a weekly fifteen-minute Radio segment produced for WBAI
99.5 FM Friday Morning Wake UP Call by The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign.
Despierta Boricua airs at 6:45am, but is subject to re-scheduling depending
on the Station�s needs.

Despierta Boricua is dedicated to providing the New York City listening
audience with the latest news and updates on Puerto Rican politics and
culture from U.S. based Puerto Rican communities and the island of Puerto
Rico.

Happy International Working Women�s Day and Women�s History Month!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is dedicating all of our Despierta Boricua
segments to the Puerto Rican Women in arts, sciences, history and politics.

This week�s segment will feature an interview with Dr. Myrna Nieves of
Boricua College; she is organizing a special event on Boricua/Latino women
writers at Boricua College on Friday March 11th.

Tune in every week to Despierta Boricua, whether you receive a reminder or
not, 6:45am WBAI 99.5fm or via web stream, for those of you outside of NYC,
http://www.wbai.org
_______________________________________________________________________________

CELEBRATE THE REVOLUTIONARY PUERTO RICAN WOMAN!!

Friday March 18, 2005 6:30pm at St. Mary�s Church 521 w126th St.
(Btwn. Broadway and Amsterdam Ave.)
Take the 1 or 9 train to W125th St. and Broadway

Donation: $10 (no one will be turned away)

Food and Alcohol will be sold!! There will also be a raffle of Latin
American Artisan work made by women or donated by women for $2 a ticket.

Join The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign for a PARTY AND CELEBRATION dedicated
to the revolutionary Puerto Rican women that have fought for the freedom and
liberation of Puerto Rico and the Puerto Rican Political Prisoners!!

Join us as we honor the women that have been at the heart of the struggle
for Puerto Rican Independence, our Madres de la Patria/Mothers of the
Nation; women like Marianna Bracetti, Lolita Lebron, Isabel Rosado, Lola
Rodriguez De Tio, Adelfa Vera, Rosa Escobar, Dylcia Pagan, Carmen Valentin,
Ida Luz Rodriguez, Alicia Rodriguez, Carmen Jimenez De Cancel Miranda, and
many many more!!

This International Working Women�s Day and Women�s History Month event is
dedicated to Puerto Rican Political Prisoner Haydee Beltran Torres, who has
spent 25 years of her life in jail for fighting for the independence of
Puerto Rico!!

Come out and Support ProLibertad, Come out and honor our Madres de La
Patria/Mothers of the Nation, and help us FREE HAYDEE BELTRAN AND ALL THE
PUERTO RICAN POLITICAL PRISONERS!!

Program:

DANCING, DELICIOUS PUERTO RICAN FOOD, AND...

DJ Carlito and his All Latino Music Mix, who will be playing all the
fantastic Salsa, and Merengue you can dance to all night!!

Yaya, Yaya is a women's collective dedicated to preserving and promoting the
rich, cultural legacies and Africa-based musical traditions of Puerto Rico
and the Dominican Republic.

Rosie Mendez, Future City Council Woman

Lynne Stewart, People�s lawyer and Friend to the Puerto Rican Movement

Poetry by Boricua Poets:
Alina Serrano
Tanya Torres
Mariposa
Prima
Stacey Toro

A special film screening of "Our Women, Our struggle" a work in progress
documentary about women in the Puerto Rican independence movement by
Filmmaker Melissa Montero

El Coqui Libre March Newsletter can be downloaded at:
http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclMarch2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

Despierta Boricua is a weekly fifteen-minute Radio segment produced for WBAI
99.5 FM Friday Morning Wake UP Call by The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign.
Despierta Boricua airs at 6:45am, but is subject to re-scheduling depending
on the Station�s needs.

Despierta Boricua is dedicated to providing the New York City listening
audience with the latest news and updates on Puerto Rican politics and
culture from U.S. based Puerto Rican communities and the island of Puerto
Rico.

Happy International Working Women�s Day and Women�s History Month!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is dedicating all of our Despierta Boricua
segments in March to the Puerto Rican Women in arts, sciences, history and 
politics.

This week�s segment is dedicated to HAYDEE BELTRAN, THE ONLY FEMALE Puerto 
Rican Political prisoner; we will be talking about her case, and the special 
event being organized on march 18th dedicated to her and all the other 
revolutionary Puerto Rican women who have fought for Puerto Rican 
independence and self-determination.

Tune in every week to Despierta Boricua, whether you receive a reminder or
not, 6:45am WBAI 99.5fm or via web stream, for those of you outside of NYC,
http://www.wbai.org
______________________________________________________________________________

CELEBRATE THE REVOLUTIONARY PUERTO RICAN WOMAN!!

Friday March 18, 2005 6:30pm at St. Mary�s Church 521 w126th St.
(Btwn. Broadway and Amsterdam Ave.)
Take the 1 or 9 train to W125th St. and Broadway

Donation: $10 (no one will be turned away)

Food and Alcohol will be sold!! There will also be a raffle of Latin
American Artisan work made by women or donated by women for $2 a ticket.

Join The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign for a PARTY AND CELEBRATION dedicated
to the revolutionary Puerto Rican women that have fought for the freedom and
liberation of Puerto Rico and the Puerto Rican Political Prisoners!!

Join us as we honor the women that have been at the heart of the struggle
for Puerto Rican Independence, our Madres de la Patria/Mothers of the
Nation; women like Marianna Bracetti, Lolita Lebron, Isabel Rosado, Lola
Rodriguez De Tio, Adelfa Vera, Rosa Escobar, Dylcia Pagan, Carmen Valentin,
Ida Luz Rodriguez, Alicia Rodriguez, Carmen Jimenez De Cancel Miranda, and
many many more!!

This International Working Women�s Day and Women�s History Month event is
dedicated to Puerto Rican Political Prisoner Haydee Beltran Torres, who has
spent 25 years of her life in jail for fighting for the independence of
Puerto Rico!!

Come out and Support ProLibertad, Come out and honor our Madres de La
Patria/Mothers of the Nation, and help us FREE HAYDEE BELTRAN AND ALL THE
PUERTO RICAN POLITICAL PRISONERS!!

Program:

DANCING, DELICIOUS PUERTO RICAN FOOD, AND...

DJ Carlito and his All Latino Music Mix, who will be playing all the
fantastic Salsa, and Merengue you can dance to all night!!

Yaya, Yaya is a women's collective dedicated to preserving and promoting the
rich, cultural legacies and Africa-based musical traditions of Puerto Rico
and the Dominican Republic.

Rosie Mendez, Future City Council Woman

Lynne Stewart, People�s lawyer and Friend to the Puerto Rican Movement

Poetry by Boricua Poets:
Alina Serrano
Tanya Torres
Mariposa
Prima
Stacey Toro

A special film screening of "Our Women, Our struggle" a work in progress
documentary about women in the Puerto Rican independence movement by
Filmmaker Melissa Montero

Post ID:3607
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-03-10 07:32:41
Subject:Despierta Boricua/March 18th Celebrate the Puerto Rican Revolutionary Women!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

El Coqui Libre March Newsletter can be downloaded at:
http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclMarch2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

Despierta Boricua is a weekly fifteen-minute Radio segment produced for WBAI
99.5 FM Friday Morning Wake UP Call by The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign.
Despierta Boricua airs at 6:45am, but is subject to re-scheduling depending
on the Station�s needs.

Despierta Boricua is dedicated to providing the New York City listening
audience with the latest news and updates on Puerto Rican politics and
culture from U.S. based Puerto Rican communities and the island of Puerto
Rico.

Happy International Working Women�s Day and Women�s History Month!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is dedicating all of our Despierta Boricua
segments in March to the Puerto Rican Women in arts, sciences, history and 
politics.

This week�s segment is dedicated to HAYDEE BELTRAN, THE ONLY FEMALE Puerto 
Rican Political prisoner; we will be talking about her case, and the special 
event being organized on march 18th dedicated to her and all the other 
revolutionary Puerto Rican women who have fought for Puerto Rican 
independence and self-determination.

Tune in every week to Despierta Boricua, whether you receive a reminder or
not, 6:45am WBAI 99.5fm or via web stream, for those of you outside of NYC,
http://www.wbai.org
______________________________________________________________________________

CELEBRATE THE REVOLUTIONARY PUERTO RICAN WOMAN!!

Friday March 18, 2005 6:30pm at St. Mary�s Church 521 w126th St.
(Btwn. Broadway and Amsterdam Ave.)
Take the 1 or 9 train to W125th St. and Broadway

Donation: $10 (no one will be turned away)

Food and Alcohol will be sold!! There will also be a raffle of Latin
American Artisan work made by women or donated by women for $2 a ticket.

Join The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign for a PARTY AND CELEBRATION dedicated
to the revolutionary Puerto Rican women that have fought for the freedom and
liberation of Puerto Rico and the Puerto Rican Political Prisoners!!

Join us as we honor the women that have been at the heart of the struggle
for Puerto Rican Independence, our Madres de la Patria/Mothers of the
Nation; women like Marianna Bracetti, Lolita Lebron, Isabel Rosado, Lola
Rodriguez De Tio, Adelfa Vera, Rosa Escobar, Dylcia Pagan, Carmen Valentin,
Ida Luz Rodriguez, Alicia Rodriguez, Carmen Jimenez De Cancel Miranda, and
many many more!!

This International Working Women�s Day and Women�s History Month event is
dedicated to Puerto Rican Political Prisoner Haydee Beltran Torres, who has
spent 25 years of her life in jail for fighting for the independence of
Puerto Rico!!

Come out and Support ProLibertad, Come out and honor our Madres de La
Patria/Mothers of the Nation, and help us FREE HAYDEE BELTRAN AND ALL THE
PUERTO RICAN POLITICAL PRISONERS!!

Program:

DANCING, DELICIOUS PUERTO RICAN FOOD, AND...

DJ Carlito and his All Latino Music Mix, who will be playing all the
fantastic Salsa, and Merengue you can dance to all night!!

Yaya, Yaya is a women's collective dedicated to preserving and promoting the
rich, cultural legacies and Africa-based musical traditions of Puerto Rico
and the Dominican Republic.

Rosie Mendez, Future City Council Woman

Lynne Stewart, People�s lawyer and Friend to the Puerto Rican Movement

Poetry by Boricua Poets:
Alina Serrano
Tanya Torres
Mariposa
Prima
Stacey Toro

A special film screening of "Our Women, Our struggle" a work in progress
documentary about women in the Puerto Rican independence movement by
Filmmaker Melissa Montero

SAVE THE DATE!! SAVE THE DATE!!  SAVE THE DATE!!  SAVE THE DATE!!  SAVE THE
DATE!!

�WHILE THER EXISTS CHALLENGES, THERE IS LIFE, AND AS A CONSEQUENCE WE CAN BE
CREATIVE EVEN IN THE URNS OF HELL!!�--Oscar Lopez Rivera, Puerto Rican 
Political Prisoner

Saturday April 2nd, 2005  from 11am-3pm
John Jay College for Criminal Justice
445 West 59th St.
(Btwn. 9th-10th Avenues)
Lecture Hall 1311-N

Registration fee: $5-$10 (no one will be turned away)

Attention all Activists, Artists, Youth, Students, Community Members and
People who believe in Freedom and Justice!!  The time is now to free the
Puerto Rican Political Prisoners!!

April 2005 marks the 25th anniversary of the incarceration of the Puerto
Rican Political Prisoners!!  It is now time to reorganize our campaign and
bring in new energy into this work;  WE NEED YOU!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign and the Puerto Rican/Latin American Studies
Department of John Jay College of Criminal Justice invite you to attend a
special Teach in for Action for Puerto Rico and the Puerto Rican Political
Prisoners!!

Come to the Teach In for Action and hear about how you can help the campaign
to free the Puerto Rican Political Prisoners AND get an update on what is
happening in the Puerto Rican Independence Movement!!


TEACH IN FOR ACTION KEYNOTE ADDRESS:
Rev. Luis Barrios, Puerto Rican/Latin American Studies Department of John
Jay College of Criminal Justice

WORKSHOPS FOR THE TEACH INFOR ACTION:
Culture as a Weapon for Freedom and Change!!
Youth Caucus-Young People UNITE!!
Making Freedom happen; Working to Build a Movement to free the Puerto Rican
Political Prisoners!!

CULTURAL PERFORMANCES:
Broadcast Live
Rafael Landron
And many other performed to be announced�

For more information please contact ProLibertad@...

Post ID:3612
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-03-16 10:05:21
Subject:SUPPORT DYLCIA PAGAN!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
ProLibertad@...
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
Bronx 718-601-4751
Mnahattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

Former Puerto Rican Political Prisoner Dylcia Pagan needs our support!!  She 
was ill for several months, is currently unemployed, is in the process of 
moving from one town to another in Puerto Rico and needs our financial 
support!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is calling on our allies and supporters to 
help our sister Dylcia by sending her a donation; whatever you can send will 
be appreciated!!

Please send donations (checks or money orders made out to Dylcia Pagan) to:

Dylcia Pagan
752 Calle Evelino Vicente  #3b
San Juan, PR 00909

Who is Dylcia Pag�n???

Dylcia Pag�n is one of the 11 Puerto Rican former political prisoners 
granted clemency by President Clinton in September 1999. She immediately 
returned to Puerto Rico, where she and her compa�eros/as were met with a 
huge welcome celebration.

The background description below is adapted from Can't Jail the Spirit 
(March 1998).

Dylcia Pag�n was born in "El Barrio" in New York City on October 15, 1946. 
She attended Brooklyn College were she majored in Cinematography and 
Sociology, participated in the struggle for students' rights and founded the 
Puerto Rican Students Union. She taught social studies in the New York City 
school system, worked for ABC, NBC, and CBS and also for the daily newspaper 
El Tiempo.

Dylcia was captured April 4, 1980 along with other comrades, for 
participating in the underground wing of the Puerto Rican independence 
movement. She is serving a 55-year sentence on charges of seditious 
conspiracy, among others. She completed an 8-year state sentence. After 
years of separation, she has been reunited with her son Guillermo.

Dylcia's patriotism has manifested itself in many artistic forms which 
include painting, ceramics, poetry and her writings. She has participated in 
the production of a video about her life and lives of her compa�eros in the 
struggle. While in prison, she helped direct a documentary about the Puerto 
Rican Women Prisoners of War.

Her biography has been published in Puerto Rican Women: A History of 
Oppression and Resistance. Dylcia's poetry has appeared in Have You Seen La 
Nueva Mujer Puertorrique�a? Part of Dylcia's life story was also included in 
a book by the anthropologist, John Langston Gwaltney entitled, The 
Dissenters: Voices from Contemporary America.

Throughout her capture, trial and incarceration she has maintained her 
position as an anti-colonial prisoner of war (POW) resisting the illegal 
U.S. occupation of her homeland.





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Who is Dylcia Pag�n???

Dylcia Pag�n is one of the 11 Puerto Rican former political prisoners 
granted clemency by President Clinton in September 1999. She immediately 
returned to Puerto Rico, where she and her compa�eros/as were met with a 
huge welcome celebration.

The background description below is adapted from Can't Jail the Spirit 
(March 1998).

Dylcia Pag�n was born in "El Barrio" in New York City on October 15, 1946. 
She attended Brooklyn College were she majored in Cinematography and 
Sociology, participated in the struggle for students' rights and founded the 
Puerto Rican Students Union. She taught social studies in the New York City 
school system, worked for ABC, NBC, and CBS and also for the daily newspaper 
El Tiempo.

Dylcia was captured April 4, 1980 along with other comrades, for 
participating in the underground wing of the Puerto Rican independence 
movement. She is serving a 55-year sentence on charges of seditious 
conspiracy, among others. She completed an 8-year state sentence. After 
years of separation, she has been reunited with her son Guillermo.

Dylcia's patriotism has manifested itself in many artistic forms which 
include painting, ceramics, poetry and her writings. She has participated in 
the production of a video about her life and lives of her compa�eros in the 
struggle. While in prison, she helped direct a documentary about the Puerto 
Rican Women Prisoners of War.

Her biography has been published in Puerto Rican Women: A History of 
Oppression and Resistance. Dylcia's poetry has appeared in Have You Seen La 
Nueva Mujer Puertorrique�a? Part of Dylcia's life story was also included in 
a book by the anthropologist, John Langston Gwaltney entitled, The 
Dissenters: Voices from Contemporary America.

Throughout her capture, trial and incarceration she has maintained her 
position as an anti-colonial prisoner of war (POW) resisting the illegal 
U.S. occupation of her homeland.





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:3614
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-03-20 14:13:54
Subject:Puerto Rican Socialist Front/April 2nd Events
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

This ProLibertad digest includes:
1.  A Socialist Front Press Release on
2.  The April 2nd ProLIbertad Teach in for Action
3.  THe April 2nd Night time Jericho Spring Fling Party
______________________________________________________________________________

PRESS RELEASE

The Socialist Front of Puerto Rico
March 18, 2005

Spokespersons:  Jorge Farinacci Garc�a, 502-9756; Ricardo Santos Ortiz,
644-2998; Rafael Bernabe Riefkohl, 787-225-7071; Hugo Delgado , 787-403-2884
fax: (787) 722-8112

The Socialist Front Rejects The Attempt By The National Hostosiano
Independence
Movement (MINH) To Subordinate The Independence Movement To the
Popular Democratic Party (PPD) And Applauds Actions By Representative Javier
Garc�a Cab�n

The Socialist Front, an organization with a long history of anti-colonial
struggle, repudiates the constant attempts by leaders of the National
Hostosiano Independence Movement (MINH) to transform the independence
movement into a submissive and subordinate entity of the Popular Democratic
Party (PPD).  The current debate on the status of Puerto Rico has made clear
the posture of surrender and collaboration of this sector of the
independence movement. This sector is more concerned with reaching
agreements with the Popular Democratic Party than it is in articulating a
firm strategy of struggle for the independence of Puerto Rico. The fact that
they have opted to attack the Puerto Rican Independence Party (PIP) for not
supporting the colonial constituent project and their silence in face of the
support of the substitute project by the PPD leadership, shows that their
reason for being is to serve as a shield for that party.

The Socialist Front wants make clear that this sector does not represent the
majority of the Puerto Rican independence movement which in its varios
expressions � such as the PIP, the Nationalist Party of Puerto Rico, and the
EPB-Macheteros, among others, have maintained a firm and independent
position both in regard to U.S. imperialism and toward the colonialists of
the Popular Democratic Party (PPD).  With these actions and positions the
National Hostosiano Independence Movement (MINH), increasingly distances
itself from the Puerto Rican national liberation movement.

The independence movement cannot bind its future to the whims of the
colonialist party.   It also cannot fall into the trap of thinking that the
New Progressive Party (PNP) is an anti-colonial party.  The Socialist Front
applauds the actions of representative Javier Garc�a Cab�n who, in evident
contradiction with the colonialist majority of the PNP and the PPD,
submitted an amendment to the substitute project so that it would be known
that any Referendum to be submitted to the people should include a call to
remove Puerto Rico from the Territorial Clause of the United States
Constitution.  The Socialist Front made a similar proposal during the
hearings in the House and Senate.  Anyone who would calls themselves
anti-colonialists should begin by demanding the immediate removal of Puerto
Rico from that clause � anything else is to operate within the confines of
the colony.

In Puerto Rico there will not be a genuine process of decolonization lead by
people such as An�bal Acevedo Vil� and Luis Fortu�o.  The Socialist Front
calls on the entire independence movement to concentrate our efforts in
bringing the rest of the anti-colonialist sectors among the people to
positions of struggle and toward not wasting time with the maneuverings of
the political hacks of the PPD and the PNP.

Translation: Frank Velgara, Socialist Front/Frente Socialista - NY
_______________________________________________________________________________

SAVE THE DATE!! SAVE THE DATE!!  SAVE THE DATE!!  SAVE THE DATE!!  SAVE THE
DATE!!

�WHILE THER EXISTS CHALLENGES, THERE IS LIFE, AND AS A CONSEQUENCE WE CAN BE
CREATIVE EVEN IN THE URNS OF HELL!!�--Oscar Lopez Rivera, Puerto Rican
Political Prisoner

Saturday April 2nd, 2005  from 11am-3pm
John Jay College for Criminal Justice
445 West 59th St.
(Btwn. 9th-10th Avenues)
Lecture Hall 1311-N

Registration fee: $5-$10 (no one will be turned away)

Attention all Activists, Artists, Youth, Students, Community Members and
People who believe in Freedom and Justice!!  The time is now to free the
Puerto Rican Political Prisoners!!

April 2005 marks the 25th anniversary of the incarceration of the Puerto
Rican Political Prisoners!!  It is now time to reorganize our campaign and
bring in new energy into this work;  WE NEED YOU!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign and the Puerto Rican/Latin American Studies
Department of John Jay College of Criminal Justice invite you to attend a
special Teach in for Action for Puerto Rico and the Puerto Rican Political
Prisoners!!

Come to the Teach In for Action and hear about how you can help the campaign
to free the Puerto Rican Political Prisoners AND get an update on what is
happening in the Puerto Rican Independence Movement!!


TEACH IN FOR ACTION KEYNOTE ADDRESS:
Rev. Luis Barrios, Puerto Rican/Latin American Studies Department of John
Jay College of Criminal Justice

WORKSHOPS FOR THE TEACH INFOR ACTION:
Culture as a Weapon for Freedom and Change!!
Youth Caucus-Young People UNITE!!
Making Freedom happen; Working to Build a Movement to free the Puerto Rican
Political Prisoners!!

CULTURAL PERFORMANCES:
Broadcast Live
Rafael Landron
And many other performed to be announced�

For more information please contact ProLibertad@...

8 p.m. until . . .

Local 169 UNITE Union Hall
33 West 14th Street, Manhattan
(between 5th & 6th Aves.)

Dance to the tunes of DJ Carlito
and his all-Latino mix: Salsa � Mambo � Merengue � Reggaeton plus Hiphop,
Jazz, Motown, & more!

OPEN MIKE: Spoken Word � HipHop � Comedy

SILENT AUCTION OF ORIGINAL WORK OF ART BY WARD CHURCHILL!!

PRESS RELEASE

The Socialist Front of Puerto Rico
March 18, 2005

Spokespersons:  Jorge Farinacci Garc�a, 502-9756; Ricardo Santos Ortiz,
644-2998; Rafael Bernabe Riefkohl, 787-225-7071; Hugo Delgado , 787-403-2884
fax: (787) 722-8112

The Socialist Front Rejects The Attempt By The National Hostosiano
Independence
Movement (MINH) To Subordinate The Independence Movement To the
Popular Democratic Party (PPD) And Applauds Actions By Representative Javier
Garc�a Cab�n

The Socialist Front, an organization with a long history of anti-colonial
struggle, repudiates the constant attempts by leaders of the National
Hostosiano Independence Movement (MINH) to transform the independence
movement into a submissive and subordinate entity of the Popular Democratic
Party (PPD).  The current debate on the status of Puerto Rico has made clear
the posture of surrender and collaboration of this sector of the
independence movement. This sector is more concerned with reaching
agreements with the Popular Democratic Party than it is in articulating a
firm strategy of struggle for the independence of Puerto Rico. The fact that
they have opted to attack the Puerto Rican Independence Party (PIP) for not
supporting the colonial constituent project and their silence in face of the
support of the substitute project by the PPD leadership, shows that their
reason for being is to serve as a shield for that party.

The Socialist Front wants make clear that this sector does not represent the
majority of the Puerto Rican independence movement which in its varios
expressions � such as the PIP, the Nationalist Party of Puerto Rico, and the
EPB-Macheteros, among others, have maintained a firm and independent
position both in regard to U.S. imperialism and toward the colonialists of
the Popular Democratic Party (PPD).  With these actions and positions the
National Hostosiano Independence Movement (MINH), increasingly distances
itself from the Puerto Rican national liberation movement.

The independence movement cannot bind its future to the whims of the
colonialist party.   It also cannot fall into the trap of thinking that the
New Progressive Party (PNP) is an anti-colonial party.  The Socialist Front
applauds the actions of representative Javier Garc�a Cab�n who, in evident
contradiction with the colonialist majority of the PNP and the PPD,
submitted an amendment to the substitute project so that it would be known
that any Referendum to be submitted to the people should include a call to
remove Puerto Rico from the Territorial Clause of the United States
Constitution.  The Socialist Front made a similar proposal during the
hearings in the House and Senate.  Anyone who would calls themselves
anti-colonialists should begin by demanding the immediate removal of Puerto
Rico from that clause � anything else is to operate within the confines of
the colony.

In Puerto Rico there will not be a genuine process of decolonization lead by
people such as An�bal Acevedo Vil� and Luis Fortu�o.  The Socialist Front
calls on the entire independence movement to concentrate our efforts in
bringing the rest of the anti-colonialist sectors among the people to
positions of struggle and toward not wasting time with the maneuverings of
the political hacks of the PPD and the PNP.

Translation: Frank Velgara, Socialist Front/Frente Socialista - NY

Post ID:3618
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-03-22 20:42:15
Subject:Despierta Boricua/April 2nd Events
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Mnahattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

El Coqui Libre March Newsletter can be downloaded at:
http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclMarch2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

Despierta Boricua is a weekly fifteen minute Radio segment produced for WBAI
99.5 FM Friday Morning Wake UP Call by The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign.
Despierta Boricua airs at 6:45am, but is subject to re-scheduling depending
on the Station�s needs.

Despierta Boricua is dedicated to providing the New York City listening
audience with the latest news and updates on Puerto Rican politics and
culture from U.S. based Puerto Rican communities and the island of Puerto
Rico.

This month�s Despierta Boricuas are dedicated to the contributions of Puerto
Rican Women in arts, politics, history and culture.

This week�s segment features an interview with several sisters from Yaya.  
Yaya is a women's collective dedicated to preserving and promoting the rich, 
cultural legacies and Africa-based musical traditions of Puerto Rico and the 
Dominican Republic. Founded in 2002, Yaya honors the vibrant musical 
heritage represented in Puerto Rican bomba and Dominican salve traditions, 
through live performance, workshops, and female-led, creative ciphers. 
Recognizing the contributions of women in preserving and transmitting these 
traditions, Yaya honors the yayas (Creole/Kongo origin), or mothers, who 
have helped shape our histories, traditions and legacies of resistance.

Contact Info for Yaya:
TheZolLab@... 917 449 7419

Tune in every week to Despierta Boricua, whether you receive a reminder or
not, 6:45am WBAI 99.5fm or via web stream, for those of you outside of NYC,
http://www.wbai.org

_______________________________________________________________________________


�WHILE THER EXISTS CHALLENGES, THERE IS LIFE, AND AS A CONSEQUENCE WE CAN BE
CREATIVE EVEN IN THE URNS OF HELL!!�--Oscar Lopez Rivera, Puerto Rican
Political Prisoner

John Jay College for Criminal Justice
445 West 59th St.
(Btwn. 9th-10th Avenues)

_______________________________________________________________________________

SUPPORT DYLCIA PAGAN; SHE NEEDS OUR HELP!!

Former Puerto Rican Political Prisoner Dylcia Pagan needs our support!! She
was ill for several months, is currently unemployed, is in the process of
moving from one town to another in Puerto Rico and needs our financial
support!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is calling on our allies and supporters to
help our sister Dylcia by sending her a donation; whatever you can send will
be appreciated!!

Please send donations (checks or money orders made out to Dylcia Pagan) to:

Dylcia Pagan
752 Calle Evelino Vicente #3b
San Juan, PR 00909

Who is Dylcia Pag�n???

Dylcia Pag�n is one of the 11 Puerto Rican former political prisoners
granted clemency by President Clinton in September 1999. She immediately
returned to Puerto Rico, where she and her compa�eros/as were met with a
huge welcome celebration.

The background description below is adapted from Can't Jail the Spirit
(March 1998).

Dylcia Pag�n was born in "El Barrio" in New York City on October 15, 1946.
She attended Brooklyn College were she majored in Cinematography and
Sociology, participated in the struggle for students' rights and founded the
Puerto Rican Students Union. She taught social studies in the New York City
school system, worked for ABC, NBC, and CBS and also for the daily newspaper
El Tiempo.

Dylcia was captured April 4, 1980 along with other comrades, for
participating in the underground wing of the Puerto Rican independence
movement. She is serving a 55-year sentence on charges of seditious
conspiracy, among others. She completed an 8-year state sentence. After
years of separation, she has been reunited with her son Guillermo.

Dylcia's patriotism has manifested itself in many artistic forms which
include painting, ceramics, poetry and her writings. She has participated in
the production of a video about her life and lives of her compa�eros in the
struggle. While in prison, she helped direct a documentary about the Puerto
Rican Women Prisoners of War.

Her biography has been published in Puerto Rican Women: A History of
Oppression and Resistance. Dylcia's poetry has appeared in Have You Seen La
Nueva Mujer Puertorrique�a? Part of Dylcia's life story was also included in
a book by the anthropologist, John Langston Gwaltney entitled, The
Dissenters: Voices from Contemporary America.

Throughout her capture, trial and incarceration she has maintained her
position as an anti-colonial prisoner of war (POW) resisting the illegal
U.S. occupation of her homeland.

Despierta Boricua is a weekly fifteen minute Radio segment produced for WBAI
99.5 FM Friday Morning Wake UP Call by The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign.
Despierta Boricua airs at 6:45am, but is subject to re-scheduling depending
on the Station�s needs.

Despierta Boricua is dedicated to providing the New York City listening
audience with the latest news and updates on Puerto Rican politics and
culture from U.S. based Puerto Rican communities and the island of Puerto
Rico.

This month�s Despierta Boricuas are dedicated to the contributions of Puerto
Rican Women in arts, politics, history and culture.

This week�s segment features an interview with several sisters from Yaya.  
Yaya is a women's collective dedicated to preserving and promoting the rich, 
cultural legacies and Africa-based musical traditions of Puerto Rico and the 
Dominican Republic. Founded in 2002, Yaya honors the vibrant musical 
heritage represented in Puerto Rican bomba and Dominican salve traditions, 
through live performance, workshops, and female-led, creative ciphers. 
Recognizing the contributions of women in preserving and transmitting these 
traditions, Yaya honors the yayas (Creole/Kongo origin), or mothers, who 
have helped shape our histories, traditions and legacies of resistance.

http://www.wbai.org

_______________________________________________________________________________


�WHILE THER EXISTS CHALLENGES, THERE IS LIFE, AND AS A CONSEQUENCE WE CAN BE
CREATIVE EVEN IN THE URNS OF HELL!!�--Oscar Lopez Rivera, Puerto Rican
Political Prisoner

Saturday April 2nd, 2005 from 11am-3pm
John Jay College for Criminal Justice
445 West 59th St.
(Btwn. 9th-10th Avenues)
Lecture Hall 1311-N

Registration fee: $5-$10 (no one will be turned away)

Attention all Activists, Artists, Youth, Students, Community Members and
People who believe in Freedom and Justice!! The time is now to free the
Puerto Rican Political Prisoners!!

April 2005 marks the 25th anniversary of the incarceration of the Puerto
Rican Political Prisoners!! It is now time to reorganize our campaign and
bring in new energy into this work; WE NEED YOU!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign and the Puerto Rican/Latin American Studies
Department of John Jay College of Criminal Justice invite you to attend a
special Teach in for Action for Puerto Rico and the Puerto Rican Political
Prisoners!!

Come to the Teach In for Action and hear about how you can help the campaign
to free the Puerto Rican Political Prisoners AND get an update on what is
happening in the Puerto Rican Independence Movement!!


TEACH IN FOR ACTION KEYNOTE ADDRESS:
Rev. Luis Barrios, Puerto Rican/Latin American Studies Department of John
Jay College of Criminal Justice

WORKSHOPS FOR THE TEACH INFOR ACTION:
Culture as a Weapon for Freedom and Change!!
Youth Caucus-Young People UNITE!!
Making Freedom happen; Working to Build a Movement to free the Puerto Rican
Political Prisoners!!

And many other performed to be announced�

Jericho Movement Spring Fling!
Dance Party in Solidarity with All Political Prisoners!
Saturday, April 2, 2005
8 p.m. until . . .

Local 169 UNITE Union Hall
33 West 14th Street, Manhattan
(between 5th & 6th Aves.)

Dance to the tunes of DJ Carlito
and his all-Latino mix: Salsa � Mambo � Merengue � Reggaeton plus Hiphop,
Jazz, Motown, & more!

OPEN MIKE: Spoken Word � HipHop � Comedy

SILENT AUCTION OF ORIGINAL WORK OF ART BY WARD CHURCHILL!!

ONLY $10! Come and bring a friend! Food & Drink will be served!
ALL PROCEEDS WILL BENEFIT THE POLITICAL PRISONERS!
For more information, call NYC Jericho at 718-220-6004 �
nycjericho@... � http://jerichony.org

_______________________________________________________________________________

SUPPORT DYLCIA PAGAN; SHE NEEDS OUR HELP!!

Former Puerto Rican Political Prisoner Dylcia Pagan needs our support!! She
was ill for several months, is currently unemployed, is in the process of
moving from one town to another in Puerto Rico and needs our financial
support!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is calling on our allies and supporters to
help our sister Dylcia by sending her a donation; whatever you can send will
be appreciated!!

Please send donations (checks or money orders made out to Dylcia Pagan) to:

Dylcia Pagan
752 Calle Evelino Vicente #3b
San Juan, PR 00909

Who is Dylcia Pag�n???

Dylcia Pag�n is one of the 11 Puerto Rican former political prisoners
granted clemency by President Clinton in September 1999. She immediately
returned to Puerto Rico, where she and her compa�eros/as were met with a
huge welcome celebration.

The background description below is adapted from Can't Jail the Spirit
(March 1998).

Dylcia Pag�n was born in "El Barrio" in New York City on October 15, 1946.
She attended Brooklyn College were she majored in Cinematography and
Sociology, participated in the struggle for students' rights and founded the
Puerto Rican Students Union. She taught social studies in the New York City
school system, worked for ABC, NBC, and CBS and also for the daily newspaper
El Tiempo.

Dylcia was captured April 4, 1980 along with other comrades, for
participating in the underground wing of the Puerto Rican independence
movement. She is serving a 55-year sentence on charges of seditious
conspiracy, among others. She completed an 8-year state sentence. After
years of separation, she has been reunited with her son Guillermo.

Dylcia's patriotism has manifested itself in many artistic forms which
include painting, ceramics, poetry and her writings. She has participated in
the production of a video about her life and lives of her compa�eros in the
struggle. While in prison, she helped direct a documentary about the Puerto
Rican Women Prisoners of War.

Her biography has been published in Puerto Rican Women: A History of
Oppression and Resistance. Dylcia's poetry has appeared in Have You Seen La
Nueva Mujer Puertorrique�a? Part of Dylcia's life story was also included in
a book by the anthropologist, John Langston Gwaltney entitled, The
Dissenters: Voices from Contemporary America.

Throughout her capture, trial and incarceration she has maintained her
position as an anti-colonial prisoner of war (POW) resisting the illegal
U.S. occupation of her homeland.

Dylcia Pagan

Who is Dylcia Pag�n???

Dylcia Pag�n is one of the 11 Puerto Rican former political prisoners
granted clemency by President Clinton in September 1999. She immediately
returned to Puerto Rico, where she and her compa�eros/as were met with a
huge welcome celebration.

The background description below is adapted from Can't Jail the Spirit
(March 1998).

Dylcia Pag�n was born in "El Barrio" in New York City on October 15, 1946.
She attended Brooklyn College were she majored in Cinematography and
Sociology, participated in the struggle for students' rights and founded the
Puerto Rican Students Union. She taught social studies in the New York City
school system, worked for ABC, NBC, and CBS and also for the daily newspaper
El Tiempo.

Dylcia was captured April 4, 1980 along with other comrades, for
participating in the underground wing of the Puerto Rican independence
movement. She is serving a 55-year sentence on charges of seditious
conspiracy, among others. She completed an 8-year state sentence. After
years of separation, she has been reunited with her son Guillermo.

Dylcia's patriotism has manifested itself in many artistic forms which
include painting, ceramics, poetry and her writings. She has participated in
the production of a video about her life and lives of her compa�eros in the
struggle. While in prison, she helped direct a documentary about the Puerto
Rican Women Prisoners of War.

Her biography has been published in Puerto Rican Women: A History of
Oppression and Resistance. Dylcia's poetry has appeared in Have You Seen La
Nueva Mujer Puertorrique�a? Part of Dylcia's life story was also included in
a book by the anthropologist, John Langston Gwaltney entitled, The
Dissenters: Voices from Contemporary America.

Throughout her capture, trial and incarceration she has maintained her
position as an anti-colonial prisoner of war (POW) resisting the illegal
U.S. occupation of her homeland.

Who is Dylcia Pag�n???

Dylcia Pag�n is one of the 11 Puerto Rican former political prisoners
granted clemency by President Clinton in September 1999. She immediately
returned to Puerto Rico, where she and her compa�eros/as were met with a
huge welcome celebration.

The background description below is adapted from Can't Jail the Spirit
(March 1998).

Dylcia Pag�n was born in "El Barrio" in New York City on October 15, 1946.
She attended Brooklyn College were she majored in Cinematography and
Sociology, participated in the struggle for students' rights and founded the
Puerto Rican Students Union. She taught social studies in the New York City
school system, worked for ABC, NBC, and CBS and also for the daily newspaper
El Tiempo.

Dylcia was captured April 4, 1980 along with other comrades, for
participating in the underground wing of the Puerto Rican independence
movement. She is serving a 55-year sentence on charges of seditious
conspiracy, among others. She completed an 8-year state sentence. After
years of separation, she has been reunited with her son Guillermo.

include painting, ceramics, poetry and her writings. She has participated in
the production of a video about her life and lives of her compa�eros in the
struggle. While in prison, she helped direct a documentary about the Puerto
Rican Women Prisoners of War.

Her biography has been published in Puerto Rican Women: A History of
Oppression and Resistance. Dylcia's poetry has appeared in Have You Seen La
Nueva Mujer Puertorrique�a? Part of Dylcia's life story was also included in
a book by the anthropologist, John Langston Gwaltney entitled, The
Dissenters: Voices from Contemporary America.

Throughout her capture, trial and incarceration she has maintained her
position as an anti-colonial prisoner of war (POW) resisting the illegal
U.S. occupation of her homeland.

521 West 126th Street, Manhattan, Between Broadway and Amsterdam

Campaign, Latin@s for Mumia, Fuerzas de la Revolucin Dominicana, San Romero 
de las Amricas, Casa de las Amricas, Vieques Support Campaign, 2005 For

Post ID:3624
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-03-30 11:30:01
Subject:Despierta Boricua/April Events
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Mnahattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

El Coqui Libre March Newsletter can be downloaded at:
http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclMarch2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

Despierta Boricua is a weekly fifteen minute Radio segment produced for WBAI
99.5 FM Friday Morning Wake UP Call by The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign.
Despierta Boricua airs at 6:45am, but is subject to re-scheduling depending
on the Station�s needs.

Despierta Boricua is dedicated to providing the New York City listening
audience with the latest news and updates on Puerto Rican politics and
culture from U.S. based Puerto Rican communities and the island of Puerto
Rico.

This week�s segment features an interview with  Frank Velgara, one of the 
coordinators of the ProLibertad Freedom Campaign; who will be talking about 
the significance of the 25th anniversary of the Puerto Rican Political 
Prisoner incarceration and will update us on the work to free them.

Tune in every week to Despierta Boricua, whether you receive a reminder or
not, 6:45am WBAI 99.5fm or via web stream, for those of you outside of NYC,
http://www.wbai.org

______________________________________________________________________________________


JOIN FISH VARGAS, RAFAEL LANDRON, MARIPOSA AND BROADCAST LIVE AS THEY HELP 
US BUILD THE NEW MOVMENT TO FREE THE PUERTO RICAN POLITICAL PRISONERS!!

�WHILE THER EXISTS CHALLENGES, THERE IS LIFE, AND AS A CONSEQUENCE WE CAN BE
CREATIVE EVEN IN THE URNS OF HELL!!�--Oscar Lopez Rivera, Puerto Rican 
Political Prisoner

Saturday April 2nd, 2005 from 11am-3pm
John Jay College for Criminal Justice
445 West 59th St.
(Btwn. 9th-10th Avenues)

Political Prisoners!!

CULTURAL PERFORMANCES:
BROADCAST LIVE
RAFALE LANDRON
FISH VARGAS

For more information please contact ProLibertad@...
______________________________________________________________________________

Jericho Movement Spring Fling!
Dance Party in Solidarity with All Political Prisoners!
Saturday, April 2, 2005
8 p.m. until . . .

Local 169 UNITE Union Hall
33 West 14th Street, Manhattan
(between 5th & 6th Aves.)

Dance to the tunes of DJ Carlito
and his all-Latino mix: Salsa � Mambo � Merengue � Reggaeton plus Hiphop,
Jazz, Motown, & more!

OPEN MIKE: Spoken Word � HipHop � Comedy

SILENT AUCTION OF ORIGINAL WORK OF ART BY WARD CHURCHILL!!

ONLY $10! Come and bring a friend! Food & Drink will be served!
ALL PROCEEDS WILL BENEFIT THE POLITICAL PRISONERS!
For more information, call NYC Jericho at 718-220-6004 �
nycjericho@... � http://jerichony.org

_______________________________________________________________________________

SUPPORT DYLCIA PAGAN; SHE NEEDS OUR HELP!!

Former Puerto Rican Political Prisoner Dylcia Pagan needs our support!! She
was ill for several months, is currently unemployed, is in the process of
moving from one town to another in Puerto Rico and needs our financial
support!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is calling on our allies and supporters to
help our sister Dylcia by sending her a donation; whatever you can send will
be appreciated!!

Please send donations (checks or money orders made out to Dylcia Pagan) to:

Dylcia Pagan
752 Calle Avelino Vicente #3b
San Juan, PR 00909

Who is Dylcia Pag�n???

Dylcia Pag�n is one of the 11 Puerto Rican former political prisoners
granted clemency by President Clinton in September 1999. She immediately
returned to Puerto Rico, where she and her compa�eros/as were met with a
huge welcome celebration.

The background description below is adapted from Can't Jail the Spirit
(March 1998).

Dylcia Pag�n was born in "El Barrio" in New York City on October 15, 1946.
She attended Brooklyn College were she majored in Cinematography and
Sociology, participated in the struggle for students' rights and founded the
Puerto Rican Students Union. She taught social studies in the New York City
school system, worked for ABC, NBC, and CBS and also for the daily newspaper
El Tiempo.

Dylcia was captured April 4, 1980 along with other comrades, for
participating in the underground wing of the Puerto Rican independence
movement. She is serving a 55-year sentence on charges of seditious
conspiracy, among others. She completed an 8-year state sentence. After
years of separation, she has been reunited with her son Guillermo.

Dylcia's patriotism has manifested itself in many artistic forms which
include painting, ceramics, poetry and her writings. She has participated in
the production of a video about her life and lives of her compa�eros in the
struggle. While in prison, she helped direct a documentary about the Puerto
Rican Women Prisoners of War.

Her biography has been published in Puerto Rican Women: A History of
Oppression and Resistance. Dylcia's poetry has appeared in Have You Seen La
Nueva Mujer Puertorrique�a? Part of Dylcia's life story was also included in
a book by the anthropologist, John Langston Gwaltney entitled, The
Dissenters: Voices from Contemporary America.

Throughout her capture, trial and incarceration she has maintained her
position as an anti-colonial prisoner of war (POW) resisting the illegal
U.S. occupation of her homeland.

Despierta Boricua is a weekly fifteen minute Radio segment produced for WBAI
99.5 FM Friday Morning Wake UP Call by The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign.
Despierta Boricua airs at 6:45am, but is subject to re-scheduling depending
on the Station�s needs.

Despierta Boricua is dedicated to providing the New York City listening
audience with the latest news and updates on Puerto Rican politics and
culture from U.S. based Puerto Rican communities and the island of Puerto
Rico.

This week's segment features an interview with Frank Velgara of ProLibertad
who will be talking about the 25th anniversary of the arrests of the Puerto
Rican Political Prisoners and the work in ProLibertad to free them!!

Tune in every week to Despierta Boricua, whether you receive a reminder or
not, 6:45am WBAI 99.5fm or via web stream, for those of you outside of NYC,
http://www.wbai.org
______________________________________________________________________________

521 West 126th Street, Manhattan, Between Broadway and Amsterdam

Campaign, Latin@s for Mumia, Fuerzas de la Revoluci�n Dominicana, San Romero
de las Am�ricas, Casa de las Am�ricas, Vieques Support Campaign, 2005 For
The Cuban 5, Jericho Movement. List In Formation.

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is urging all our friends and allies to 
support this event to free the Cuban Five Political prisoners!!  The time is 
now to bring all of our prisoners home!!

FREE THE PUERTO RICAN POLITICAL PRISONERS
FREE THE CUBAN FIVE!!
FREE ALL POLITICAL PRISONERS!!
______________________________________________________________________________

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5: 2005 for the Cuban 5 
Presents:

MISSION AGAINST TERROR!!

DID YOU MISS IT THE FIRST TIME IT WAS IN NYC?

Join The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5: 2005 for the Cuban 5 
and Latino/as at Riverside/The Riverside Church for our premiere of MISSION 
AGAINST TERROR in Harlem!!

MISSION AGAINST TERROR, a documentary written and directed by Bernie Dwyer 
and Roberto Ruiz Rebo was made in Cuba and details the case of the Cuban 5. 
The movie answers the question why are people who fight terrorism imprisoned 
in the U.S. while known terrorists proven to carry out bombings and attacks 
against the Cuban island are allowed to walk the streets of Miami freely.

After the film, the guest panelists below will comment and take questions 
from the audience.

*Representative, Cuban Mission to the United Nations

*Rafael Rodr�guez Cruz, Lawyer of Ren� Gonz�lez

*Bonnie Massey, Venceremos Brigade

*Benjamin Ramos, Popular Education Project
To Free the Cuban 5

Friday June 3rd, 2005 at 6:30pm at
Riverside Church  91 Claremont Ave.
Btwn. 120-122 Streets
Train 1/9 to 116 or 125th St.

Donation: $5-10 (no one will be turned away)

For more info. Email: freethecuban5@... or
call our Free the Cuban Five Hotline 718-601-4751
_____________________________________________________________________________

��MISION EN CONTRA DEL TERRORISMO!!

NO LA PUDO VER CUANDO SE PRESENTO EN NUEVA YORK?

El Proyecto de Educaci�n Popular: 2005 Por Los 5 Cubanos y Latino/as en 
Riverside/Iglesia de Riverside les invita a la presentaci�n de la pel�cula 
Misi�n En Contra Del Terrorismo en Harlem.

MISION EN CONTRA DEL TERRORISMO, un documental de Bernie Dwyer y Roberto 
Ruiz Rebo sobre el caso de los 5 cubanos fue hecho en Cuba. �Porque estan 
presos los que luchan en contra del terrorismo, mientras que conocidos 
terroristas que han puesto bombas y que han hecho otros ataques en contra de 
Cuba se les permite andar libre en las calles de Miami?

Despues de la pel�cula los panelistas invitados haran comentarios y 
contestar�n preguntas del p�blico.

*Representante, Misi�n de Cuba Ante Las Naciones Unidas

*Rafael Rodr�guez Cruz, Abogado de Ren� Gonz�lez

*Bonnie Massey, La Brigada Venceremos

*Benjamin Ramos, Proyecto de Educaci�n Popular
2005 Por Los 5

Viernes, 3 de junio, 2005�6:30 p.m.
Iglesia Riverside�91 Avenida Claremont
Entre: Calles 120 y 122
Trenes: 1 y 9 a Calle 116 o Calle 125

Donaci�n: $5-$10 (no se le negar� entrada a nadie)

_______________________________________________________________________________

Despierta Boricua is a weekly fifteen minute Radio segment produced for WBAI
99.5 FM Friday Morning Wake UP Call by The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign.
Despierta Boricua airs at 6:45am, but is subject to re-scheduling depending
on the Station�s needs.

Despierta Boricua is dedicated to providing the New York City listening
audience with the latest news and updates on Puerto Rican politics and
culture from U.S. based Puerto Rican communities and the island of Puerto
Rico.

April 29th, 2005: This week's segment features an interview with Hugo 
Delgado, of La Union de Juventud Socialista/Moviemiento Socialista de 
Trabajadores, who will be talking about the student
strike taking place at the University of Puerto Rico-Rio Piedras against 
tutition hikes and student fee
increases.

Tune in every week to Despierta Boricua, whether you receive a reminder or
not, 6:45am WBAI 99.5fm or via web stream, for those of you outside of NYC,
http://www.wbai.org

against the Cuban island are allowed to walk the streets of Miami freely.

from the audience.

call our Free the Cuban Five Hotline 718-601-4751

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5: 2005 for the Cuban 5
_______________________________________________________________________________

MISSION AGAINST TERROR!!

DID YOU MISS IT THE FIRST TIME IT WAS IN NYC?

Join The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5: 2005 for the Cuban 5 
and Latino/as at Riverside/The Riverside Church for our premiere of MISSION 
AGAINST TERROR in Harlem!!

MISSION AGAINST TERROR, a documentary written and directed by Bernie Dwyer 
and Roberto Ruiz Rebo was made in Cuba and details the case of the Cuban 5. 
The movie answers the question why are people who fight terrorism imprisoned 
in the U.S. while known terrorists proven to carry out bombings and attacks 
against the Cuban island are allowed to walk the streets of Miami freely.

After the film, the guest panelists below will comment and take questions 
from the audience.

*Representative, Cuban Mission to the United Nations

*Rafael Rodr�guez Cruz, Lawyer of Ren� Gonz�lez

*Bonnie Massey, Venceremos Brigade

*Benjamin Ramos, Popular Education Project To Free the Cuban 5

Friday June 3rd, 2005 at 6:30pm at
Riverside Church  91 Claremont Ave.
Btwn. 120-122 Streets
Train 1/9 to 116 or 125th St.

Donation: $5-10 (no one will be turned away)

For more info. Email: freethecuban5@... or
call our Free the Cuban Five Hotline 718-601-4751
_____________________________________________________________________________

El Coqui Libre is the ProLibertad Freedom Campaign Newsletter; we ask all 
our allies and supporters to download a copy of the newsletter and forward 
the link throughout your lists.

Download the May 2005 edition of the ProLibertad Newsletter El Coqui Libre:
http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclMay2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

OSCAR LOPEZ RIVERA HAS BEEN MOVED!!

On April 12th, Puerto Rican Political Prisoner Oscar Lopez Rivera was moved 
from the Federal Correctional Institution in in Terre Haute, Indiana to the 
U.S. Penitentiary in Terre Haute.

According to a letter ProLibertad received from Oscar Lopez Rivera, the 
Penitentiary is larger than the Federal Correctional Institution;  the 
Penitentiary is also behind walls.

In his last prison, Oscar could see the trees, had access to the birds, and 
to a nice running track.  In the new prison, all the units are separated 
from each other; in order to go from unit to another he has to go outside 
and walk from building to building.

According to Oscar, on his first day there, he had to walk in the rain to 
get to the commissary to eat; he arrived soaking wet.  Oscar also commented 
that the new prison is like a military camp because they have to wear a 
Khaki uniform and boots all of the time.

Oscar has also commented that there is not enough space provided for artists 
to work. According to Oscar, there is plenty of space, but that the artists 
are relegated to a small area, where they are, �on top of each other.�  He 
is going to be sending us information soon about how we can support him and 
the other artists.

If you want to write to Oscar, please send him a letter or postcard to:

Oscar Lopez Rivera
#87651-024
U.S. Penitentiary
P.O. Box 12015
Terre Haute, IN 47801

OSCAR LOPEZ RIVERA HAS BEEN MOVED!!

On April 12th, Puerto Rican Political Prisoner Oscar Lopez Rivera was moved 
from the Federal Correctional Institution in in Terre Haute, Indiana to the 
U.S. Penitentiary in Terre Haute.

According to a letter ProLibertad received from Oscar Lopez Rivera, the 
Penitentiary is larger than the Federal Correctional Institution;  the 
Penitentiary is also behind walls.

In his last prison, Oscar could see the trees, had access to the birds, and 
to a nice running track.  In the new prison, all the units are separated 
from each other; in order to go from unit to another he has to go outside 
and walk from building to building.

According to Oscar, on his first day there, he had to walk in the rain to 
get to the commissary to eat; he arrived soaking wet.  Oscar also commented 
that the new prison is like a military camp because they have to wear a 
Khaki uniform and boots all of the time.

Oscar has also commented that there is not enough space provided for artists 
to work. According to Oscar, there is plenty of space, but that the artists 
are relegated to a small area, where they are, �on top of each other.�  He 
is going to be sending us information soon about how we can support him and 
the other artists.

If you want to write to Oscar, please send him a letter or postcard to:

Oscar Lopez Rivera
#87651-024
U.S. Penitentiary
P.O. Box 12015
Terre Haute, IN 47801

_______________________________________________________________________________

Despierta Boricua is a weekly fifteen-minute Radio segment produced for WBAI
99.5 FM Friday Morning Wake UP Call by The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign.
Despierta Boricua airs at 6:45am, but is subject to re-scheduling depending
on the Station�s needs.

Despierta Boricua is dedicated to providing the New York City listening
audience with the latest news and updates on Puerto Rican politics and
culture from U.S. based Puerto Rican communities and the island of Puerto
Rico.

This week�s segment (Friday May 6) is dedicated to the students at the
University of Puerto Rico-Rio Piedras Who were engaged in a student strike
for several weeks, which ended this weekend with a Victory.  The segment
will feature an interview with Hugo Delgado, a student activist/organizer
member of La Union de Juventud Socialista, and member of the Puerto
Rican Frente Socialista (Socialist Front).

Tune in every week to Despierta Boricua, whether you receive a reminder or
not, 6:45am WBAI 99.5fm or via web stream, for those of you outside of NYC,
http://www.wbai.org
_______________________________________________________________________________

SUPPORT THE VIEQUES POLITICAL PRISONERS!!

The Vieques Political Prisoners are activists, community members and 
residents of Vieques/mainland Puerto Rico that were targeted by the FBI for 
their activities in Vieques on May 1st, 2003. The arrests of ten of the 
initial 12 Vieques activists in June 2003 was another attempt by the FBI and 
U.S. government to repress and punish Vieques activists for participating in 
the struggle to remove the U.S. Navy from Vieques.

It was also an attempt to discourage activists from continuing the struggle 
to achieve the four demands of the People of Vieques 
(Decontamination-Devolution-Development-Demilitarization)!!

When the Vieques Political Prisoners were incarcerated, many of their 
families lost their sole source of income.  Also, as prisoners, the Vieques 
Political Prisoners need commissary donations in order to buy toiletries, 
paper goods and extra food.

In order to deal with these needs, an account was established in Puerto Rico 
by Todo Puerto Rico con Vieques (All of Puerto Rico with Vieques) to collect 
money for the prisoners and their families.

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is urging all our allies and supporters to 
send donations to the Vieques Political Prisoners and their families.  Todo 
Puerto Rico con Vieques will disseminate the money to the prisoners and 
their families:

Comit� de�Apoyo a los Acusados por�Vieques el Primero de Mayo�
Apartado 191792��
San Juan, Puerto Rico� 00919-1792�
Direct Deposit Banco Popular� �#�116-26767-4.�

Despierta Boricua is a weekly fifteen-minute Radio segment produced for WBAI
99.5 FM Friday Morning Wake UP Call by The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign.
Despierta Boricua airs at 6:45am, but is subject to re-scheduling depending
on the Station�s needs.

Despierta Boricua is dedicated to providing the New York City listening
audience with the latest news and updates on Puerto Rican politics and
culture from U.S. based Puerto Rican communities and the island of Puerto
Rico.

This week�s segment (Friday May 6) is dedicated to the students at the
University of Puerto Rico-Rio Piedras Who were engaged in a student strike
for several weeks, which ended this weekend with a Victory.  The segment
will feature an interview with Hugo Delgado, a student activist/organizer

SUPPORT THE VIEQUES POLITICAL PRISONERS!!

The Vieques Political Prisoners are activists, community members and 
residents of Vieques/mainland Puerto Rico that were targeted by the FBI for 
their activities in Vieques on May 1st, 2003. The arrests of ten of the 
initial 12 Vieques activists in June 2003 was another attempt by the FBI and 
U.S. government to repress and punish Vieques activists for participating in 
the struggle to remove the U.S. Navy from Vieques.

It was also an attempt to discourage activists from continuing the struggle 
to achieve the four demands of the People of Vieques 
(Decontamination-Devolution-Development-Demilitarization)!!

When the Vieques Political Prisoners were incarcerated, many of their 
families lost their sole source of income.  Also, as prisoners, the Vieques 
Political Prisoners need commissary donations in order to buy toiletries, 
paper goods and extra food.

In order to deal with these needs, an account was established in Puerto Rico 
by Todo Puerto Rico con Vieques (All of Puerto Rico with Vieques) to collect 
money for the prisoners and their families.

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is urging all our allies and supporters to 
send donations to the Vieques Political Prisoners and their families.  Todo 
Puerto Rico con Vieques will disseminate the money to the prisoners and 
their families:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is calling on all our allies and supporters 
to support the Film screening of Mission Against Terror by the Popular 
Education Project to Free the Cuban Five; which is a people of color led 
campaign made up of individuals and organizations that are working to 
educate people of color communities and garner support for the freedom of 
the Cuban Five.
______________________________________________________________________________

Presents

MISSION AGAINST TERROR, a documentary written and directed by Bernie Dwyer
and Roberto Ruiz Rebo was made in Cuba and details the case of the Cuban 5.

RHYMES FOR TREASON
Welfare Poets Celebrate New Album
This Thursday MAY 12TH @ REMY LOUNGE (NYC)
104 Greenwich Street, Doors Open 9pm
$10 Admission

HOSTED BY: RUSSELL SHOATZ III and Flaco Navaja
PERFORMANCES BY: M � 1 of Dead Prez, Don Divino, Alkebulan, Yaya
and other Special Invited Guests

Take the 4 or 5 train to Wall Street
Or Take the 1 or 9, N or R train to Rector Street
_______________________________________________________________________________

FREE THE MOVE 9!! SATURDAY MAY 14TH IN PHILADELPHIA!!

[ADVANCE RESERVATION REQUIRED]    15 passenger van & possibly another
car...leaving at 8 a.m. sharp and most probably leaving Philly at 4 or
4:30 p.m., arriving back in NYC by 7 p.m. at the latest.   $15 
roundtrip....will drop us off at 63rd & Osage and pick us up at the closing 
rally at Malcolm X Park (52nd & Pine). Please make sure that folk call the 
phone numbers ahead of time to confirm, so we can keep a head count.

Join the Latin@s por Mumia contingent
to Philadelphia on this important date!
For more info:

call 718-365-4407 or 718-601-475

8 a.m. from Amsterdam Ave. & 180 Street
Call first to reserve your seat!
Otherwise it is not guaranteed!
Only $15 roundtrip!

MAY 14, 2005
Demonstrate on the 20th Anniversary of the May 13, 1985 Massacre of MOVE!!
Free the MOVE 9!!

Join the Latin@s por Mumia contingent to Philadelphia on this important 
date!

For more info:
call 718-365-4407 or 718-601-4751
8 a.m from Amsterdam Ave. & 180 St.
Call first to reserve your seat! Otherwise it is not guaranteed!

On May 13th, 1985, the U.S. government in complicity with state and
city officials, dropped a bomb on the MOVE Organization in Philadelphia. 6
adults, 5 children and many animals were murdered by the bomb-induced
fire as well as the police bullets they faced trying to escape the blaze.

Many people do not know that the government tried desperately to
silence MOVE in large part due to their defiant, consistent protest on 
behalf
of the incarcerated MOVE 9. The government was threatened by the
possibility of having to admit their wrongdoing in the conviction of the 
MOVE 9. To
eliminate this threat the government knowingly conspired to kill MOVE.

This government has provided constant examples of their willingess to
beat, torture, jail, bomb, or kill anybody that stands for truth,
righteousness, equality, and justice? principles this government claims to 
represent
but has never represented. All of us fighting for what�s right are a threat
and a target. Our only safety is to fight back! In recognition of the MOVE
soldiers who gave their lives, and in self- protection, we must take a
stand and never let them forget! In honor of those killed May 13th we
MUST fight to FREE the MOVE 9!

Join us Saturday, May 14th, 2005 as we demand acknowledgement of this
atrocity, and demand the release of the MOVE 9!!! We will be meeting at
10:30 am on 63rd and Osage Ave. in West Philadelphia (the original site
of the bombing) for a rally and march throughout West Philadephia!

"When a cause comes along and you know in your bones that it is just,
yet refuse to defend it--at that moment you begin to die. And I have never
seen so many corpses walking around talking about justice." --Mumia
Abu-Jamal

Free Mumia and All Political Prisoners!
Latin@s por Mumia ? www.freemumia.net  info@...
NYC Jericho Movement
nycjericho@...   http://www.jerichony.org

Post ID:3645
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-05-09 10:00:45
Subject:ProLibertad Activity Digest
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
______________________________________________________________________________

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is calling on all our allies and supporters
to support the Film screening of Mission Against Terror by the Popular
Education Project to Free the Cuban Five; which is a people of color led
campaign made up of individuals and organizations that are working to
educate people of color communities and garner support for the freedom of
the Cuban Five.
______________________________________________________________________________

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5: 2005 for the Cuban 5 
Presents

MISSION AGAINST TERROR!!

DID YOU MISS IT THE FIRST TIME IT WAS IN NYC?

Join The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5: 2005 for the Cuban 5
and Latino/as at Riverside/The Riverside Church for our premiere of MISSION
AGAINST TERROR in Harlem!!

MISSION AGAINST TERROR, a documentary written and directed by Bernie Dwyer
and Roberto Ruiz Rebo was made in Cuba and details the case of the Cuban 5.
The movie answers the question why are people who fight terrorism imprisoned
in the U.S. while known terrorists proven to carry out bombings and attacks
against the Cuban island are allowed to walk the streets of Miami freely.

After the film, the guest panelists below will comment and take questions
from the audience.

*Representative, Cuban Mission to the United Nations

*Rafael Rodr�guez Cruz, Attorney and Board member of the Rosenberg Fund for 
Children

*Bonnie Massey, Venceremos Brigade

*Benjamin Ramos, Popular Education Project To Free the Cuban 5

Friday June 3rd, 2005 at 6:30pm at
Riverside Church  91 Claremont Ave.
Btwn. 120-122 Streets
Train 1/9 to 116 or 125th St.

Donation: $5-10 (no one will be turned away)

For more info. Email: freethecuban5@... or call our Free the Cuban 
Five Hotline 718-601-4751
_______________________________________________________________________________

RHYMES FOR TREASON
Welfare Poets Celebrate New Album
This Thursday MAY 12TH @ REMY LOUNGE (NYC)
104 Greenwich Street, Doors Open 9pm
$10 Admission

HOSTED BY: RUSSELL SHOATZ III and Flaco Navaja
PERFORMANCES BY: M � 1 of Dead Prez, Don Divino, Alkebulan, Yaya
and other Special Invited Guests

Take the 4 or 5 train to Wall Street
Or Take the 1 or 9, N or R train to Rector Street
_______________________________________________________________________________

FREE THE MOVE 9!! SATURDAY MAY 14TH IN PHILADELPHIA!!

[ADVANCE RESERVATION REQUIRED]    15 passenger van & possibly another
car...leaving at 8 a.m. sharp and most probably leaving Philly at 4 or
4:30 p.m., arriving back in NYC by 7 p.m. at the latest.   $15 
roundtrip....will drop us off at 63rd & Osage and pick us up at the closing 
rally at Malcolm X Park (52nd & Pine). Please make sure that folk call the 
phone numbers ahead of time to confirm, so we can keep a head count.

Join the Latin@s por Mumia contingent
to Philadelphia on this important date!
For more info:

call 718-365-4407 or 718-601-475

8 a.m. from Amsterdam Ave. & 180 Street
Call first to reserve your seat!
Otherwise it is not guaranteed!
Only $15 roundtrip!

MAY 14, 2005
Demonstrate on the 20th Anniversary of the May 13, 1985 Massacre of MOVE!!
Free the MOVE 9!!

Join the Latin@s por Mumia contingent to Philadelphia on this important 
date!

For more info:
call 718-365-4407 or 718-601-4751
8 a.m from Amsterdam Ave. & 180 St.
Call first to reserve your seat! Otherwise it is not guaranteed!

On May 13th, 1985, the U.S. government in complicity with state and
city officials, dropped a bomb on the MOVE Organization in Philadelphia. 6
adults, 5 children and many animals were murdered by the bomb-induced
fire as well as the police bullets they faced trying to escape the blaze.

Many people do not know that the government tried desperately to
silence MOVE in large part due to their defiant, consistent protest on 
behalf
of the incarcerated MOVE 9. The government was threatened by the
possibility of having to admit their wrongdoing in the conviction of the 
MOVE 9. To
eliminate this threat the government knowingly conspired to kill MOVE.

This government has provided constant examples of their willingess to
beat, torture, jail, bomb, or kill anybody that stands for truth,
righteousness, equality, and justice? principles this government claims to 
represent
but has never represented. All of us fighting for what�s right are a threat
and a target. Our only safety is to fight back! In recognition of the MOVE
soldiers who gave their lives, and in self- protection, we must take a
stand and never let them forget! In honor of those killed May 13th we
MUST fight to FREE the MOVE 9!

Join us Saturday, May 14th, 2005 as we demand acknowledgement of this
atrocity, and demand the release of the MOVE 9!!! We will be meeting at
10:30 am on 63rd and Osage Ave. in West Philadelphia (the original site
of the bombing) for a rally and march throughout West Philadephia!

"When a cause comes along and you know in your bones that it is just,
yet refuse to defend it--at that moment you begin to die. And I have never
seen so many corpses walking around talking about justice." --Mumia
Abu-Jamal

Free Mumia and All Political Prisoners!
Latin@s por Mumia ? www.freemumia.net  info@...
NYC Jericho Movement
nycjericho@...   http://www.jerichony.org

Post ID:3646
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-05-10 12:15:27
Subject:Despierta Boricua
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

Download a copy of El Coqui Libre, ProLibertad�s monthly newsletter; our May 
edition can be found at: http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclMay2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

Despierta Boricua is a weekly fifteen-minute Radio segment produced for WBAI
99.5 FM Friday Morning Wake UP Call by The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign.
Despierta Boricua airs at 6:45am, but is subject to re-scheduling depending
on the Station�s needs.

Despierta Boricua is dedicated to providing the New York City listening
audience with the latest news and updates on Puerto Rican politics and
culture from U.S. based Puerto Rican communities and the island of Puerto
Rico.

This week�s segment (Friday May 13) features an interview with Lillian 
Jimenez of the Latino Educational Media Center and the upcoming fund-raiser 
to defray completion expenses of the landmark documentary produced by the 
Latino Educational Media Center:"Antonia Pantoja: Abriendo Camino" (Forging 
A Path). The first documentary to dramatically capture the Puerto Rican 
community's struggle for educational and language rights. Featuring 
visionary leader Dr. Antonia Pantoja as its guide, the documentary 
chronicles the contributions made by the Puerto Rican community to community 
control of public schools; the creation of Aspira and Puerto Rican Studies, 
and bilingual education in New York City and the nation. Mistress of 
Ceremony: Lorraine Cortes Vazquez, Vice President, Cablevision Thursday, May 
19, 2005 Julia de Burgos Cultural Center 1680 Lexington Avenue (corner of 
106th Street) New York, NY First floor Gallery 7 PM to 9 PM Tickets: $75.00 
Please RSVP to (718) 401-9020 Lemctr@... Latino Educational Media Center 
329 East 149th Street, Suite 404 Bronx, NY 10451 (718) 401-9020 
Lemctr@...

Tune in every week to Despierta Boricua, whether you receive a reminder or
not, 6:45am WBAI 99.5fm or via web stream, for those of you outside of NYC,
http://www.wbai.org





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is calling on all our allies and supporters
to support the Film screening of Mission Against Terror by the Popular
Education Project to Free the Cuban Five; which is a people of color led
campaign made up of individuals and organizations that are working to
educate people of color communities and garner support for the freedom of
the Cuban Five.

Check out the Popular Education  Project Website at: 
http://www.freethecuban5.com
______________________________________________________________________________

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5: 2005 for the Cuban 5
Presents

MISSION AGAINST TERROR!!

DID YOU MISS IT THE FIRST TIME IT WAS IN NYC?

Join The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5: 2005 for the Cuban 5
and Latino/as at Riverside/The Riverside Church for our premiere of MISSION
AGAINST TERROR in Harlem!!

MISSION AGAINST TERROR, a documentary written and directed by Bernie Dwyer
and Roberto Ruiz Rebo was made in Cuba and details the case of the Cuban 5.
The movie answers the question why are people who fight terrorism imprisoned
in the U.S. while known terrorists proven to carry out bombings and attacks
against the Cuban island are allowed to walk the streets of Miami freely.

After the film, the guest panelists below will comment and take questions
from the audience.

*Representative, Cuban Mission to the United Nations

*Rafael Rodr�guez Cruz, Attorney and Board Member of the Rosenberg Fund for 
Children

*Bonnie Massey, Venceremos Brigade

*Benjamin Ramos, Popular Education Project To Free the Cuban 5

Friday June 3rd, 2005 at 6:30pm at
Riverside Church  91 Claremont Ave.
Btwn. 120-122 Streets
Train 1/9 to 116 or 125th St.

Donation: $5-10 (no one will be turned away)

Five Hotline 718-601-4751
