Subject:Political Prisoner Support Calendar
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com

Mnahattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

The following is a calendar of Political Prisoner Support events taking 
place from May-June 2005.  The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is calling on 
all our allies to support all these events and forard this calendar out to 
as many people as possible; we need to mobilize en mass for these events!!
_______________________________________________________________________________

TUESDAY MAY 24TH FREE THE HOOD Show for  Black Panther
Russell Maroon Shoatz

"Free the Hood" Benefit/Tour (for prostate Cancer) @
Bar Sputnik 262 Taaffe Pl. Bk NY
doors open @ 8pm
hosted by Russell Shoatz III
Live performances by

M1 of Dead Prez, Bedouin, Divino and members of PA
(the peoples army).

Special invited guests

Plus surprise performance by legendary hip hop artist, dont ask who, just be 
there!

Supported by Sista II Sista and Cop Watch.
Guest speakers from MXGM (Malcolm X grassroots Movement)
FCU (Families Communities United). A Portion of
proceeds to benefit:

ShoFam "Russell Maroon Shoatz's Legal defense fund

Please support this Political prisoner of 30 years
(black liberation army/Black Panther)

$15 in advance, $20 at the door

To Purchace Tickets click on the link below:

www.brownpapertickets.com/event/1615

For donations contact rshoatz@... For more info on Maroon go to 
www.mxg.org
______________________________________________________________________________

BLIPHOP.com presents Free Veronza Benefit Concert

May 26, 2005 � Korova Milkbar
8 p.m.
The Korova Milkbar
200 Ave. A, between 12th & 13th Streets
(take the L to 1st Ave.)

Featuring live music by Bliphop.com and special guests plus mixes by DJ No 
Request!

Help donate to a worthy cause!

For more info about this political prisoner, log on to www.veronza.org!!  
Veronza would love to hear from you.

He can be reached at the following address:
Veronza Bowers, Jr., #35316-136
FCC, Medium C-1,
P.O. Box 1032,
Coleman, FL 33521-1032
veronzab@...

There are no computers in federal prison, so if you would like a response to 
your e-mail, please include your snail mail address
______________________________________________________________________________

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5: 2005 for the Cuban 5
Presents

MISSION AGAINST TERROR!!

DID YOU MISS IT THE FIRST TIME IT WAS IN NYC?

Join The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5: 2005 for the Cuban 5
and Latino/as at Riverside/The Riverside Church for our premiere of MISSION
AGAINST TERROR in Harlem!!

MISSION AGAINST TERROR, a documentary written and directed by Bernie Dwyer
and Roberto Ruiz Rebo was made in Cuba and details the case of the Cuban 5.
The movie answers the question why are people who fight terrorism imprisoned
in the U.S. while known terrorists proven to carry out bombings and attacks
against the Cuban island are allowed to walk the streets of Miami freely.

After the film, the guest panelists below will comment and take questions
from the audience.

*Representative, Cuban Mission to the United Nations

*Rafael Rodr�guez Cruz, Attorney and Board member of the Rosenberg Fund for
Children

*Bonnie Massey, Venceremos Brigade

*Benjamin Ramos, Popular Education Project To Free the Cuban 5

Friday June 3rd, 2005 at 6:30pm at
Riverside Church  91 Claremont Ave.
Btwn. 120-122 Streets
Train 1/9 to 116 or 125th St.

Donation: $5-10 (no one will be turned away)

For more info. Email: freethecuban5@... or call our Free the Cuban
Five Hotline 718-601-4751
______________________________________________________________________________


Open the Cages: A Night of Political Prisoner Support

Saturday, June 11th 7 PM�2 AM
$8-12 donation. sliding scale

No one turned away due to lack of funds! All proceeds benefit the Jeffrey 
Luers Legal Fund
and Jericho NYC DUMBA Art space, 57 Jay Street (between Front and Water 
Streets)

Down under the Manhattan bridge in Brooklyn.

F train to York Street. Exit train, make right, go two blocks down Jay 
Street. DUMBA is on your right side.

Speakers:

Ashanti Alston
Ashanti is a former member of the Black Panther Party and former political 
prisoner (Black Liberation Army) for over 14 years. He was recently the 
Northeast regional coordinator for Critical Resistance, a national radical 
prison abolitionist organization and is now a member of its New York City 
chapter; Estaci�n Libre, an organization that works to strengthen ties 
between people of color in the US with folks in the liberated Zapatista 
territories of Chiapas [Mexico]; and Anarchist People of Color. He sits on 
the board of the Institute of Anarchist Studies and has been an invited 
guest teacher for the last two summers at the Institute of Social Ecology in 
Vermont. Ashanti also authors the zine Anarchist Panther.

Andy Stepanian
Andy is a member of the Animal Defense League of NY. He has previously 
served time for his commitment to the animal rights movement. Currently, he 
is being prosecuted for actions against the vivisection industry, along with 
others known as the Shac 7.
Other former Political Prisoners and representatives from the Jeffrey Luers 
Defense Network and Jericho NYC will speak as well.

Music:
Cipher
A political metal-core band from Long Island that merges radical politics 
with punk/hardcore. Cipher is committed to promoting revolutionary and 
radical tactics and ideals through their work. The band is featured in James 
Spooner's critically acclaimed Afropunk documentary and will release their 
first nationally distributed album, Children of God's Fire Tuesday, June 
14th on Uprising records.

Casey Neill
Brooklyn, NY based songwriter and band leader in the American musical 
tradition. His music fuses modern roots rock with country, punk, and Celtic 
styles.

Plus the Rude Mechanical Orchestra!  Brooklyn's own radical marching band.

Film:
This will be the New York City premiere of the new film
22/8: the Jeffrey Luers Story  There will be info�tables of radical groups, 
childcare,
food and drinks.

Contact: freefreenow@...
www.freefreenow.org/june05nyc.html

For more info. Email: freethecuban5@... or call our Free the Cuban
Five Hotline 718-601-4751
______________________________________________________________________________


Open the Cages: A Night of Political Prisoner Support

Saturday, June 11th 7 PM�2 AM
$8-12 donation. sliding scale

No one turned away due to lack of funds! All proceeds benefit the Jeffrey 
Luers Legal Fund
and Jericho NYC DUMBA Art space, 57 Jay Street (between Front and Water 
Streets)

Down under the Manhattan bridge in Brooklyn.

F train to York Street. Exit train, make right, go two blocks down Jay 
Street. DUMBA is on your right side.

Speakers:

Ashanti Alston
Ashanti is a former member of the Black Panther Party and former political 
prisoner (Black Liberation Army) for over 14 years. He was recently the 
Northeast regional coordinator for Critical Resistance, a national radical 
prison abolitionist organization and is now a member of its New York City 
chapter; Estaci�n Libre, an organization that works to strengthen ties 
between people of color in the US with folks in the liberated Zapatista 
territories of Chiapas [Mexico]; and Anarchist People of Color. He sits on 
the board of the Institute of Anarchist Studies and has been an invited 
guest teacher for the last two summers at the Institute of Social Ecology in 
Vermont. Ashanti also authors the zine Anarchist Panther.

Andy Stepanian
Andy is a member of the Animal Defense League of NY. He has previously 
served time for his commitment to the animal rights movement. Currently, he 
is being prosecuted for actions against the vivisection industry, along with 
others known as the Shac 7.
Other former Political Prisoners and representatives from the Jeffrey Luers 
Defense Network and Jericho NYC will speak as well.

Music:
Cipher
A political metal-core band from Long Island that merges radical politics 
with punk/hardcore. Cipher is committed to promoting revolutionary and 
radical tactics and ideals through their work. The band is featured in James 
Spooner's critically acclaimed Afropunk documentary and will release their 
first nationally distributed album, Children of God's Fire Tuesday, June 
14th on Uprising records.

Casey Neill
Brooklyn, NY based songwriter and band leader in the American musical 
tradition. His music fuses modern roots rock with country, punk, and Celtic 
styles.

Plus the Rude Mechanical Orchestra!  Brooklyn's own radical marching band.

Film:
This will be the New York City premiere of the new film
22/8: the Jeffrey Luers Story  There will be info�tables of radical groups, 
childcare,
food and drinks.

Contact: freefreenow@...
www.freefreenow.org/june05nyc.html

the link throughout your lists.

http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclMay2005.pdf

Puerto Rico: An International Struggle for Liberation
The Vieques Struggle, the Independence movement, the work to free the Puerto
Rican Political Prisoners!!

Monday June 13, 2005 at 6:30pm at Hunter College West Building
8th floor Faculty/Staff Lounge E68th St. and Lexington Avenue  (Take the #6
train to E68th St.)

Donation: $10  (no one will be turned away)

Join the ProLibertad Freedom Campaign for our annual Reception/Forum for the
Puerto Rico Delegation of the United Nations De-Colonization Committee
Hearings!!

Every year a Delegation from Puerto Rico comes to the United Nations to
testify to the U.N. De-Colonization Committee, to make the case for the
liberation of Puerto Rico, Vieques and the release of the Puerto Rican
Political Prisoners and Prisoners of War.

This delegation is made up of various activists from the different
organizations that fight for the independence of Puerto Rico.  The
reception/forum is an opportunity for allies of the Puerto Rican
independence movement in NYC to converse with activists from Puerto Rico, to
hear about the work they do in the United Nations, and to hear an update
about the various struggles in Puerto Rico.

U.N. Presenters:
Benjamin Ramos, The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
Jorge Farinacci, Frente Socialista
Rosa Meneses, The Nationalist Party of Puerto Rico
Ismael Guadalupe, Vieques Activist
Frank Velgara, The Vieques Support Campaign
And other U.N. presenters...

_______________________________________________________________________________


The New School Artists presents Esperanza & Rephstar Revisioning Art and
Revolution A Mother and Son Art show On view May 7th - 29th

Closing reception May 29th, 4 to 8 pm At the Brecht Forum 451 West Street,
New York, NY 10014 www.brechtforum.org

New School Artists (NSA) brings you The Revisioning Art and Revolution arts
exhibition featuring mother and son duo Esperanza and Rephstar. This
intergenerational show will celebrate Mother�s day, Puerto Rican cultural
history and Hip-Hop.

The Closing reception May 29th, 4 to 8:pm will feature a silent auction,
open Mic, slide show, and much more. The Revisioning art Show is a
not-to-miss event for any art enthusiasts. To see the exhibit during the
month go to www.brechtforum.org to see what times and dates they are open.

Esperanza Martell To Espe her art is an expression of her politics,
culture/spirituality. Her African/Taino ancestors used art magically in
healing and to give meaning to their existence. She does the same by
creating ceramic sculpture from nothing, allowing total self-expression. She
hand builds, using traditional images and methods and is inspired by the
earth/ocean/stars. She hopes her work opens individuals to their historical
roots generating healing and power.

Rephstar (www.rephstar.com) Rephstar is an MC, Producer, Dancer, Mixed Media
visual artist and activist. He developed his love for the visual arts
through writing and appreciating the graffiti on walls throughout Manhattan.
That coupled with a passion for technology, history and social change is
what led him to the work he is doing today with computer graphics, video and
sound. Rephstar visions his work as a reflection of the human experience
through the eyes of the Hip-Hop generation. Peace, MiLs 646-772-6081
rephstar@...





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

open Mic, slide show, and much more. The Revisioning art Show is a
not-to-miss event for any art enthusiasts. To see the exhibit during the
month go to www.brechtforum.org to see what times and dates they are open.

Post ID:3656
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-05-17 13:30:37
Subject:June 3rd: Mission Against Terror
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
______________________________________________________________________________

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is calling on all our allies and supporters
to support the Film screening of Mission Against Terror by the Popular
Education Project to Free the Cuban Five; which is a people of color led
campaign made up of individuals and organizations that are working to
educate people of color communities and garner support for the freedom of
the Cuban Five.

Check out the Popular Education  Project Website at:
http://www.freethecuban5.com
______________________________________________________________________________

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5: 2005 for the Cuban 5
Presents

MISSION AGAINST TERROR!!

DID YOU MISS IT THE FIRST TIME IT WAS IN NYC?

Join The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5: 2005 for the Cuban 5
and Latino/as at Riverside/The Riverside Church for our premiere of MISSION
AGAINST TERROR in Harlem!!

MISSION AGAINST TERROR, a documentary written and directed by Bernie Dwyer
and Roberto Ruiz Rebo was made in Cuba and details the case of the Cuban 5.
The movie answers the question why are people who fight terrorism imprisoned
in the U.S. while known terrorists proven to carry out bombings and attacks
against the Cuban island are allowed to walk the streets of Miami freely.

After the film, the guest panelists below will comment and take questions
from the audience.

*Representative, Cuban Mission to the United Nations

*Rafael Rodr�guez Cruz, Attorney and Board Member of the Rosenberg Fund for
Children

*Bonnie Massey, Venceremos Brigade

*Benjamin Ramos, Popular Education Project To Free the Cuban 5

Friday June 3rd, 2005 at 6:30pm at
Riverside Church  91 Claremont Ave.
Btwn. 120-122 Streets
Train 1/9 to 116 or 125th St.

Donation: $5-10 (no one will be turned away)

For more info. Email: freethecuban5@... or call our Free the Cuban
Five Hotline 718-601-4751
_____________________________________________________________________________

��MISION EN CONTRA DEL TERRORISMO!!

NO LA PUDO VER CUANDO SE PRESENTO EN NUEVA YORK?

El Proyecto de Educaci�n Popular: 2005 Por Los 5 Cubanos y Latino/as en
Riverside/Iglesia de Riverside les invita a la presentaci�n de la pel�cula
Misi�n En Contra Del Terrorismo en Harlem.

MISION EN CONTRA DEL TERRORISMO, un documental de Bernie Dwyer y Roberto
Ruiz Rebo sobre el caso de los 5 cubanos fue hecho en Cuba. �Porque estan
presos los que luchan en contra del terrorismo, mientras que conocidos
terroristas que han puesto bombas y que han hecho otros ataques en contra de
Cuba se les permite andar libre en las calles de Miami?

Despues de la pel�cula los panelistas invitados haran comentarios y
contestar�n preguntas del p�blico.

*Representante, Misi�n de Cuba Ante Las Naciones Unidas

*Rafael Rodr�guez Cruz, Abogado y miembro de La junta del Rosenberg Fund for
Children

*Bonnie Massey, La Brigada Venceremos

*Benjamin Ramos, Proyecto de Educaci�n Popular 2005 Por Los 5

Viernes, 3 de junio, 2005�6:30 p.m.
Iglesia Riverside�91 Avenida Claremont
Entre: Calles 120 y 122
Trenes: 1 y 9 a Calle 116 o Calle 125

Donaci�n: $5-$10 (no se le negar� entrada a nadie)

creating ceramic sculpture from nothing, allowing total self-expression. She
hand builds, using traditional images and methods and is inspired by the
earth/ocean/stars. She hopes her work opens individuals to their historical
roots generating healing and power.

Rephstar (www.rephstar.com) Rephstar is an MC, Producer, Dancer, Mixed Media
visual artist and activist. He developed his love for the visual arts
through writing and appreciating the graffiti on walls throughout Manhattan.
That coupled with a passion for technology, history and social change is
what led him to the work he is doing today with computer graphics, video and
sound. Rephstar visions his work as a reflection of the human experience
through the eyes of the Hip-Hop generation. Peace, MiLs 646-772-6081
rephstar@...





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

our allies and supporters to download a copy of the newsletter and forward

Download the May 2005 edition of the ProLibertad Newsletter El Coqui Libre:
http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclMay2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

Puerto Rico: An International Struggle for Liberation
The Vieques Struggle, the Independence movement, the work to free the Puerto
Rican Political Prisoners!!

Monday June 13, 2005 at 6:30pm at Hunter College West Building
8th floor Faculty/Staff Lounge E68th St. and Lexington Avenue  (Take the #6
train to E68th St.)

Donation: $10  (no one will be turned away)

Join the ProLibertad Freedom Campaign for our annual Reception/Forum for the
Puerto Rico Delegation of the United Nations De-Colonization Committee
Hearings!!

Every year a Delegation from Puerto Rico comes to the United Nations to
testify to the U.N. De-Colonization Committee, to make the case for the
liberation of Puerto Rico, Vieques and the release of the Puerto Rican
Political Prisoners and Prisoners of War.

This delegation is made up of various activists from the different
organizations that fight for the independence of Puerto Rico.  The
reception/forum is an opportunity for allies of the Puerto Rican
independence movement in NYC to converse with activists from Puerto Rico, to
hear about the work they do in the United Nations, and to hear an update
about the various struggles in Puerto Rico.

U.N. Presenters:
Benjamin Ramos, The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
Jorge Farinacci, Frente Socialista
Rosa Meneses, The Nationalist Party of Puerto Rico
Ismael Guadalupe, Vieques Activist
Frank Velgara, The Vieques Support Campaign
And other U.N. presenters...

_______________________________________________________________________________


The New School Artists presents Esperanza & Rephstar Revisioning Art and
Revolution A Mother and Son Art show On view May 7th - 29th

Closing reception May 29th, 4 to 8 pm At the Brecht Forum 451 West Street,
New York, NY 10014 www.brechtforum.org

New School Artists (NSA) brings you The Revisioning Art and Revolution arts
exhibition featuring mother and son duo Esperanza and Rephstar. This
intergenerational show will celebrate Mother�s day, Puerto Rican cultural
history and Hip-Hop.

The Closing reception May 29th, 4 to 8:pm will feature a silent auction,
open Mic, slide show, and much more. The Revisioning art Show is a
not-to-miss event for any art enthusiasts. To see the exhibit during the
month go to www.brechtforum.org to see what times and dates they are open.

Esperanza Martell To Espe her art is an expression of her politics,
culture/spirituality. Her African/Taino ancestors used art magically in
healing and to give meaning to their existence. She does the same by
creating ceramic sculpture from nothing, allowing total self-expression. She
hand builds, using traditional images and methods and is inspired by the
earth/ocean/stars. She hopes her work opens individuals to their historical
roots generating healing and power.

Rephstar (www.rephstar.com) Rephstar is an MC, Producer, Dancer, Mixed Media
visual artist and activist. He developed his love for the visual arts
through writing and appreciating the graffiti on walls throughout Manhattan.
That coupled with a passion for technology, history and social change is
what led him to the work he is doing today with computer graphics, video and
sound. Rephstar visions his work as a reflection of the human experience
through the eyes of the Hip-Hop generation. Peace, MiLs 646-772-6081
rephstar@...

Post ID:3660
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-05-19 13:27:54
Subject:2 EVENTS FOR THE Cuban 5
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
______________________________________________________________________________

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is calling on all our allies and supporters
to support the Film screening of Mission Against Terror by the Popular
Education Project to Free the Cuban Five; which is a people of color led
campaign made up of individuals and organizations that are working to
educate people of color communities and garner support for the freedom of
the Cuban Five.

Check out the Popular Education  Project Website at:
http://www.freethecuban5.com
______________________________________________________________________________

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5: 2005 for the Cuban 5
Presents

MISSION AGAINST TERROR!!

DID YOU MISS IT THE FIRST TIME IT WAS IN NYC?

Join The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5: 2005 for the Cuban 5
and Latino/as at Riverside/The Riverside Church for our premiere of MISSION
AGAINST TERROR in Harlem!!

MISSION AGAINST TERROR, a documentary written and directed by Bernie Dwyer
and Roberto Ruiz Rebo was made in Cuba and details the case of the Cuban 5.
The movie answers the question why are people who fight terrorism imprisoned
in the U.S. while known terrorists proven to carry out bombings and attacks
against the Cuban island are allowed to walk the streets of Miami freely.

After the film, the guest panelists below will comment and take questions
from the audience.

*Representative, Cuban Mission to the United Nations

*Rafael Rodr�guez Cruz, Attorney and Board Member of the Rosenberg Fund for 
Children

*Bonnie Massey, Venceremos Brigade

*Benjamin Ramos, Popular Education Project To Free the Cuban 5

Friday June 3rd, 2005 at 6:30pm at
Riverside Church  91 Claremont Ave.
Btwn. 120-122 Streets
Train 1/9 to 116 or 125th St.

Donation: $5-10 (no one will be turned away)

For more info. Email: freethecuban5@... or call our Free the Cuban
Five Hotline 718-601-4751
_____________________________________________________________________________

HAPPY BIRTHDAY GERARDO AND RAMON!!

On June 4th, Gerardo Hernandez Nordelo will be turning 40 years YOUNG and on 
June 9th, Ramon Laba�ino Salazar will be turning 42 years YOUNG!!

Ramon and Gerardo are 2 of the 5 U.S. held Cuban Political Prisoners, 
incarcerated for safe guarding the U.S. and Cuba from acts of terrorism!!

Join The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5, for a belated 
birthday party for Ramon and Gerardo; help us raise commissary money for the 
Cuban 5!!  Join  us as we party all night long with:

DJ Carlito and his All Latino Music Mix!!

DELICIOUS LATINO FOOD, MUSIC, AND DANCING!! NO SPEECHES!!

Friday July 1st, 2005 at 7pm
St. Mary�s Episcopal Church
521 W126th St.
(Between Amsterdam Ave. and Broadway)
Take the 1 or 9 Train to W125th St.

$10 Donation (no one will be turned away)

For more information on the Birthday Party contact The Popular Education 
Project to Free the Cuban 5 at: Freethecuban5@... or call 
718-601-4751
Website: Http://www.freethecuban5.com

Post ID:3662
Sender:"L_Glasyner" <447cc159fa759e8a8bf63c68494f81a0@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-05-21 08:58:21
Subject:Find your perfect partner. I did...
Message:

Yeah I know, I never thought this stuff would work either, but honestly I stand corrected. This place <a href="http://www.lovewebcams.info/fbcbt">http://www.lovewebcams.info/fbcbt</a> is actually very awesome. I hooked mycam up and within no time I was talking to a few great ladies over it. Anyway, I recommend it to everyone here!

_______________________________________________________________________________

Puerto Rico: An International Struggle for Liberation
The Vieques Struggle, the Independence movement, the work to free the Puerto
Rican Political Prisoners!!

Monday June 13, 2005 at 6:30pm at Hunter College West Building
8th floor Faculty/Staff Lounge E68th St. and Lexington Avenue  (Take the #6
train to E68th St.)

Donation: $10  (no one will be turned away)

Join the ProLibertad Freedom Campaign for our annual Reception/Forum for the
Puerto Rico Delegation of the United Nations De-Colonization Committee
Hearings!!

Every year a Delegation from Puerto Rico comes to the United Nations to
testify to the U.N. De-Colonization Committee, to make the case for the
liberation of Puerto Rico, Vieques and the release of the Puerto Rican
Political Prisoners and Prisoners of War.

This delegation is made up of various activists from the different
organizations that fight for the independence of Puerto Rico.  The
reception/forum is an opportunity for allies of the Puerto Rican
independence movement in NYC to converse with activists from Puerto Rico, to
hear about the work they do in the United Nations, and to hear an update
about the various struggles in Puerto Rico.

U.N. Presenters:
Benjamin Ramos, The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
Jorge Farinacci, Frente Socialista
Rosa Meneses, The Nationalist Party of Puerto Rico
Ismael Guadalupe, Vieques Activist
Frank Velgara, The Vieques Support Campaign
And other U.N. presenters...
_______________________________________________________________________________

PROLIBERTAD FREEDOM PICNIC 2005!!

Join ProLibertad on our annual Freedom Picnic to HighLands Pool in Ringwood, 
New Jersey!!

Enjoy the sun, fun and relaxation of HighLands Pool!!  Bring your swimming 
trunks for the cool and refreshing Chemical-free mountain stream fed pool!!  
We will have FOOD, FUN, MUSIC, GAMES, SPORTS and RELAXATION!!

Saturday July 16th, 2005 at  9am!!  Get on the Bus!! Support ProLibertad!!
Meet at the corner of w179th St. and Broadway at 9am to catch one of our 
Freedom Vans to HighLand Pools!!

Transportation from NYC ($10), Entrance to HighLand Pools ($5) and Food 
($5); all together $20.  Contact ProLibertad to reserve a seat on our 
Freedom Bus by calling 718-601-4751 or email
ProLibertad@...

For more information on the ProLibertad Freedom Picnic, please contact 
ProLibertad at ProLibertad@..., Bronx 718-601-4751, Manhattan 
212-927-9065, New Jersey 201-435-3244.  Check out the website: 
http://www.ProLibertadweb.com

MISSION AGAINST TERROR!!

DID YOU MISS IT THE FIRST TIME IT WAS IN NYC?

Join The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5: 2005 for the Cuban 5
and Latino/as at Riverside/The Riverside Church for our premiere of MISSION
AGAINST TERROR in Harlem!!

MISSION AGAINST TERROR, a documentary written and directed by Bernie Dwyer
and Roberto Ruiz Rebo was made in Cuba and details the case of the Cuban 5.
The movie answers the question why are people who fight terrorism imprisoned
in the U.S. while known terrorists proven to carry out bombings and attacks
against the Cuban island are allowed to walk the streets of Miami freely.

After the film, the guest panelists below will comment and take questions
from the audience.

*Representative, Cuban Mission to the United Nations

*Rafael Rodr�guez Cruz, Attorney and Board Member of the Rosenberg Fund for
Children

*Bonnie Massey, Venceremos Brigade

*Benjamin Ramos, Popular Education Project To Free the Cuban 5

Friday June 3rd, 2005 at 6:30pm at
Riverside Church  91 Claremont Ave.
Btwn. 120-122 Streets
Train 1/9 to 116 or 125th St.

Donation: $5-10 (no one will be turned away)

For more info. Email: freethecuban5@... or call our Free the Cuban
Five Hotline 718-601-4751
_____________________________________________________________________________

HAPPY BIRTHDAY GERARDO AND RAMON!!

On June 4th, Gerardo Hernandez Nordelo will be turning 40 years YOUNG and on
June 9th, Ramon Laba�ino Salazar will be turning 42 years YOUNG!!

Ramon and Gerardo are 2 of the 5 U.S. held Cuban Political Prisoners,
incarcerated for safe guarding the U.S. and Cuba from acts of terrorism!!

Join The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5, for a belated
birthday party for Ramon and Gerardo; help us raise commissary money for the
Cuban 5!!  Join  us as we party all night long with:

DJ Carlito and his All Latino Music Mix!!

DELICIOUS LATINO FOOD, MUSIC, AND DANCING!! NO SPEECHES!!

Friday July 1st, 2005 at 7pm
St. Mary�s Episcopal Church
521 W126th St.
(Between Amsterdam Ave. and Broadway)
Take the 1 or 9 Train to W125th St.

$10 Donation (no one will be turned away)

For more information on the Birthday Party contact The Popular Education
Project to Free the Cuban 5 at: Freethecuban5@... or call
718-601-4751
Website: Http://www.freethecuban5.com

Download the May 2005 edition of the ProLibertad Newsletter El Coqui Libre:
http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclMay2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

Puerto Rico: An International Struggle for Liberation
The Vieques Struggle, the Independence movement, the work to free the Puerto
Rican Political Prisoners!!

Monday June 13, 2005 at 6:30pm at Hunter College West Building
8th floor Faculty/Staff Lounge E68th St. and Lexington Avenue  (Take the #6
train to E68th St.)

Donation: $10  (no one will be turned away)

Join the ProLibertad Freedom Campaign for our annual Reception/Forum for the
Puerto Rico Delegation of the United Nations De-Colonization Committee
Hearings!!

Every year a Delegation from Puerto Rico comes to the United Nations to
testify to the U.N. De-Colonization Committee, to make the case for the
liberation of Puerto Rico, Vieques and the release of the Puerto Rican
Political Prisoners and Prisoners of War.

This delegation is made up of various activists from the different
organizations that fight for the independence of Puerto Rico.  The
reception/forum is an opportunity for allies of the Puerto Rican
independence movement in NYC to converse with activists from Puerto Rico, to
hear about the work they do in the United Nations, and to hear an update
about the various struggles in Puerto Rico.

U.N. Presenters:
Benjamin Ramos, The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
Jorge Farinacci, Frente Socialista
Rosa Meneses, The Nationalist Party of Puerto Rico
Ismael Guadalupe, Vieques Activist
Frank Velgara, The Vieques Support Campaign
And other U.N. presenters...
_______________________________________________________________________________

PROLIBERTAD FREEDOM PICNIC 2005!!

Join ProLibertad on our annual Freedom Picnic to HighLands Pool in Ringwood,
New Jersey!!

Enjoy the sun, fun and relaxation of HighLands Pool!!  Bring your swimming
trunks for the cool and refreshing Chemical-free mountain stream fed pool!!
We will have FOOD, FUN, MUSIC, GAMES, SPORTS and RELAXATION!!

Saturday July 16th, 2005 at  9am!!  Get on the Bus!! Support ProLibertad!!
Meet at the corner of w179th St. and Broadway at 9am to catch one of our
Freedom Vans to HighLand Pools!!

Transportation from NYC ($10), Entrance to HighLand Pools ($5) and Food
($5); all together $20.  Contact ProLibertad to reserve a seat on our
Freedom Bus by calling 718-601-4751 or email ProLibertad@...

For more information on the ProLibertad Freedom Picnic, please contact
ProLibertad at ProLibertad@..., Bronx 718-601-4751, Manhattan
212-927-9065, New Jersey 201-435-3244.  Check out the website:
http://www.ProLibertadweb.com

Post ID:3677
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-06-01 10:40:58
Subject:DB Segment/HAPPY BIRTHDAY HAYDEE BELTRAN
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

Download a copy of El Coqui Libre, ProLibertad�s monthly newsletter; our 
June
edition can be found at: http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclJune2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

Despierta Boricua is a weekly fifteen-minute Radio segment produced for WBAI
99.5 FM Friday Morning Wake UP Call by The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign.
Despierta Boricua airs at 6:45am, but is subject to re-scheduling depending
on the Station�s needs.

This week�s segment (Friday June 3rd)  will focus on Puerto Rican solidarity 
with Cuba; it  features an interview with Bonnie Massy, of the Venceremos 
Brigade, about the Arrest of Luis Posada Carriles, his extradition to 
Venezuela, and the June 13th event in NYC for his extradition.

Originally, this segment was to be aired on Friday May 27th but due to 
technical issues it was postponed!!

Tune in every week to Despierta Boricua, whether you receive a reminder or
not, 6:45am WBAI 99.5fm or via web stream, for those of you outside of NYC,
http://www.wbai.org
_______________________________________________________________________________

HAPPY 50TH BIRTHDAY HAYDEE BENTRAN!!

On June 7th of this year, Haydee Beltran Torres, one of three Puerto Rican 
Political Prisoners, will be turning 50 YEARS YOUNG!!

For the past 25 years (HALF OF HER LIFE), she has been incarcerated for 
fighting for the freedom and self-determination of her homeland Puerto Rico; 
a colony of the United States for 106 years.

Haydee Beltran Torres was born in Arecibo, Puerto Rico on June 7, 1955.  
When Haydee was 12 years old, her parents moved to Chicago.  At Tuley High 
School, she organized a boycott that demanded the firing of a racist 
principal.  Haydee attended the University of Illinois where she was an 
outspoken defender of Latino students� rights.

Haydee was forced underground in 1976 and was captured April 4, 1980.  She 
has been sentenced to life in prison on charges including seditious 
conspiracy.  Haydee was the first POW to receive a life sentence.  She was 
kept in total isolation from the other prisoners of war and was transferred 
to a special control unit which limited visits.  It was a year before she 
was allowed to see her family.  At the MCC in Chicago, she was classified as 
�no visitors allowed�.  Haydee was subject to physical abuse in 
interrogations for refusing to implicate her comrades in unfounded crimes.  
This was done several times by FBI and other government agents.  These and 
other inhumane acts by the U.S. government have led to serious injuries, 
which prison medical directors have misdiagnosed; also, Haydee has received 
injections of unknown medications.

To celebrate her birthday, The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is calling on 
all our allies and supporters to send her birthday cards, postcards or 
letters.  Let Haydee know that we love her, support her, and wish her a 
great 50!!

Send her a letter, postcard, Birthday card to:

Haydee Beltran Torres
#88462-024
SCI Tallahassee
501 Capitol Circle NE
Tallahassee, FL 32031

If you want to send Haydee a commissary donation so she can buy supplies and 
make telephone calls to family and friends, then send it to the following 
address and follow the guidelines below:

Federal Bureau of Prisons
Haydee Beltran (#88462-024)
PO Box 474701
Des Moines IA 50947-0001

You must send all funds to the mailing address (above) and adhere to the 
following instructions:

1.  The Bureau of Prisons (BOP) will only approve/accept the following 
items, which it calls �Negotiable instruments�:  Money Orders, government 
checks, Foreign Negotiable Instruments or Business  checks.  NOTE: No 
Personal Checks; they will be sent back to you.

2.  Endorse the check or money order with the prisoner�s committed name and 
register number (prison number) on  the funds.

3.  The name and return address of the sender must appear in the upper left 
hand corner of the envelope to ensure that funds can be returned when 
necessary.

4.  Don�t send items other than funds top the above provided address.  The 
BOP will discard letters, pictures and anything else you send.





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:3678
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-06-01 10:41:24
Subject:DB Segment/HAPPY BIRTHDAY HAYDEE BELTRAN
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

Download a copy of El Coqui Libre, ProLibertad�s monthly newsletter; our 
June
edition can be found at: http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclJune2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

Despierta Boricua is a weekly fifteen-minute Radio segment produced for WBAI
99.5 FM Friday Morning Wake UP Call by The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign.
Despierta Boricua airs at 6:45am, but is subject to re-scheduling depending
on the Station�s needs.

This week�s segment (Friday June 3rd)  will focus on Puerto Rican solidarity 
with Cuba; it  features an interview with Bonnie Massy, of the Venceremos 
Brigade, about the Arrest of Luis Posada Carriles, his extradition to 
Venezuela, and the June 13th event in NYC for his extradition.

Originally, this segment was to be aired on Friday May 27th but due to 
technical issues it was postponed!!

Tune in every week to Despierta Boricua, whether you receive a reminder or
not, 6:45am WBAI 99.5fm or via web stream, for those of you outside of NYC,
http://www.wbai.org
_______________________________________________________________________________

HAPPY 50TH BIRTHDAY HAYDEE BENTRAN!!

On June 7th of this year, Haydee Beltran Torres, one of three Puerto Rican 
Political Prisoners, will be turning 50 YEARS YOUNG!!

For the past 25 years (HALF OF HER LIFE), she has been incarcerated for 
fighting for the freedom and self-determination of her homeland Puerto Rico; 
a colony of the United States for 106 years.

Haydee Beltran Torres was born in Arecibo, Puerto Rico on June 7, 1955.  
When Haydee was 12 years old, her parents moved to Chicago.  At Tuley High 
School, she organized a boycott that demanded the firing of a racist 
principal.  Haydee attended the University of Illinois where she was an 
outspoken defender of Latino students� rights.

Haydee was forced underground in 1976 and was captured April 4, 1980.  She 
has been sentenced to life in prison on charges including seditious 
conspiracy.  Haydee was the first POW to receive a life sentence.  She was 
kept in total isolation from the other prisoners of war and was transferred 
to a special control unit which limited visits.  It was a year before she 
was allowed to see her family.  At the MCC in Chicago, she was classified as 
�no visitors allowed�.  Haydee was subject to physical abuse in 
interrogations for refusing to implicate her comrades in unfounded crimes.  
This was done several times by FBI and other government agents.  These and 
other inhumane acts by the U.S. government have led to serious injuries, 
which prison medical directors have misdiagnosed; also, Haydee has received 
injections of unknown medications.

To celebrate her birthday, The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is calling on 
all our allies and supporters to send her birthday cards, postcards or 
letters.  Let Haydee know that we love her, support her, and wish her a 
great 50!!

Send her a letter, postcard, Birthday card to:

Haydee Beltran Torres
#88462-024
SCI Tallahassee
501 Capitol Circle NE
Tallahassee, FL 32031

If you want to send Haydee a commissary donation so she can buy supplies and 
make telephone calls to family and friends, then send it to the following 
address and follow the guidelines below:

Federal Bureau of Prisons
Haydee Beltran (#88462-024)
PO Box 474701
Des Moines IA 50947-0001

You must send all funds to the mailing address (above) and adhere to the 
following instructions:

1.  The Bureau of Prisons (BOP) will only approve/accept the following 
items, which it calls �Negotiable instruments�:  Money Orders, government 
checks, Foreign Negotiable Instruments or Business  checks.  NOTE: No 
Personal Checks; they will be sent back to you.

2.  Endorse the check or money order with the prisoner�s committed name and 
register number (prison number) on  the funds.

3.  The name and return address of the sender must appear in the upper left 
hand corner of the envelope to ensure that funds can be returned when 
necessary.

4.  Don�t send items other than funds top the above provided address.  The 
BOP will discard letters, pictures and anything else you send.

http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclJune2005.pdf

Puerto Rico: An International Struggle for Liberation
The Vieques Struggle, the Independence movement, the work to free the Puerto
Rican Political Prisoners!!

Monday June 13, 2005 at 6:30pm at Hunter College West Building
8th floor Faculty/Staff Lounge E68th St. and Lexington Avenue  (Take the #6
train to E68th St.)

Donation: $10  (no one will be turned away)

Join the ProLibertad Freedom Campaign for our annual Reception/Forum for the
Puerto Rico Delegation of the United Nations De-Colonization Committee
Hearings!!

Every year a Delegation from Puerto Rico comes to the United Nations to
testify to the U.N. De-Colonization Committee, to make the case for the
liberation of Puerto Rico, Vieques and the release of the Puerto Rican
Political Prisoners and Prisoners of War.

This delegation is made up of various activists from the different
organizations that fight for the independence of Puerto Rico.  The
reception/forum is an opportunity for allies of the Puerto Rican
independence movement in NYC to converse with activists from Puerto Rico, to
hear about the work they do in the United Nations, and to hear an update
about the various struggles in Puerto Rico.

U.N. Presenters:
Benjamin Ramos, The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
Jorge Farinacci, Frente Socialista
Rosa Meneses, The Nationalist Party of Puerto Rico
Ismael Guadalupe, Vieques Activist
Frank Velgara, The Vieques Support Campaign
And other U.N. presenters...
_______________________________________________________________________________

PROLIBERTAD FREEDOM PICNIC 2005!!

Join ProLibertad on our annual Freedom Picnic to HighLands Pool in Ringwood, 
New Jersey!!

Enjoy the sun, fun and relaxation of HighLands Pool!!  Bring your swimming
trunks for the cool and refreshing Chemical-free mountain stream fed pool!!
We will have FOOD, FUN, MUSIC, GAMES, SPORTS and RELAXATION!!

Saturday July 16th, 2005 at  9am!!  Get on the Bus!! Support ProLibertad!!
Meet at the corner of w179th St. and Broadway at 9am to catch one of our
Freedom Vans to HighLand Pools!!

Transportation from NYC ($10), Entrance to HighLand Pools ($5) and Food
($5); all together $20.  Contact ProLibertad to reserve a seat on our
Freedom Bus by calling 718-601-4751 or email ProLibertad@...

For more information on the ProLibertad Freedom Picnic, please contact
ProLibertad at ProLibertad@..., Bronx 718-601-4751, Manhattan
212-927-9065, New Jersey 201-435-3244.  Check out the website:
http://www.ProLibertadweb.com

Despierta Boricua is a weekly fifteen-minute Radio segment produced for WBAI
99.5 FM Friday Morning Wake UP Call by The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign.
Despierta Boricua airs at 6:45am, but is subject to re-scheduling depending
on the Station�s needs.

This week�s segment (Friday June 10th) features an interview with Vagabond 
of
the Ricanstruction Network about the upcoming film screening of MACHETERO, a
film about a Boricua young man  imprisoned for his acts of revolutionary 
violence in
support of the Puerto Rican Independence movement.  The film features music 
by
Puerto Punx band Ricanstruction and stars Not4Prophet of Ricanstruction.

Tune in every week to Despierta Boricua, whether you receive a reminder or
not, 6:45am WBAI 99.5fm or via web stream, for those of you outside of NYC,
http://www.wbai.org
_______________________________________________________________________________

HAPPY BIRTHDAY GERARDO AND RAMON!!

On June 4th, Gerardo Hernandez Nordelo will be turning 40 years YOUNG and on
June 9th, Ramon Laba�ino Salazar will be turning 42 years YOUNG!!

Ramon and Gerardo are 2 of the 5 U.S. held Cuban Political Prisoners,
incarcerated for safe guarding the U.S. and Cuba from acts of terrorism!!

Join The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5, for a belated
birthday party for Ramon and Gerardo; help us raise commissary money for the
Cuban 5!!  Join  us as we party all night long with:

DJ Carlito and his All Latino Music Mix!!

DELICIOUS LATINO FOOD, MUSIC, AND DANCING!! NO SPEECHES!!

Friday July 1st, 2005 at 7pm
St. Mary�s Episcopal Church
521 W126th St.
(Between Amsterdam Ave. and Broadway)
Take the 1 or 9 Train to W125th St.

$10 Donation (no one will be turned away)

For more information on the Birthday Party contact The Popular Education
Project to Free the Cuban 5 at: Freethecuban5@... or call
718-601-4751

June edition can be found at: http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclJune2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

Despierta Boricua is a weekly fifteen-minute Radio segment produced for WBAI
99.5 FM Friday Morning Wake UP Call by The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign.
Despierta Boricua airs at 6:45am, but is subject to re-scheduling depending
on the Station�s needs.

This week�s segment (Friday June 10th) features an interview with Vagabond
of the Ricanstruction Network about the upcoming film screening of 
MACHETERO, a
film about a Boricua young man  imprisoned for his acts of revolutionary 
violence in
support of the Puerto Rican Independence movement.  The film features music
by Puerto Punx band Ricanstruction and stars Not4Prophet of Ricanstruction.

Tune in every week to Despierta Boricua, whether you receive a reminder or
not, 6:45am WBAI 99.5fm or via web stream, for those of you outside of NYC,
http://www.wbai.org
_______________________________________________________________________________

HAPPY BIRTHDAY GERARDO AND RAMON!!

On June 4th, Gerardo Hernandez Nordelo will be turning 40 years YOUNG and on
June 9th, Ramon Laba�ino Salazar will be turning 42 years YOUNG!!

Ramon and Gerardo are 2 of the 5 U.S. held Cuban Political Prisoners,
incarcerated for safe guarding the U.S. and Cuba from acts of terrorism!!

Join The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5, for a belated
birthday party for Ramon and Gerardo; help us raise commissary money for the
Cuban 5!!  Join  us as we party all night long with:

DJ Carlito and his All Latino Music Mix!!

DELICIOUS LATINO FOOD, MUSIC, AND DANCING!! NO SPEECHES!!

Friday July 1st, 2005 at 7pm
St. Mary�s Episcopal Church
521 W126th St.
(Between Amsterdam Ave. and Broadway)
Take the 1 or 9 Train to W125th St.

$10 Donation (no one will be turned away)

For more information on the Birthday Party contact The Popular Education
Project to Free the Cuban 5 at: Freethecuban5@... or call
718-601-4751
Website: Http://www.freethecuban5.com

Post ID:3693
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-06-12 02:07:42
Subject:June 13th Puerto Rico: An International Struggle for Liberation
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
______________________________________________________________________________

1.  ProLibertad Forum "Puerto Rico" An International Struggle for 
Liberation"
2.  PROLIBERTAD FREEDOM PICNIC 2005

Download the June 2005 edition of the ProLibertad Newsletter El Coqui Libre:
http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclJune2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

Puerto Rico: An International Struggle for Liberation
The Vieques Struggle, the Independence movement, the work to free the Puerto
Rican Political Prisoners!!

Monday June 13, 2005 at 6:30pm at Hunter College West Building
8th floor Faculty/Staff Lounge E68th St. and Lexington Avenue  (Take the #6
train to E68th St.)

Donation: $10  (no one will be turned away)

Join the ProLibertad Freedom Campaign for our annual Reception/Forum for the
Puerto Rico Delegation of the United Nations De-Colonization Committee
Hearings!!

Every year a Delegation from Puerto Rico comes to the United Nations to
testify to the U.N. De-Colonization Committee, to make the case for the
liberation of Puerto Rico, Vieques and the release of the Puerto Rican
Political Prisoners and Prisoners of War.

This delegation is made up of various activists from the different
organizations that fight for the independence of Puerto Rico.  The
reception/forum is an opportunity for allies of the Puerto Rican
independence movement in NYC to converse with activists from Puerto Rico, to
hear about the work they do in the United Nations, and to hear an update
about the various struggles in Puerto Rico.

U.N. Presenters:
Benjamin Ramos, The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
Jorge Farinacci, Frente Socialista
Rosa Meneses, The Nationalist Party of Puerto Rico
Ismael Guadalupe, Vieques Activist
Frank Velgara, The Vieques Support Campaign
And other U.N. presenters...
_______________________________________________________________________________

PROLIBERTAD FREEDOM PICNIC 2005!!

Join ProLibertad on our annual Freedom Picnic to HighLands Pool in Ringwood,
New Jersey!!

Enjoy the sun, fun and relaxation of HighLands Pool!!  Bring your swimming
trunks for the cool and refreshing Chemical-free mountain stream fed pool!!
We will have FOOD, FUN, MUSIC, GAMES, SPORTS and RELAXATION!!

Saturday July 16th, 2005 at  9am!!  Get on the Bus!! Support ProLibertad!!
Meet at the corner of w179th St. and Broadway at 9am to catch one of our
Freedom Vans to HighLand Pools!!

Transportation from NYC ($10), Entrance to HighLand Pools ($5) and Food
($5); all together $20.  Contact ProLibertad to reserve a seat on our
Freedom Bus by calling 718-601-4751 or email ProLibertad@...

For more information on the ProLibertad Freedom Picnic, please contact
ProLibertad at ProLibertad@..., Bronx 718-601-4751, Manhattan
212-927-9065, New Jersey 201-435-3244.  Check out the website:
http://www.ProLibertadweb.com

Poet/Activist Rafael Landron, who will be hosting his first one-man show 
"Rafael's Anti-War Expressions on June 24th and 25th at 107 Suffolk St. 
(between Delancy and Riverton) on the 2nd floor at 8pm.

DJ Carlito and his All Latino Music Mix!!

DELICIOUS LATINO FOOD, MUSIC, AND DANCING!! NO SPEECHES!!

Friday July 1st, 2005 at 7pm
St. Mary�s Episcopal Church
521 W126th St.
(Between Amsterdam Ave. and Broadway)
Take the 1 or 9 Train to W125th St.

$10 Donation (no one will be turned away)

For more information on the Birthday Party contact The Popular Education
Project to Free the Cuban 5 at: Freethecuban5@... or call
718-601-4751
Website: Http://www.freethecuban5.com

Post ID:3706
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-06-21 12:58:09
Subject:DB Segment/ProLibertad Freedom Picnic
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

Download a copy of El Coqui Libre, ProLibertad�s monthly newsletter; our
June edition can be found at: http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclJune2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

Despierta Boricua is a weekly fifteen-minute Radio segment produced for WBAI
99.5 FM Friday Morning Wake UP Call by The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign.
Despierta Boricua airs at 6:45am, but is subject to re-scheduling depending
on the Station�s needs.

This week�s segment (Friday June 22nd) features an interview with the 
coordinators
of El Maestro; Help an important South Bronx institution stay alive; El 
Maestro: Cultural
& Educational Center, a project of UTBANY, Inc., is undergoing a critical 
financial situation
and needs your help to continue providing the community with much needed 
services.

Join us on Saturday, June 25th 8PM Featuring the Music of: Tato Torres & 
YERBABUENA: Boricua Roots Music Live Alex Javier "La Voz de Oro" 7 the 
Patriotic Poetry of: Prisionera Special Guest: Angel "Cholo" Espada, former 
WBA welterweight champion Minimum Donation: $25 Includes Dinner United 
Trainers and Boxers Association of New York, Inc. (UTBA, Inc.) is a 
non-profit organization whose mission is to improve the quality of life of 
the people in the community through social activities such as sports, 
cultural and educational programs. It houses two major projects: a sports 
center named after Juan Laporte, the Puerto Rican boxing champion, and a 
cultural and educational center named El Maestro after the Puerto Rican 
patriot, Dr. Pedro Albizu Campos.

Tune in every week to Despierta Boricua, whether you receive a reminder or 
not, 6:45am WBAI 99.5fm or via web stream, for those of you outside of NYC, 
http://www.wbai.org
_______________________________________________________________________________

PROLIBERTAD FREEDOM PICNIC 2005!!

Join ProLibertad on our annual Freedom Picnic to HighLands Pool in Ringwood,
New Jersey!!

Enjoy the sun, fun and relaxation of HighLands Pool!!  Bring your swimming
trunks for the cool and refreshing Chemical-free mountain stream fed pool!!
We will have FOOD, FUN, MUSIC, GAMES, SPORTS and RELAXATION!!

Saturday July 16th, 2005 at  9am!!  Get on the Bus!! Support ProLibertad!!
Meet at the corner of w179th St. and Broadway at 9am to catch one of our
Freedom Vans to HighLand Pools!!

Transportation from NYC ($10), Entrance to HighLand Pools ($5) and Food
($5); all together $20.  Contact ProLibertad to reserve a seat on our
Freedom Bus by calling 718-601-4751 or email ProLibertad@...

For more information on the ProLibertad Freedom Picnic, please contact
ProLibertad at ProLibertad@..., Bronx 718-601-4751, Manhattan
212-927-9065, New Jersey 201-435-3244.  Check out the website:
http://www.ProLibertadweb.com

Despierta Boricua is a weekly fifteen-minute Radio segment produced for WBAI
99.5 FM Friday Morning Wake UP Call by The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign.
Despierta Boricua airs at 6:45am, but is subject to re-scheduling depending
on the Station�s needs.

This week�s segment (Friday June 22nd) features an interview with the 
coordinators
of El Maestro; Help an important South Bronx institution stay alive; El 
Maestro: Cultural
& Educational Center, a project of UTBANY, Inc., is undergoing a critical 
financial situation
and needs your help to continue providing the community with much needed 
services.

Join us on Saturday, June 25th 8PM Featuring the Music of: Tato Torres & 
YERBABUENA: Boricua Roots Music Live Alex Javier "La Voz de Oro" 7 the 
Patriotic Poetry of: Prisionera Special Guest: Angel "Cholo" Espada, former 
WBA welterweight champion Minimum Donation: $25 Includes Dinner United 
Trainers and Boxers Association of New York, Inc. (UTBA, Inc.) is a 
non-profit organization whose mission is to improve the quality of life of 
the people in the community through social activities such as sports, 
cultural and educational programs. It houses two major projects: a sports 
center named after Juan Laporte, the Puerto Rican boxing champion, and a 
cultural and educational center named El Maestro after the Puerto Rican 
patriot, Dr. Pedro Albizu Campos.

Tune in every week to Despierta Boricua, whether you receive a reminder or 
not, 6:45am WBAI 99.5fm or via web stream, for those of you outside of NYC, 
http://www.wbai.org

Join ProLibertad on our annual Freedom Picnic to HighLands Pool in Ringwood,
New Jersey!!

Enjoy the sun, fun and relaxation of HighLands Pool!!  Bring your swimming
trunks for the cool and refreshing Chemical-free mountain stream fed pool!!
We will have FOOD, FUN, MUSIC, GAMES, SPORTS and RELAXATION!!

Saturday July 16th, 2005 at  9am!!  Get on the Bus!! Support ProLibertad!!
Meet at the corner of w179th St. and Broadway at 9am to catch one of our
Freedom Vans to HighLand Pools!!

Transportation from NYC ($10), Entrance to HighLand Pools ($5) and Food
($5); all together $20.  Contact ProLibertad to reserve a seat on our
Freedom Bus by calling 718-601-4751 or email ProLibertad@...

212-927-9065, New Jersey 201-435-3244.  Check out the website:

SUPPORT THE POPULAR EDUCATION PROJECT TO FREE THE CUBAN 5'S...

HAPPY BIRTHDAY GERARDO AND RAMON!!

On June 4th, Gerardo Hernandez Nordelo will be turning 40 years YOUNG and on
June 9th, Ramon Laba�ino Salazar will be turning 42 years YOUNG!!

Ramon and Gerardo are 2 of the 5 U.S. held Cuban Political Prisoners,
incarcerated for safe guarding the U.S. and Cuba from acts of terrorism!!

Join The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5, for a belated
birthday party for Ramon and Gerardo; help us raise commissary money for the
Cuban 5!!  Join  us as we party all night long with:

DJ Carlito and his All Latino Music Mix!!

DELICIOUS LATINO FOOD, MUSIC, AND DANCING!! NO SPEECHES!!

Friday July 1st, 2005 at 7pm
St. Mary�s Episcopal Church
521 W126th St.
(Between Amsterdam Ave. and Broadway)
Take the 1 or 9 Train to W125th St.

$10 Donation (no one will be turned away)

For more information on the Birthday Party contact The Popular Education
Project to Free the Cuban 5 at: Freethecuban5@... or call
718-601-4751  Website: Http://www.freethecuban5.com

PROLIBERTAD FREEDOM COOK OUT 2005/CELEBRATE ASSATA SHAKUR'S BIRTHDAY!!

Join ProLibertad on our annual Freedom Cook Out to HighLands Pool in 
Ringwood,
New Jersey!!

Enjoy the sun, fun and relaxation of HighLands Pool!!  Bring your swimming
trunks for the cool and refreshing Chemical-free mountain stream fed pool!!
We will have FOOD, FUN, MUSIC, GAMES, SPORTS and RELAXATION!!

**JOIN US AS WE CELEBRATE ASSATA SHAKUR�S BIRTHDAY!!**

Bring a cupcake, candle or musical instrument as we celebrate the life of 
our sister Assata Shakur!!

Saturday July 16th, 2005 at  9am!!  Get on the Bus!! Support ProLibertad!!
Meet at the corner of w179th St. and Broadway at 9am to catch one of our
Freedom Vans to HighLand Pools!!

Transportation from NYC ($10), Entrance to HighLand Pools ($5) and Food
($5); all together $20.  Contact ProLibertad to reserve a seat on our
Freedom Bus by calling 718-601-4751 or email ProLibertad@...

For more information on the ProLibertad Freedom Picnic, please contact
ProLibertad at ProLibertad@..., Bronx 718-601-4751, Manhattan
212-927-9065, New Jersey 201-435-3244.  Check out the website:
http://www.ProLibertadweb.com

Message:

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5
http://www.freethecuban5.com
Freethecuban5@...
Free the Cuban 5 Hotline: 718-601-4751

*******************************************************************************

Sign the Cuban 5 Petition "Family Visitation Petition" prepared by the 
Jericho Movement!!

Sign the Petition and get your friends and family to do so as well.  Also,
do not forget to send a letter to Attorney Alberto Gonzalez!!  Go to our
National Visa Campaign Page on our website and send out your support 
letter!!

www.PetitionOnline.com/cuban5/petition.html

June edition can be found at: http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclJune2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

Despierta Boricua is a weekly fifteen-minute Radio segment produced for WBAI
99.5 FM Friday Morning Wake UP Call by The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign.
Despierta Boricua airs at 6:45am, but is subject to re-scheduling depending
on the Station�s needs.

This week�s segment (Friday July 1st)) features an interview with Sarah 
Peisch
an environmentalist from Puerto Rico who will be talking with us about the
US corporate campaign to buy up and privatize the Puerto Rican coastline.

AFTER JULY 1ST DESPIERTA BORICUA WILL BE GOING ON HIATUS FOR THE
SUMMER; WE WILL BE BACK SEPTEMBER 2005!!

Tune in every week to Despierta Boricua, whether you receive a reminder or
not, 6:45am WBAI 99.5fm or via web stream, for those of you outside of NYC,
http://www.wbai.org
______________________________________________________________________________

SUPPORT THE POPULAR EDUCATION PROJECT TO FREE THE CUBAN 5...

HAPPY BIRTHDAY GERARDO AND RAMON!!

On June 4th, Gerardo Hernandez Nordelo will be turning 40 years YOUNG and on
June 9th, Ramon Laba�ino Salazar will be turning 42 years YOUNG!!

Ramon and Gerardo are 2 of the 5 U.S. held Cuban Political Prisoners,
incarcerated for safe guarding the U.S. and Cuba from acts of terrorism!!

Join The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5, for a belated
birthday party for Ramon and Gerardo; help us raise commissary money for the
Cuban 5!!  Join  us as we party all night long with:

DJ Carlito and his All Latino Music Mix!!

DELICIOUS LATINO FOOD, MUSIC, AND DANCING!! NO SPEECHES!!

Friday July 1st, 2005 at 7pm
St. Mary�s Episcopal Church
521 W126th St.
(Between Amsterdam Ave. and Broadway)
Take the 1 or 9 Train to W125th St.

$10 Donation (no one will be turned away)

For more information on the Birthday Party contact The Popular Education
Project to Free the Cuban 5 at: Freethecuban5@... or call
718-601-4751
Website: Http://www.freethecuban5.com

Subject:ProLibertad Cookout/Celebrate Assata Shakur
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

PROLIBERTAD FREEDOM COOK OUT 2005/CELEBRATE ASSATA SHAKUR'S BIRTHDAY!!

Join ProLibertad on our annual Freedom Cook Out to HighLands Pool in
Ringwood, New Jersey!!

Enjoy the sun, fun and relaxation of HighLands Pool!! Bring your swimming
trunks for the cool and refreshing Chemical-free mountain stream fed pool!!
We will have FOOD, FUN, MUSIC, GAMES, SPORTS and RELAXATION!!

**JOIN US AS WE CELEBRATE ASSATA SHAKUR�S BIRTHDAY!!**

Bring a cupcake, candle or musical instrument as we celebrate the life of
our sister Assata Shakur!!

Saturday July 16th, 2005 at 9am!! Get on the Bus!! Support ProLibertad!!
Meet at the corner of w179th St. and Broadway at 9am to catch one of our
Freedom Vans to HighLand Pools!!

Transportation from NYC ($10), Entrance to HighLand Pools ($5) and Food
($5); all together $20. Contact ProLibertad to reserve a seat on our
Freedom Bus by calling 718-601-4751 or email ProLibertad@...

For more information on the ProLibertad Freedom Picnic, please contact
ProLibertad at ProLibertad@..., Bronx 718-601-4751, Manhattan
212-927-9065, New Jersey 201-435-3244. Check out the website:
http://www.ProLibertadweb.com

our sister Assata Shakur!!

Post ID:3727
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-07-03 18:12:23
Subject:Article on Oscar Lopez Rivera
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

Download a copy of El Coqui Libre, ProLibertad�s monthly newsletter; our
July edition can be found at: http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclJuly2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

Several months ago, ProLibertad  reported on Oscar Lopez Rivera�s transfer; 
this article was written by Jan Susler for the National Boricua  Human 
Rights Network about Oscar current conditions


Posted Tuesday, June 28, 2005

April of this year marked the 25th anniversary of the arrest of eleven 
Puerto Rican political prisoners. April also marked the opening of an art 
exhibit featuring paintings and ceramics created by two remaining Puerto 
Rican political prisoners, Oscar L�pez Rivera and Carlos Alberto Torres... 
an exhibit scheduled to travel throughout the United States and Latin 
America. Not coincidentally, after having served 24 years of a 70 year 
sentence, April also marked Oscar�s unsolicited transfer from one maximum 
security prison to another... a prison where he not only has more difficulty 
maintaining his health and his family and community ties, but where painting 
is virtually impossible.

While prison officials would undoubtedly deny that Oscar�s transfer was 
punitive, its consequences are undeniably punitive. The new prison is not 
simply a disruption of his routine, not a mere matter of the inconvenience 
of the new requirements to be always fully dressed in khaki uniform and 
boots (U.S. military castoffs, all), or weathering the elements�without 
benefit of rain gear�as he makes his way from the cellblock to chow, or 
sleeping on the small plastic mattress that makes noise with every move. The 
new prison even further restricts his already restricted contact with the 
outside world. Visits from friends and family, never encouraged, are 
actively discouraged at the new prison. In June, his family was made to wait 
close to three hours before granted entry, while a sole officer ploddingly 
processed other visitors through drug testing and paper pushing, leaving 
only a few hours for the visit. And they were lucky, as some families were 
turned away completely, either for mistaken drug test results� which has 
previously happened with Oscar�s family---or because the officer took so 
frightfully long processing other families, the visiting day ended before he 
reached many of those waiting.

News media, which have interviewed Oscar in virtually every prison in which 
he has been held, is turned away. For example, Univision�s May request to 
interview him was spurned, allegedly due to �security,� although media was 
granted access to him in the more maximum security prisons in years 
previous. Such a ban only increases the risk to Oscar and others held there, 
as it lulls prison authorities to act with impunity and prevents public 
access to a public institution. Witness recent disclosures of the military�s 
refusal to allow media or United Nations access to staff or detainees at 
Guant�namo, not only hiding from public light their ongoing torture, but 
ensuring that it may continue with impunity. Ever since the United States 
began to use Guant�namo as a �terrorist� detention camp, United Nations 
human rights investigators have sought to visit Guant�namo and obtain full 
access to the facilities and prison population, but the U.S. has never 
allowed such access. The military refused to give the New York Times 
permission to interview physicians at Guant�namo about their having aided 
interrogators in conducting and refining coercive interrogations of 
detainees, including providing advice on how to increase stress levels and 
exploit fears, with a purpose of helping interrogators break the detainees.

Painting, one of the few outlets of creative expression available to him at 
the previous penitentiary, was simply not available when he arrived. 
Officials �lost� the majority of his painting supplies in the move to the 
new prison, but those can be replaced, albeit at great expense. The problem 
lies in the supposed lack of space. The problem is that, in the huge new 
prison, fashioned of large buildings, officials have refused to designate 
adequate space for this positive activity, creating in its place 
frustration. Having seen the tiny space available, he writes, �The area 
designated for us to paint is about the size of a cell, without any 
ventilation, sink or proper lighting. There are four easels standing and 
there�s no more room. There are about ten prisoners who paint. So right now 
I don�t know if I�m going to be able to continue painting.�

Exercise, another of the few outlets available in the previous penitentiary, 
has likewise been limited. At age 62, Oscar has managed to remain healthy, 
energetic, and productive in spite of, not because of, his surroundings. At 
the new prison, however, his ability to maintain his health is threatened by 
new limitations, such as no equipment to exercise the upper body (no 
weights, pull-up bars, dip bars), and a hard surface track that is bound to 
injure the joints with repeated use. His skin, extremely sensitive since his 
exposure to Agent Orange in Viet Nam, requires special soap which he is not 
sure will be available through the commissary of the new prison. He already 
knows that dental floss, so necessary for the prevention of tooth decay and 
gum disease, is considered a security risk and is therefore not available.

These conditions must be put in the overall perspective of the new 
penitentiary. The team responsible for designing and building it proudly 
describes their project: �Twenty-first century correctional facility design 
emphasizes security, function and workability, new technologies, staff 
efficiency and livability.� A construction magazine glorifies the structure 
as follows: �An inwardly focused series of more than a dozen buildings 
offers inmates little opportunity to look out of the site and dream of 
escape.� �A secured corridor of enclosed space surrounds the compound. The 
corridor's interior wall is the back sides of the housing pods, and the 
exterior wall is composed of precast concrete wall panels, described the 
construction company�s vice president. Beyond that is "no man's land" and 
three circuits of taut-wire fencing. Six guard towers with sight lines into 
the compound are just outside the fencing, and a seventh guard tower is back 
in the middle of the compound.� �Closed-circuit TV cameras monitor the 
prison's critical areas, and a control room outside the secured perimeter 
can open and close key access points into structures that include the 
housing pods, the secured corridor and the main entrance.

The 960 cells measure approximately 7 feet wide by 14 feet long, fabricated 
of precast concrete. The cells are formed as five-sided boxes - four walls 
and a roof. Two cells, one atop another, make up a unit. A balcony fronts 
the upper cell.

And, yes, the new prison includes a �special housing unit� where the federal 
death penalty will be carried out.

Oscar is ever clear in the reason why he is where he is, sure of who he is, 
and of his commitment to the independence of his nation, and even though he 
patiently and optimistically adjusts to the new surroundings, all the while 
resisting the encroaching limitations, living the salutation all his letters 
bear: �en resistencia y lucha� [in resistance and struggle]. However, since 
911, prison conditions have worsened across the board, especially 
jeopardizing the health, safety and lives of our political prisoners. A 
reporter with extensive experience covering U.S. prisons and jails, 
remarking on the revelations of torture in Abu Ghraib, said, �the images 
from Iraq looked all too American to me,� noting similar patterns of 
physical and psychological abuse in the atmosphere of increasing 
militarization of imprisonment in the U.S. We must therefore be vigilant of 
his human rights while we make every effort to achieve his and Carlos 
Alberto�s release.

The new address:

Oscar L�pez Rivera
#87651-024
USP Terre Haute
P.O. Box 12015
Terre Haute, IN 47801

Financial contributions in the form of postal money orders to help him 
purchase art supplies and pay for telephone calls must be sent to:

Federal Bureau of Prisons
Oscar L�pez Rivera #87651-024
P.O. Box 474701
Des Moines, IA 50947-0001





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Rights Network about Oscar current conditions


Posted Tuesday, June 28, 2005

allowed such access. The military refused to give the New York Times 
permission to interview physicians at Guant�namo about their having aided

detainees, including providing advice on how to increase stress levels and 
exploit fears, with a purpose of helping interrogators break the detainees.

new prison, but those can be replaced, albeit at great expense. The problem

prison, fashioned of large buildings, officials have refused to designate 
adequate space for this positive activity, creating in its place

designated for us to paint is about the size of a cell, without any 
ventilation, sink or proper lighting. There are four easels standing and 
there�s no more room. There are about ten prisoners who paint. So right now 
I don�t know if I�m going to be able to continue painting.�

Exercise, another of the few outlets available in the previous penitentiary, 
has likewise been limited. At age 62, Oscar has managed to remain healthy, 
energetic, and productive in spite of, not because of, his surroundings. At 
the new prison, however, his ability to maintain his health is threatened by

weights, pull-up bars, dip bars), and a hard surface track that is bound to

emphasizes security, function and workability, new technologies, staff 
efficiency and livability.� A construction magazine glorifies the structure

offers inmates little opportunity to look out of the site and dream of 
escape.� �A secured corridor of enclosed space surrounds the compound. The 
corridor's interior wall is the back sides of the housing pods, and the 
exterior wall is composed of precast concrete wall panels, described the 
construction company�s vice president. Beyond that is "no man's land" and 
three circuits of taut-wire fencing. Six guard towers with sight lines into 
the compound are just outside the fencing, and a seventh guard tower is back 
in the middle of the compound.� �Closed-circuit TV cameras monitor the 
prison's critical areas, and a control room outside the secured perimeter

death penalty will be carried out.

and of his commitment to the independence of his nation, and even though he 
patiently and optimistically adjusts to the new surroundings, all the while

bear: �en resistencia y lucha� [in resistance and struggle]. However, since 
911, prison conditions have worsened across the board, especially 
jeopardizing the health, safety and lives of our political prisoners. A 
reporter with extensive experience covering U.S. prisons and jails, 
remarking on the revelations of torture in Abu Ghraib, said, �the images 
from Iraq looked all too American to me,� noting similar patterns of 
physical and psychological abuse in the atmosphere of increasing 
militarization of imprisonment in the U.S. We must therefore be vigilant of 
his human rights while we make every effort to achieve his and Carlos 
Alberto�s release.

http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclJuly2005.pdf

PROLIBERTAD FREEDOM COOK OUT 2005/CELEBRATE ASSATA SHAKUR'S BIRTHDAY!!

Join ProLibertad on our annual Freedom Cook Out to HighLands Pool in
Ringwood, New Jersey!!

Enjoy the sun, fun and relaxation of HighLands Pool!! Bring your swimming
trunks for the cool and refreshing Chemical-free mountain stream fed pool!!
We will have FOOD, FUN, MUSIC, GAMES, SPORTS and RELAXATION!!

**JOIN US AS WE CELEBRATE ASSATA SHAKUR�S BIRTHDAY!!**

Bring a cupcake, candle or musical instrument as we celebrate the life of
our sister Assata Shakur!!

Saturday July 16th, 2005 at 9am!! Get on the Bus!! Support ProLibertad!!
Meet at the corner of w179th St. and Broadway at 9am to catch one of our
Freedom Vans to HighLand Pools!!

Transportation from NYC ($10), Entrance to HighLand Pools ($5) and Food
($5); all together $20. Contact ProLibertad to reserve a seat on our
Freedom Bus by calling 718-601-4751 or email ProLibertad@...

For more information on the ProLibertad Freedom Picnic, please contact
ProLibertad at ProLibertad@..., Bronx 718-601-4751, Manhattan
212-927-9065, New Jersey 201-435-3244. Check out the website:
http://www.ProLibertadweb.com
