brother Alberto �Tito Kayak� DeJesus!

Tito Kayak, a Puerto Rican environmentalist and civil disobedient, was
arrested on Monday June 13th, 2005 for attempting to lower the United
Nations flag and replacing it with the Puerto Rican flag; this was an
another attempt to call attention to the colonial condition of Puerto Rico
and to the contamination on the island of Vieques!! As many of you
remember, Tito Kayak was responsible for hanging the Puerto Rican and
Vieques flags from the Statue of Liberty on November 2001. Tito was
sentenced to jail for this act of civil disobedience and served his time in
New York City and Puerto Rico.

Subject:Sign the Letter to Free the Cuban 5!!
Message:

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5
http://www.freethecuban5.com
Freethecuban5@...
Free the Cuban 5 Hotline: 718-601-4751

******************************************************************************
Download The Project Sept. Edition Newsletter: 
http://www.freethecuban5.com/JF5September2005.pdf

******************************************************************************

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5 is calling on all peoples 
to support the international campaign to sign on the letter to Attorney 
General Alberto Gonzalez ro demand the FREEDOM OF THE CUBAN 5!!

Forward this email throughout your address books and link this link to your 
websites!!

The time is now to put pressure on the US government to free the Cuban 5!!  
After the Aug. 9th decision of the 11th Cicuit Court of Appeals 
(http://www.freethecuban5.com/page16.html)  and the Decision by the UN 
Working group on Arbritrary Detentions, the the time is now to keep putting 
pressure on the US government!!

The People free Political prisoners!!  Add your name to the list of 
support!!

http://www.liberenlos5.cult.cu/index.php?lang=2

Post ID:3805
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-09-23 23:44:44
Subject:Puerto Rican Leader FILIBERTO OJEDA ASSASSINATED
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

DOWNLOAD THE SEPTEMBER EDITION OF EL COQUI LIBRE; ProLibertad's newsletter:
http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclSeptember2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

DENOUNCE THE ASSASSINATION OF FILIBERTO OJEDA RIOS!!

MONDAY SEPT. 26TH, AT 5PM
PROTEST AT 26 FEDERAL PLAZA
(Subway: 4, 5, 6, J, M to Brooklyn Bridge; A, C, E to Chambers St.; R, N to 
Canal St)

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is calling on all our allies and supporters 
of justice to join us on Monday Sept. 26th at 5pm at 26 Federal Plaza to 
denounce the assassination of Puerto Rican revolutionary leader Filiberto 
Ojeda Rios, leader of the clandestine revolutionary organization called El 
Ejercito Popular Boricua-Macheteros (The Popular Boricua Army-Machete 
Wielders)!!

On Friday Sept. 23rd, in a massive Federal Bureau of Investigation (F.B.I.) 
operation in the town of Hormigueros, Puerto Rico, Filiberto Ojeda Rios, 
leader of the clandestine revolutionary organization called El Ejercito 
Popular Boricua-Macheteros (The Popular Boricua Army-Machete Wielders) was 
assassinated by an FBI sniper.

During the ensuing gun battle, Beatriz Rosado Barbosa, Ojeda Rios� wife, was 
critically wounded and then arrested, along with an F.B.I. agent. Both are 
presently hospitalized, and a third man has yet to be identified by 
authorities.

This assassination is an attack against the Puerto Rican Independence 
movement that cannot go unanswered!!  We must mobilize and organize a 
response to this heinous act of murder. Ojeda Rios represented the 
revolutionary spirit and morality of the Puerto Rican independence 
movement!!

The FBI chose to assassinate Ojeda Rios on Friday Sept. 23rd (Known as  El 
Grito de Lares, a celebration of the anti-colonial resistance movement in 
Puerto Rico) as a message to the independence movement; the US government is 
trying to tell us that if we resist, then we will be murdered like Ojeda 
Rios, Don Pedro Albizu Campos, Angel Rodrgiuez Cristobal and the many other 
Puerto Rican patriots that have fallen at the hands of the US governement.

We will not be scared or initmidated.  The power of the people cannot be 
stopped!!  We make freedom happen; we make liberation happen!!

WE WILL RISE, RESIST AND REBEL!!  Join us in our outrage, mourning and 
resistance!!  Wear a black arm band, wear all black, bring your niose 
makers, your flags and your 25 closest friends to the protest!!  MOBILIZE IN 
THE SPIRIT OF FILIBERTO!!

��FILIBERTO OJEDA RIOS PRESENTE!!
��FILIBERTO VIVE, LA LUCHA SIGUE!!





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Post ID:3807
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-09-24 17:37:49
Subject:Wife of Filiberto in Jail/125 arrests pending...
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

DOWNLOAD THE SEPTEMBER EDITION OF EL COQUI LIBRE; ProLibertad's newsletter:
http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclSeptember2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE

Contact: Benjamin Ramos 718-601-4751
ProLibertad@...


WIFE OF ASSASSINATED PUERTO RICAN LEADER FILIBERTO OJEDA RIOS IN FEDRAL 
PENITENTIARY IN PUERTO RICO; FBI READY TO ARRESTS 125 ALLEGED MACHETERO 
SUPPORTERS

Saturday September 24, 2005, New York, NY-The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign 
denounces the incarceration of Beatriz Rosado Barbosa, who is now the 6th 
PUERTO RICAN POLITICAL PRISONER incarcerated in U.S. jails.  Beatriz Rosado 
Barbosa, wife of assassinated Machetero leader Filiberto Ojeda Rios, was 
injured yesterday during the gun battle in Hormigueros, Puerto Rico that 
took Ojeda Rios' life.  Rosado Barbosa is incarcerated in the federal prison 
in Guaynabo, Puerto Rico.

As of yet, there are no charges lobbied against her; Rosado Barbos is 
presently being supported by thousands of Puerto Rican activists, community 
members, and clergy outside of the federal penitentiary.

According to Puerto Rican news sources, the FBI has begun to write out 
arrests order for 125 people suspected of being Machetero supporters. The 
FBI is attempting another set of mass arrests; similar to the arrests that 
took place in Puerto Rico in April 1985 when nearly 400 FBI agents invaded 
Puerto Rico arresting any person they thought was a Machetero or who might 
be a supporter of the Macheteros.  Those arrests were an attempt to destroy 
the clandestine revolutionary movement and to send a clear message to all 
independentistas; if you resist, you will be arrested.

This new "independentista witchhunt" will not intimidate or detour the work 
to free the Puerto Rican political prisoners, attain the 4 demands of the 
people of Vieques, and the liberation of Puerto Rico.  The Puerto Rican 
people have been organizing protests, vigils and pickets throughout the 
island in the spirit and in honor of Ojeda Rios.

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is calling a PROTEST ON MONDAY SEPT. 26TH 
AT 5PM AT 26 FEDERAL PLAZA to denounce the assassination of Ojeda Rios, the 
incarceration of Rosado barbosa and this new wave of repression agains tthe 
Puerto Rican indpendence movement!!

Subway: 4, 5, 6, J, M to Brooklyn Bridge; A, C, E to Chambers St.; R, N to 
Canal St

-END-





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:3808
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-09-24 17:38:15
Subject:Wife of Filiberto in Jail/125 arrests pending...
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

DOWNLOAD THE SEPTEMBER EDITION OF EL COQUI LIBRE; ProLibertad's newsletter:
http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclSeptember2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE

Contact: Benjamin Ramos 718-601-4751
ProLibertad@...


WIFE OF ASSASSINATED PUERTO RICAN LEADER FILIBERTO OJEDA RIOS IN FEDRAL 
PENITENTIARY IN PUERTO RICO; FBI READY TO ARRESTS 125 ALLEGED MACHETERO 
SUPPORTERS

Saturday September 24, 2005, New York, NY-The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign 
denounces the incarceration of Beatriz Rosado Barbosa, who is now the 6th 
PUERTO RICAN POLITICAL PRISONER incarcerated in U.S. jails.  Beatriz Rosado 
Barbosa, wife of assassinated Machetero leader Filiberto Ojeda Rios, was 
injured yesterday during the gun battle in Hormigueros, Puerto Rico that 
took Ojeda Rios' life.  Rosado Barbosa is incarcerated in the federal prison 
in Guaynabo, Puerto Rico.

As of yet, there are no charges lobbied against her; Rosado Barbos is 
presently being supported by thousands of Puerto Rican activists, community 
members, and clergy outside of the federal penitentiary.

According to Puerto Rican news sources, the FBI has begun to write out 
arrests order for 125 people suspected of being Machetero supporters. The 
FBI is attempting another set of mass arrests; similar to the arrests that 
took place in Puerto Rico in April 1985 when nearly 400 FBI agents invaded 
Puerto Rico arresting any person they thought was a Machetero or who might 
be a supporter of the Macheteros.  Those arrests were an attempt to destroy 
the clandestine revolutionary movement and to send a clear message to all 
independentistas; if you resist, you will be arrested.

This new "independentista witchhunt" will not intimidate or detour the work 
to free the Puerto Rican political prisoners, attain the 4 demands of the 
people of Vieques, and the liberation of Puerto Rico.  The Puerto Rican 
people have been organizing protests, vigils and pickets throughout the 
island in the spirit and in honor of Ojeda Rios.

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is calling a PROTEST ON MONDAY SEPT. 26TH 
AT 5PM AT 26 FEDERAL PLAZA to denounce the assassination of Ojeda Rios, the 
incarceration of Rosado barbosa and this new wave of repression agains tthe 
Puerto Rican indpendence movement!!

Subway: 4, 5, 6, J, M to Brooklyn Bridge; A, C, E to Chambers St.; R, N to 
Canal St

-END-

Post ID:3809
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-09-26 12:33:42
Subject:PPROTEST THE ASSASSINATION OF FILIBERTO OJEDA!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

DOWNLOAD THE SEPTEMBER EDITION OF EL COQUI LIBRE; ProLibertad's newsletter:
http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclSeptember2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

DENOUNCE THE ASSASSINATION OF FILIBERTO OJEDA RIOS!!

MONDAY SEPT. 26TH, AT 5PM
PROTEST AT 26 FEDERAL PLAZA
(Subway: 4, 5, 6, J, M to Brooklyn Bridge; A, C, E to Chambers St.; R, N to
Canal St)

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is calling on all our allies and supporters
of justice to join us on Monday Sept. 26th at 5pm at 26 Federal Plaza to
denounce the assassination of Puerto Rican revolutionary leader Filiberto
Ojeda Rios, leader of the clandestine revolutionary organization called El
Ejercito Popular Boricua-Macheteros (The Popular Boricua Army-Machete
Wielders)!!

On Friday Sept. 23rd, in a massive Federal Bureau of Investigation (F.B.I.)
operation in the town of Hormigueros, Puerto Rico, Filiberto Ojeda Rios,
leader of the clandestine revolutionary organization called El Ejercito
Popular Boricua-Macheteros (The Popular Boricua Army-Machete Wielders) was
assassinated by an FBI sniper.

During the ensuing gun battle, Beatriz Rosado Barbosa, Ojeda Rios� wife, was
critically wounded and then arrested, along with an F.B.I. agent.

This assassination is an attack against the Puerto Rican Independence
movement that cannot go unanswered!!  We must mobilize and organize a
response to this heinous act of murder. Ojeda Rios represented the
revolutionary spirit and morality of the Puerto Rican independence
movement!!

The FBI chose to assassinate Ojeda Rios on Friday Sept. 23rd (Known as  El
Grito de Lares, a celebration of the anti-colonial resistance movement in
Puerto Rico) as a message to the independence movement; the US government is
trying to tell us that if we resist, then we will be murdered like Ojeda
Rios, Don Pedro Albizu Campos, Angel Rodrgiuez Cristobal and the many other
Puerto Rican patriots that have fallen at the hands of the US governement.

We will not be scared or initmidated.  The power of the people cannot be
stopped!!  We make freedom happen; we make liberation happen!!

WE WILL RISE, RESIST AND REBEL!!  Join us in our outrage, mourning and
resistance!!  Wear a black arm band, wear all black, bring your niose
makers, your flags and your 25 closest friends to the protest!!  MOBILIZE IN
THE SPIRIT OF FILIBERTO!!

��FILIBERTO OJEDA RIOS PRESENTE!!
��FILIBERTO VIVE, LA LUCHA SIGUE!!

Subject:Sept. 28th Vigil for Filiberto Ojeda/Oct. 11th Tito Kayak
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244

DOWNLOAD THE SEPTEMBER EDITION OF EL COQUI LIBRE; ProLibertad's newsletter:
http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclSeptember2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

SPECIAL LIVE Despierta Boricua Segment this Friday Sept. 30th from 7am-8am 
dedicated to Filiberto Ojeda Rios!!  We will include an update on what has 
happened in Puerto Rico, hear local reaction to Filiberto's assassination; 
there will be many guests from Puerto Rico and New York.

Please join us and listen on at 7am-8am on Friday Morning Wake Up Call WBAI 
99.5 FM as we celebrate, mourn and outrage at the political assassination of 
Filiberto Ojeda Rios.

For any questions, comments or ideas consult the ProLibertad web blog:
http://www.prolibertadweb.com/ProLibFreedomBlog/
______________________________________________________________________________

VIGIL TO REMEMBER FILIBERTO OJEDA RIOS

Wed., Sept. 28, 2005 @ 6 p.m.
Julia de Burgos Cultural Center
1680 Lexington Avenue (bet. E. 105 & 106th Streets)
El Barrio (6 train to 103rd Str.)

Program will include:
--testimonials from people returning from Puerto Rico
--update from community leaders
--elected officials on the call for an investigation
--open mike for reflection
--anouncement of work meeting
--distribution of informational handout
______________________________________________________________________________

JUSTICE FOR TITO KAYAK!!
TUESDAY OCTOBER 11TH, 2005 AT 9AM
MANHATTAN CRIMINAL COURT 100 CENTRE ST.
Subway: 4, 5, 6, J, M to Chambers St./Brooklyn Bridge; A, C, E to Chambers
St.; R, N to Canal St.

Join ProLibertad and the friends of Tito Kayak in NYC, as we support our
brother Alberto �Tito Kayak� DeJesus!

Tito Kayak, a Puerto Rican environmentalist and civil disobedient, was
arrested on Monday June 13th, 2005 for attempting to lower the United
Nations flag and replacing it with the Puerto Rican flag; this was an
another attempt to call attention to the colonial condition of Puerto Rico
and to the contamination on the island of Vieques!! As many of you
remember, Tito Kayak was responsible for hanging the Puerto Rican and
Vieques flags from the Statue of Liberty on November 2001. Tito was
sentenced to jail for this act of civil disobedience and served his time in
New York City and Puerto Rico.

Tito�s hearing was scheduled for Thursday Sept. 8th at 9am; ProLibertad, the
Friends of Tito Kayak and Long time Vieques activist Ismael Guadalupe
supported Tito as his trial was scheduled for Tuesday October 11th, 2005 at
9am!!

Tito is facing a Class B misdemeanor charge of trespassing; if found guilty
he will have to serve 90 days in jail!! Tito�s felony charge of Reckless
endangerment was dropped!! Tito should not serve one day in jail!!

TAKE THE DAY OFF FROM WORK!!
SUPPORT TITO KAYAK!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is calling on all of your allies to support 
TITO KAYAK on the morning of Oct. 11th at his court hearing.  In this time 
of repression, tragedy and uncertainty, we have to keep the pressure and 
support on; TITO needs us to stand with him.

We cannot allow another Boricua revolutionary go to jail; with repression at 
our heels, we have to stand strong and firm.  In the spirit of Filiberto, we 
ask all folks to unite in support TITO.

NO MORE PUERTO RICAN POLITICAL PRISONERS!!

JUSTICE FOR TITO KAYAK!!
TUESDAY OCTOBER 11TH, 2005 AT 9AM
MANHATTAN CRIMINAL COURT 100 CENTRE ST.

St.; R, N to Canal St.

arrested on Monday June 13th, 2005 for attempting to lower the United
Nations flag and replacing it with the Puerto Rican flag; this was an
another attempt to call attention to the colonial condition of Puerto Rico
and to the contamination on the island of Vieques!! As many of you
remember, Tito Kayak was responsible for hanging the Puerto Rican and
Vieques flags from the Statue of Liberty on November 2001. Tito was

Tito�s hearing was scheduled for Thursday Sept. 8th at 9am; ProLibertad, the
Friends of Tito Kayak and Long time Vieques activist Ismael Guadalupe

9am!!

Post ID:3819
Sender:"FreetheCuban5 LibertadparalosCinco" <freethecuban5@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-10-02 14:36:25
Subject:Project Meeting/Sign the Cuban letter...
Message:

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5
http://www.freethecuban5.com
Freethecuban5@...
Free the Cuban 5 Hotline: 718-601-4751

******************************************************************************
Download The Project Sept. Edition Newsletter:
http://www.freethecuban5.com/JF5September2005.pdf

******************************************************************************

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5 is calling a meeting in 
New York City on Tuesday October 4th at 7pm at St. Mary's Church 521 W126th 
St. between browadway and Amsterdam Avenue in Harlem, NYC.  We will 
discussing upcoming events, projects, and activities.

All people are invited to attend and support this meeting and our work.

******************************************************************************

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5 is calling on all peoples
to support the international campaign to sign on the letter to Attorney
General Alberto Gonzalez ro demand the FREEDOM OF THE CUBAN 5!!

Forward this email throughout your address books and link this link to your
websites!!

The time is now to put pressure on the US government to free the Cuban 5!!
After the Aug. 9th decision of the 11th Cicuit Court of Appeals
(http://www.freethecuban5.com/page16.html) and the Decision by the UN
Working group on Arbritrary Detentions, the the time is now to keep putting
pressure on the US government!!

The People free Political prisoners!! Add your name to the list of
support!!

http://www.liberenlos5.cult.cu/index.php?lang=2

http://www.freethecuban5.com/JF5September2005.pdf

******************************************************************************

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5 is calling a meeting in 
New York City on Tuesday October 4th at 7pm at St. Mary's Church 521 W126th 
St. between browadway and Amsterdam Avenue in Harlem, NYC.  We will 
discussing upcoming events, projects, and activities.

All people are invited to attend and support this meeting and our work.

******************************************************************************

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5 is calling on all peoples
to support the international campaign to sign on the letter to Attorney
General Alberto Gonzalez ro demand the FREEDOM OF THE CUBAN 5!!

Forward this email throughout your address books and link this link to your
websites!!

The time is now to put pressure on the US government to free the Cuban 5!!
After the Aug. 9th decision of the 11th Cicuit Court of Appeals
(http://www.freethecuban5.com/page16.html) and the Decision by the UN
Working group on Arbritrary Detentions, the the time is now to keep putting
pressure on the US government!!

The People free Political prisoners!! Add your name to the list of
support!!

http://www.liberenlos5.cult.cu/index.php?lang=2

Post ID:3821
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-10-03 22:07:44
Subject:DB Segment/Tito Kayak
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

DOWNLOAD THE SEPTEMBER EDITION OF EL COQUI LIBRE; ProLibertad's newsletter:
http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclOctober2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

This week there will be no Despierta Boricua segment this week, please check 
back next week for
a segment on Friday Oct. 14th at 6:45am.  If you have any questions, 
comments, or any segment ideas please make post thom on our webblog:

http://www.prolibertadweb.com/ProLibFreedomBlog/
_______________________________________________________________________________

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is calling on all of your allies to support
TITO KAYAK on the morning of Oct. 11th at his court hearing.  In this time
of repression, tragedy and uncertainty, we have to keep the pressure and
support on; TITO needs us to stand with him.

We cannot allow another Boricua revolutionary go to jail; with repression at
our heels, we have to stand strong and firm.  In the spirit of Filiberto, we
ask all folks to unite in support TITO.

NO MORE PUERTO RICAN POLITICAL PRISONERS!!

JUSTICE FOR TITO KAYAK!!
TUESDAY OCTOBER 11TH, 2005 AT 9AM
MANHATTAN CRIMINAL COURT 100 CENTRE ST.
Subway: 4, 5, 6, J, M to Chambers St./Brooklyn Bridge; A, C, E to Chambers
St.; R, N to Canal St.

Join ProLibertad and the friends of Tito Kayak in NYC, as we support our
brother Alberto �Tito Kayak� DeJesus!

Tito Kayak, a Puerto Rican environmentalist and civil disobedient, was
arrested on Monday June 13th, 2005 for attempting to lower the United
Nations flag and replacing it with the Puerto Rican flag; this was an
another attempt to call attention to the colonial condition of Puerto Rico
and to the contamination on the island of Vieques!! As many of you
remember, Tito Kayak was responsible for hanging the Puerto Rican and
Vieques flags from the Statue of Liberty on November 2001. Tito was
sentenced to jail for this act of civil disobedience and served his time in
New York City and Puerto Rico.

Tito�s hearing was scheduled for Thursday Sept. 8th at 9am; ProLibertad, the
Friends of Tito Kayak and Long time Vieques activist Ismael Guadalupe
supported Tito as his trial was scheduled for Tuesday October 11th, 2005 at
9am!!

Tito is facing a Class B misdemeanor charge of trespassing; if found guilty
he will have to serve 90 days in jail!! Tito�s felony charge of Reckless
endangerment was dropped!! Tito should not serve one day in jail!!

TAKE THE DAY OFF FROM WORK!!
SUPPORT TITO KAYAK!!

Post ID:3823
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-10-06 12:40:23
Subject:Filiberto Ojeda tribute Journal
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
Http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

The Political Assassination of Filiberto Ojedas Rios has catalyzed the 
formation of a New York based coalition of Puerto Rican organizations and 
individuals to organize a political tribute to the life and political work 
of Filiberto Ojeda Rios on Saturday Nov. 19th (the venue to be announced).

The coalition has chosen to create a commemorative journal for this event; 
we are asking organizations and individuals to support this endeavor by 
buying ad space within the journal.  We are asking for solidarity statements 
that are Camera Ready pdf, jpg or psd.

If your statement is text based, then we will format it for you from emails 
or Word documents.  The prices and sizes are :

1)  One page (7.5 x 10):  $200
2.) Half page (7.5 x 4.75): $100
3.) Quarter page (3.5 x 4.75): $50
4.) Business card (3.5 x 2.25): $35
5.) 12 word greeting: $25

We are asking that all ads be sent to mateare@... and 
ProLibertad@...

All checks should be made out to: IFCO/November 19th Tribute and should be 
sent to:

IFCO/Pastors for Peace
418 W145th St.
NY, NY, 10031
_______________________________________________________________________________

Slain Puerto Rican Rebel Didn�t Have To Die
Juan Gonzalez
NY Daily News
Thursday, October 6, 2005

A former naval intelligence officer says he knows for a fact that Puerto 
Rican nationalist fugitive Filiberto Ojeda Rios didn�t have to die in a 
shootout with the FBI.

He says he knows this because he told FBI agents a year ago where they could 
find Ojeda � even telling them where he liked to eat.

�What they did was an injustice,�  the former Navy officer told me last 
week.  �No matter what Ojeda did, he was still a human being . . . . They 
could easily have taken him alive.�

The informant, who asked not to be identified, has given his full account to 
the Justice Department�s Inspector General�s Office, which opened an 
independent review of the shooting last week.

FBI Director Robert Mueller requested the review after top officials from 
the island�s various political parties, including pro-commonwealth Gov. 
Anibal Acevedo Vil�, and several members of New York�s congressional 
delegation publicly criticized the FBI�s handling of the incident.

And yesterday the Puerto Rican commonwealth�s own Department of Justice 
subpoenaed weapons and records of the FBI�s operation.

By the time of his death, 72-year-old Ojeda, a onetime musician turned 
revolutionary, had become a legendary figure on the island.

A founder of the militant pro-independence group called the Macheteros, he 
had been on the run since 1990 for his role in a $7 million Wells Fargo 
armed robbery in Hartford in 1983.

During all those years, Ojeda frequently gave interviews to Puerto Rican 
reporters, routinely disseminated pro-independence proclamations, and was 
even spotted at times at protest marches.

Despite a reward on his head that reached $1.1 million, he popped up so 
often in public that Puerto Ricans openly joked about the FBI�s apparent 
inability to find him.

But on the afternoon of Sept. 23, a special team of agents dispatched from 
the United States surrounded Ojeda�s farmhouse hideout in Hormigueros, a 
small town near the island�s western coast.

According to the official version, Ojeda opened fire from inside while 
agents moved in to arrest him.  One agent was wounded and Ojeda was shot 
beneath the clavicle in the initial shootout.

The fugitive�s wife, who was with him at the time, surrendered immediately.  
She later claimed the agents opened fire without warning and that her 
husband offered to give up in the presence of well-known Puerto Rican 
journalist Jesus Davila, but agents refused.

Over the next 20 hours, the FBI team sealed off the area and would not allow 
Puerto Rican police near the scene.  By the time they entered the house the 
next day, Ojeda had bled to death.

The long delay, officials say, was caused by waiting for bomb detection 
units to arrive and check for possible booby-trap.

But even those who oppose Ojeda�s  radical views and methods aren�t buying 
that account.

Many are especially furious at the timing of the operation.

Sept. 23 is the anniversary of El Grito de Lares, Puerto Rico�s failed 1868 
independence revolt against Spanish colonialism.  It is a date commemorated 
each year by the independence movement with a march to the town of Lares.

At the very moment federal agents were moving in on Ojeda�s hideout, a taped 
speech of his was being played at the Lares event.

�I�m a statehooder, but I see the FBI was trying to humiliate all Puerto 
Ricans by going after him on El Grito de Lares,� says the former naval 
officer who provided the agents information.  �I feel I was used.�

In early 2004, he claims, he and two of his friends met with FBI agents 
several times.  The told the agents that Ojeda was living in Hormigueros, 
and that the fugitive often ate at El Conejo Blanco, a well-known restaurant 
in Hormigueros popular with independence supporters.

�All they had to do was set up surveillance at the restaurant and they could 
have picked him up,� the informant says.

He says he also identified other spots on the island that Ojeda frequented.

�I wanted him arrested, not killed,� he said.

But when the agents failed to act by early this year, he says, he broke off 
contact and stopped offering any more information.

�I didn�t do it for the money, and never received a penny,� he insists.

When I called FBI headquarters in Washington, they referred all my questions 
to the San Juan field office, but agents there did not return several calls 
for comment.

Meanwhile, press reports in San Juan claim federal officials have begun to 
pay out part of the $1.1 million reward for Ojeda to two informants.

The Political Assassination of Filiberto Ojedas Rios has catalyzed the 
formation of a New York based coalition of Puerto Rican organizations and 
individuals to organize a political tribute to the life and political work 
of Filiberto Ojeda Rios on Saturday Nov. 19th (the venue to be announced).

The coalition has chosen to create a commemorative journal for this event; 
we are asking organizations and individuals to support this endeavor by 
buying ad space within the journal.  We are asking for solidarity statements 
that are Camera Ready pdf, jpg or psd.

If your statement is text based, then we will format it for you from emails 
or Word documents.  The prices and sizes are :

1)  One page (7.5 x 10):  $200
2.) Half page (7.5 x 4.75): $100
3.) Quarter page (3.5 x 4.75): $50
4.) Business card (3.5 x 2.25): $35
5.) 12 word greeting: $25

Slain Puerto Rican Rebel Didn�t Have To Die
Juan Gonzalez
NY Daily News
Thursday, October 6, 2005

A former naval intelligence officer says he knows for a fact that Puerto 
Rican nationalist fugitive Filiberto Ojeda Rios didn�t have to die in a 
shootout with the FBI.

He says he knows this because he told FBI agents a year ago where they could 
find Ojeda � even telling them where he liked to eat.

�What they did was an injustice,�  the former Navy officer told me last 
week.  �No matter what Ojeda did, he was still a human being . . . . They 
could easily have taken him alive.�

The informant, who asked not to be identified, has given his full account to 
the Justice Department�s Inspector General�s Office, which opened an 
independent review of the shooting last week.

FBI Director Robert Mueller requested the review after top officials from 
the island�s various political parties, including pro-commonwealth Gov. 
Anibal Acevedo Vil�, and several members of New York�s congressional 
delegation publicly criticized the FBI�s handling of the incident.

And yesterday the Puerto Rican commonwealth�s own Department of Justice 
subpoenaed weapons and records of the FBI�s operation.

By the time of his death, 72-year-old Ojeda, a onetime musician turned 
revolutionary, had become a legendary figure on the island.

A founder of the militant pro-independence group called the Macheteros, he 
had been on the run since 1990 for his role in a $7 million Wells Fargo 
armed robbery in Hartford in 1983.

During all those years, Ojeda frequently gave interviews to Puerto Rican 
reporters, routinely disseminated pro-independence proclamations, and was 
even spotted at times at protest marches.

Despite a reward on his head that reached $1.1 million, he popped up so 
often in public that Puerto Ricans openly joked about the FBI�s apparent 
inability to find him.

But on the afternoon of Sept. 23, a special team of agents dispatched from 
the United States surrounded Ojeda�s farmhouse hideout in Hormigueros, a 
small town near the island�s western coast.

According to the official version, Ojeda opened fire from inside while 
agents moved in to arrest him.  One agent was wounded and Ojeda was shot 
beneath the clavicle in the initial shootout.

The fugitive�s wife, who was with him at the time, surrendered immediately.  
She later claimed the agents opened fire without warning and that her 
husband offered to give up in the presence of well-known Puerto Rican 
journalist Jesus Davila, but agents refused.

Over the next 20 hours, the FBI team sealed off the area and would not allow 
Puerto Rican police near the scene.  By the time they entered the house the 
next day, Ojeda had bled to death.

The long delay, officials say, was caused by waiting for bomb detection 
units to arrive and check for possible booby-trap.

But even those who oppose Ojeda�s  radical views and methods aren�t buying 
that account.

Many are especially furious at the timing of the operation.

Sept. 23 is the anniversary of El Grito de Lares, Puerto Rico�s failed 1868 
independence revolt against Spanish colonialism.  It is a date commemorated 
each year by the independence movement with a march to the town of Lares.

At the very moment federal agents were moving in on Ojeda�s hideout, a taped 
speech of his was being played at the Lares event.

�I�m a statehooder, but I see the FBI was trying to humiliate all Puerto 
Ricans by going after him on El Grito de Lares,� says the former naval 
officer who provided the agents information.  �I feel I was used.�

In early 2004, he claims, he and two of his friends met with FBI agents 
several times.  The told the agents that Ojeda was living in Hormigueros, 
and that the fugitive often ate at El Conejo Blanco, a well-known restaurant 
in Hormigueros popular with independence supporters.

�All they had to do was set up surveillance at the restaurant and they could 
have picked him up,� the informant says.

He says he also identified other spots on the island that Ojeda frequented.

�I wanted him arrested, not killed,� he said.

But when the agents failed to act by early this year, he says, he broke off 
contact and stopped offering any more information.

�I didn�t do it for the money, and never received a penny,� he insists.

When I called FBI headquarters in Washington, they referred all my questions 
to the San Juan field office, but agents there did not return several calls 
for comment.

Meanwhile, press reports in San Juan claim federal officials have begun to 
pay out part of the $1.1 million reward for Ojeda to two informants.

check back with us later.  If you have any questions, comments, or any 
segment ideas please make post them on our webblog:

http://www.prolibertadweb.com/ProLibFreedomBlog/
_______________________________________________________________________________

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is calling on all of your allies to support
TITO KAYAK on the morning of Oct. 11th at his court hearing.  In this time
of repression, tragedy and uncertainty, we have to keep the pressure and
support on; TITO needs us to stand with him.

We cannot allow another Boricua revolutionary go to jail; with repression at
our heels, we have to stand strong and firm.  In the spirit of Filiberto, we
ask all folks to unite in support TITO.

NO MORE PUERTO RICAN POLITICAL PRISONERS!!

JUSTICE FOR TITO KAYAK!!
TUESDAY OCTOBER 11TH, 2005 AT 9AM
MANHATTAN CRIMINAL COURT 100 CENTRE ST.
Subway: 4, 5, 6, J, M to Chambers St./Brooklyn Bridge; A, C, E to Chambers
St.; R, N to Canal St.

Join ProLibertad and the friends of Tito Kayak in NYC, as we support our
brother Alberto �Tito Kayak� DeJesus!

Tito Kayak, a Puerto Rican environmentalist and civil disobedient, was
arrested on Monday June 13th, 2005 for attempting to lower the United
Nations flag and replacing it with the Puerto Rican flag; this was an
another attempt to call attention to the colonial condition of Puerto Rico
and to the contamination on the island of Vieques!! As many of you
remember, Tito Kayak was responsible for hanging the Puerto Rican and
Vieques flags from the Statue of Liberty on November 2001. Tito was
sentenced to jail for this act of civil disobedience and served his time in
New York City and Puerto Rico.

Tito�s hearing was scheduled for Thursday Sept. 8th at 9am; ProLibertad, the
Friends of Tito Kayak and Long time Vieques activist Ismael Guadalupe
supported Tito as his trial was scheduled for Tuesday October 11th, 2005 at
9am!!

Tito is facing a Class B misdemeanor charge of trespassing; if found guilty
he will have to serve 90 days in jail!! Tito�s felony charge of Reckless
endangerment was dropped!! Tito should not serve one day in jail!!

TAKE THE DAY OFF FROM WORK!!
SUPPORT TITO KAYAK!!

another attempt to call attention to the colonial condition of Puerto Rico
and to the contamination on the island of Vieques!! As many of you
remember, Tito Kayak was responsible for hanging the Puerto Rican and
Vieques flags from the Statue of Liberty on November 2001. Tito was
sentenced to jail for this act of civil disobedience and served his time in
New York City and Puerto Rico.

Tito�s hearing was scheduled for Thursday Sept. 8th at 9am; ProLibertad, the
Friends of Tito Kayak and Long time Vieques activist Ismael Guadalupe
supported Tito as his trial was scheduled for Tuesday October 11th, 2005 at
9am!!

Tito is facing a Class B misdemeanor charge of trespassing; if found guilty
he will have to serve 90 days in jail!! Tito�s felony charge of Reckless
endangerment was dropped!! Tito should not serve one day in jail!!

TAKE THE DAY OFF FROM WORK!!
SUPPORT TITO KAYAK!!
____________________________________________________________________________

From Lares, Puerto Rico, To New York:
Filiberto Lives, The Struggle Continues!

The Political Assassination of Filiberto Ojeda Rios and the Popular Struggle 
for National Liberation.
Presentation By
Jorge Farinacci, Frente Socialista de Puerto Rico
Socialist Front of Puerto Rico

VIDEO PRESENTATION OF THE PROTESTS AND INDIGNATION IN PUERTO RICO ABOUT THE 
ASSASSINATION OF FILIBERTO OJEDA RIOS.

Wednesday, October 12, 2005
6:30 p.m.
St. Mary�s Episcopal Church
521 West 126th Street, Maniatan
Between �msterdam Avenue and Broadway
#1 and # Trains to 125th Street and Broadway

UPDATE ON TITO KAYAK CASE
Sponsored By:
Frente Socialista de Puerto Rico � Nueva York
Socialist Front of Puerto Rico � New York
For More Information: (718) 601-4751

Post ID:3830
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-10-10 18:21:01
Subject:Tomorrow: Tito Kayak in NYC
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

DOWNLOAD THE OCTOBER EDITION OF EL COQUI LIBRE; ProLibertad's newsletter:
http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclOctober2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

There will be no Despierta Boricua segments until the end of October, please 
check back with us later.  If you have any questions, comments, or any 
segment ideas please make post them on our webblog:

http://www.prolibertadweb.com/ProLibFreedomBlog/
_______________________________________________________________________________

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is calling on all of your allies to support
TITO KAYAK on the morning of Oct. 11th at his court hearing.  In this time
of repression, tragedy and uncertainty, we have to keep the pressure and
support on; TITO needs us to stand with him.

We cannot allow another Boricua revolutionary go to jail; with repression at
our heels, we have to stand strong and firm.  In the spirit of Filiberto, we
ask all folks to unite in support TITO.

NO MORE PUERTO RICAN POLITICAL PRISONERS!!

JUSTICE FOR TITO KAYAK!!
TUESDAY OCTOBER 11TH, 2005 AT 9AM
MANHATTAN CRIMINAL COURT 100 CENTRE ST.
Subway: 4, 5, 6, J, M to Chambers St./Brooklyn Bridge; A, C, E to Chambers
St.; R, N to Canal St.

Join ProLibertad and the friends of Tito Kayak in NYC, as we support our
brother Alberto �Tito Kayak� DeJesus!

Tito Kayak, a Puerto Rican environmentalist and civil disobedient, was
arrested on Monday June 13th, 2005 for attempting to lower the United
Nations flag and replacing it with the Puerto Rican flag; this was an
another attempt to call attention to the colonial condition of Puerto Rico
and to the contamination on the island of Vieques!! As many of you
remember, Tito Kayak was responsible for hanging the Puerto Rican and
Vieques flags from the Statue of Liberty on November 2001. Tito was
sentenced to jail for this act of civil disobedience and served his time in
New York City and Puerto Rico.

Tito�s hearing was scheduled for Thursday Sept. 8th at 9am; ProLibertad, the
Friends of Tito Kayak and Long time Vieques activist Ismael Guadalupe
supported Tito as his trial was scheduled for Tuesday October 11th, 2005 at
9am!!

Tito is facing a Class B misdemeanor charge of trespassing; if found guilty
he will have to serve 90 days in jail!! Tito�s felony charge of Reckless
endangerment was dropped!! Tito should not serve one day in jail!!

TAKE THE DAY OFF FROM WORK!!
SUPPORT TITO KAYAK!!
____________________________________________________________________________

From Lares, Puerto Rico, To New York:

Post ID:3832
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-10-13 00:12:39
Subject:URGENT: FBI ARREST WARRANT FOR ANTONIO CAMACHO
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

DOWNLOAD THE SEPTEMBER EDITION OF EL COQUI LIBRE; ProLibertad's newsletter:
http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclOctober2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is calling on the Puerto Rican movement, 
our friends and allies, to come out to an emergency protest at the Federal 
Building, 26 Federal Plaza, City Hall, this Friday, October 14, 2005, at 
5:00 p.m. Take the 4,5,6 to Brooklyn Bridge/City Hall!!

Former Puerto Rican Political Prisoner Antonio Camacho Negron, arrested for 
being a part of the MACHETEROS in the late 1980s, communicated this evening 
that an arrest warrant has been issued for him and that the FBI is searching 
for him.

Antonio is asking that an urgent protest be organized demanding that his 
life and physical integrity be respected.

He is also asking that the Venezuelan Consulate be contacted and asked to 
request of the U.S. Government that his life and physical integrity be 
respected.

WE NEED PEOPLE TO COME OUT AND SUPPORT ANTONIO CAMACHO NEGRON!! NO MORE 
PUERTO RICAN POLITICAL PRISONERS!!

Todo Boricua Machetero!!
Hands Off Antonio Camacho Negron!!
Stop Repression Against the Puerto Rican Independence Movement!!
Stop The FBI Assassinations in Puerto Rico!!
Free All Political Prisoners!!
Free Puerto Rico!!





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Building, 26 Federal Plaza, City Hall, this Friday, October 14, 2005, at

Post ID:3834
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-10-16 16:19:41
Subject:Demand Medical Treatment for PR PP
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

DOWNLOAD THE OCTOBER EDITION OF EL COQUI LIBRE; ProLibertad's newsletter:
http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclOctober2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

At the same time that the FBI/U.S. government has assassinated Filiberto 
Ojeda, is trying to arrest Antonio Camacho Negron for no good reason, one of 
our 5 Puerto Rican Political Prisoners is being denied medical treatment for 
a serious ailment.

Vieques Political Prisoner Jose Velez Acosta has been EXTREMELY ILL for 
almost a month.  He has been bleeding profusely from his rectum, feels pain 
in his colon/kidney area, and has lost his appetite.

He has been given various medications, but has not undergone any medical 
examinations.  He has a Colonoscopy scheduled, but has not undergone the 
procedure.

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is urging all our allies and supporters to 
download a PDF format copy of the following letter and mail it out to Warden 
Tracy Johns of USP Coleman I and demand that Jose Velez Acosta receive the 
medical attention he deserves!!

http://www.prolibertadweb.com/JoseVelezMedicalLetter.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

http://www.prolibertadweb.com/ElDiarioArticlesACN.pdf

The above PDF link is to three articles written in El dario/La Prensa (in 
English) about Antonio Camacho negron adn the ProLibertad picket organized 
on Friday Oct. 14th to denounce the FBI's attempts to arrest him!!

The FBI has issued an arrest warrant for former Puerto Rican Political 
Prisoner Antonio Camacho Negron, arrested for being a part of the MACHETEROS 
in the late 1980s.

The following is a statement that Antonio Camacho Negron wrote and asked 
that
ProLibertad read at the Oct. 14th picket:

The allegation that the FBI has a warrant for my arrest for failure to serve 
15 more years in federal prison is false. It is a total fabrication. The FBI 
is interested in sequestering me for information that I have gathered 
surrounding Filiberto�s death, and have approached my family with this lie 
in the hopes that they will disclose my whereabouts.

I am not �hiding�. I am , of course, being cautious, but I am using my cell 
phone, communicating with friends and family members, and still 
participating in public events. I am accessible. I feel that the FBI will 
make an attempt on my life and justify it with the fabricated lies in 
pursuit of the information I have shared with various elements of the Puerto 
Rican media, as well as to quell the revolutionary spirit that has been 
activated by Filiberto�s death.

The FBI will resort to acts of terrorism against me and others who are 
calling for a full investigation of Filiberto�s death to terrify and silence 
the people from demanding the truth.

Earlier this week, there were allegations by provocateur elements in Puerto 
Rico who have made bold attempts to smear the name and reputation of 
Filiberto�s wife. I believe that the smear tactics are a strategic ploy by 
the federal government to ruin her credibility as a witness to events that 
led to her husband�s assassination. I fully support Filiberto�s wife and 
family and trust the integrity and solidarity that has been instilled in 
each and every member by the late Puerto Rican leader.

I have never been nor will ever be a fugitive from US agencies. I have 
honored his sentence to the fullest extent, and publicly exercises his right 
to express his political and moral views of the colonization of Puerto Rico 
by the United States which have made me one of the targets for censure, 
incarceration, and ultimately assassination.

I am calm and collected, heartened by the reawakened spirit of the Puerto 
Rican people who have truly understood the social and political implications 
of the death of the great patriot Filiberto Ojeda Rios. That statehooders, 
independentistas, and the undecided all understand that Filiberto�s death 
was a political assassination done by the US to demoralize the Puerto Rican 
community, and to quell any and all dissent regarding the liberation of 
Puerto Rico, anti-war beliefs, and other social justice voices that seeks 
dignity, sovereignty, and democracy.

I need the community at large to be vigilant about the conduct of law 
enforcement agents to safeguard my life, and the lives of my friends and 
family members. That the community should demand a thorough investigation on 
Filiberto�s death, and that the process be transparent and secure the human, 
civil, and social rights of Filiberto�s family, friends, and supporters. The 
community must demand that the law enforcement agents and their leadership 
be charged with the crimes that they are guilty of and that they are to be 
punished to the fullest extent of the law.

I love Puerto Rico, and am proud of my people and my heritage, and that I 
will never ever waiver my rights to defend Puerto Rico.





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

phone, communicating with friends and family members, and still 
participating in public events. I am accessible. I feel that the FBI will 
make an attempt on my life and justify it with the fabricated lies in

Rico who have made bold attempts to smear the name and reputation of 
Filiberto�s wife. I believe that the smear tactics are a strategic ploy by

led to her husband�s assassination. I fully support Filiberto�s wife and 
family and trust the integrity and solidarity that has been instilled in 
each and every member by the late Puerto Rican leader.

I have never been nor will ever be a fugitive from US agencies. I have 
honored his sentence to the fullest extent, and publicly exercises his right 
to express his political and moral views of the colonization of Puerto Rico 
by the United States which have made me one of the targets for censure, 
incarceration, and ultimately assassination.

I am calm and collected, heartened by the reawakened spirit of the Puerto 
Rican people who have truly understood the social and political implications 
of the death of the great patriot Filiberto Ojeda Rios. That statehooders, 
independentistas, and the undecided all understand that Filiberto�s death 
was a political assassination done by the US to demoralize the Puerto Rican 
community, and to quell any and all dissent regarding the liberation of 
Puerto Rico, anti-war beliefs, and other social justice voices that seeks 
dignity, sovereignty, and democracy.

I need the community at large to be vigilant about the conduct of law 
enforcement agents to safeguard my life, and the lives of my friends and 
family members. That the community should demand a thorough investigation on 
Filiberto�s death, and that the process be transparent and secure the human, 
civil, and social rights of Filiberto�s family, friends, and supporters. The 
community must demand that the law enforcement agents and their leadership 
be charged with the crimes that they are guilty of and that they are to be 
punished to the fullest extent of the law.

I love Puerto Rico, and am proud of my people and my heritage, and that I 
will never ever waiver my rights to defend Puerto Rico.

Post ID:3836
Sender:"FreetheCuban5 LibertadparalosCinco" <freethecuban5@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-10-17 20:04:05
Subject:NOCHE CUBANA: Support Venceremos Brigade and the Cuban 5
Message:

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5
http://www.freethecuban5.com
Freethecuban5@...
Free the Cuban 5 Hotline: 718-601-4751

******************************************************************************
Download The Project Sept. Edition Newsletter:
http://www.freethecuban5.com/JF5October2005.pdf

******************************************************************************
SUPPORT THE VENCEREMOS BRIGADE NOCHE CUBANA FRIDAY OCTOBER 28TH!!

Didn't make it to Cuba with us this year?

Join us as we recreate a night in Cuba and share what we learned about the 
revolution, our work, our experience and the TRAVEL CHALLENGE!!  COME READY 
TO EAT FOOD, DANCE AND PLAY DOMINOES!!  Food will be served and Drinks will 
be sold!!

Hosted by the Venceremos Brigade (vbrigade@...)
$10 donation (but you give what you can)

Friday Oct. 28th at 7:30pm (doors Open)
Program begins at 8pm
Party begins 9pm-11:30pm

Unity Hall 235 w23rd St.
NY NY

******************************************************************************

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5 is calling on all peoples
to support the international campaign to sign on the letter to Attorney
General Alberto Gonzalez ro demand the FREEDOM OF THE CUBAN 5!!

Forward this email throughout your address books and link this link to your
websites!!

The time is now to put pressure on the US government to free the Cuban 5!!
After the Aug. 9th decision of the 11th Cicuit Court of Appeals
(http://www.freethecuban5.com/page16.html) and the Decision by the UN
Working group on Arbritrary Detentions, the the time is now to keep putting
pressure on the US government!!

The People free Political prisoners!! Add your name to the list of
support!!

http://www.liberenlos5.cult.cu/index.php?lang=2

Post ID:3838
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-10-18 11:45:23
Subject:Support PR PP Oct. 20th: JOSE VELEZ ACOSTA DAY!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

DOWNLOAD THE OCTOBER EDITION OF EL COQUI LIBRE; ProLibertad's newsletter:
http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclOctober2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is calling on all our allies and supporters 
to consider Thursday Oct. 20th JOSE VELEZ ACOSTA DAY!!  We want all of you 
to call USP Coleman I on Thursday October 20th and demand from Warden Tracy 
Johns that Jose Velez Acosta #23883-069 be given the proper medical 
treatment he deserves!!

BOMBBARD THEIR TELEPHONE LINE AND FAX LINES ON JOSE VELEZ ACOSTA DAY!! LET 
THEM KNOW THAT WE SUPPORT JOSE VELEZ ACOSTA AND WILL NOT LET HIM SUFFER!!

Phone:  352-689-6000

For the fax machine number and to learn the facts of Jose Velez Acosta's 
medical crisis read the following statement:

At the same time that the FBI/U.S. government has assassinated Filiberto
Ojeda, is trying to arrest Antonio Camacho Negron for no good reason, one of
our 5 Puerto Rican Political Prisoners is being denied medical treatment for
a serious ailment.

Vieques Political Prisoner Jose Velez Acosta has been EXTREMELY ILL for
almost a month.  He has been bleeding profusely from his rectum, feels pain
in his colon/kidney area, and has lost his appetite.

He has been given various medications, but has not undergone any medical
examinations.  He has a Colonoscopy scheduled, but has not undergone the
procedure.

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is urging all our allies and supporters to
download a PDF format copy of the following letter and fax it to Warden
Tracy Johns of USP Coleman I and demand that Jose Velez Acosta receive the
medical attention he deserves!!

http://www.prolibertadweb.com/JoseVelezMedicalLetter.pdf

Prison Fax:  352-689-6012 make sure your Fax cover sheet states clearly that
the letter is for Warden Tracy Johns regarding Jose Velez Acosta #23883-069

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5

******************************************************************************
SUPPORT THE VENCEREMOS BRIGADE NOCHE CUBANA FRIDAY OCTOBER 28TH!!

Didn't make it to Cuba with us this year?

Join us as we recreate a night in Cuba and share what we learned about the 
revolution, our work, our experience and the TRAVEL CHALLENGE!!  COME READY 
TO EAT FOOD, DANCE AND PLAY DOMINOES!!  Food will be served and Drinks will 
be sold!!

Hosted by the Venceremos Brigade (vbrigade@...)
$10 donation (but you give what you can)

Friday Oct. 28th at 7:30pm (doors Open)
Program begins at 8pm
Party begins 9pm-11:30pm

Unity Hall 235 w23rd St.
NY NY

******************************************************************************

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5 is calling on all peoples
to support the international campaign to sign on the letter to Attorney
General Alberto Gonzalez ro demand the FREEDOM OF THE CUBAN 5!!

Forward this email throughout your address books and link this link to your
websites!!

The time is now to put pressure on the US government to free the Cuban 5!!
After the Aug. 9th decision of the 11th Cicuit Court of Appeals and the 
Decision
by the UN Working group on Arbritrary Detentions, the the time is now to
keep putting pressure on the US government!!

The People free Political prisoners!! Add your name to the list of
support!!

http://www.liberenlos5.cult.cu/index.php?lang=2

Post ID:3845
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-10-22 14:02:49
Subject:Keep the Pressure on: Support Jose Velez Acosta!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

DOWNLOAD THE OCTOBER EDITION OF EL COQUI LIBRE; ProLibertad's newsletter:
http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclOctober2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign thanks all of you for supporting JOSE VELEZ 
ACOSTA DAY!!

Your calls and faxes have shown that Vieques Political Prisoner Jose Velez 
Acosta is supported by the people!!  BUT, WE CANNOT LET UP!!  We still have 
to support Jose Velez Acota, as of now, we have not heard about him 
receiving propoer medical treatment!!

KEEP UP THE BOMBBARDMENT!!  FAX AND CALL USP COLEMAN I!!  LET THEM KNOW THAT 
WE SUPPORT JOSE VELEZ ACOSTA AND WILL NOT LET HIM SUFFER!!

Phone:  352-689-6000

For the fax machine number and to learn the facts of Jose Velez Acosta's
medical crisis read the following statement:

At the same time that the FBI/U.S. government has assassinated Filiberto
Ojeda, is trying to arrest Antonio Camacho Negron for no good reason, one of
our 5 Puerto Rican Political Prisoners is being denied medical treatment for
a serious ailment.

Vieques Political Prisoner Jose Velez Acosta has been EXTREMELY ILL for
almost a month.  He has been bleeding profusely from his rectum, feels pain
in his colon/kidney area, and has lost his appetite.

He has been given various medications, but has not undergone any medical
examinations.  He has a Colonoscopy scheduled, but has not undergone the
procedure.

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is urging all our allies and supporters to
download a PDF format copy of the following letter and fax it to Warden
Tracy Johns of USP Coleman I and demand that Jose Velez Acosta receive the
medical attention he deserves!!

http://www.prolibertadweb.com/JoseVelezMedicalLetter.pdf

Prison Fax:  352-689-6012 make sure your Fax cover sheet states clearly that
the letter is for Warden Tracy Johns regarding Jose Velez Acosta #23883-069

Post ID:3849
Sender:"FreetheCuban5 LibertadparalosCinco" <freethecuban5@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-10-24 12:41:59
Subject:NYC Marathon for the Cuban 5 and Mumia
Message:

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5
http://www.freethecuban5.com
Freethecuban5@...
Free the Cuban 5 Hotline: 718-601-4751

******************************************************************************
Download The Project Oct. Edition Newsletter:
http://www.freethecuban5.com/JF5October2005.pdf

******************************************************************************
THE CUBAN 5 AND MUMIA ATTHE NYC MARATHON!!

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5 is proud to support Angel 
Gonzalez, long time Puerto Rican Activist, who is running the NYC Marathon 
on Sunday Nov. 6th for the FREEDOM OF POLITICAL PRISONER MUMIA ABU JAMAL AND 
THE CUBAN 5!!

We ask that people send pledges to Angel Gonzalez and to join the Popular 
Education Project to
Free the Cuban 5 on Nov. 6th on Sunday Nov. 6th at E116th St. and 1st Ave. 
at a community table to distribute information on the Cuban 5 and Mumia Abu 
jamal!!

JOIN US AS WE MAKE THE NYC MARATHON 2005 ALL ABOUT POLITICAL PRISONERS!!

A statement fromm Angel Gonzalez:

Let me hear from you, Familia y Amigos:

On Nov. 6, I am running the New York City Marathon.  I will run to raise 
awareness about Mumia Abu-Jamal and the Cuban 5.  They are six political 
prisoners, who suffer unjustly in US jails and desperately need our support.

Mumia is a renowned African-American activist and journalist who was been 
jailed since 1981 for allegedly shooting a police officer.  Evidence points 
to his innocence and to racist manipulations throughout his trial.  We 
cannot allow our political leader to remain in jail!  Mumia must not be 
executed. Join the broad international movement calling for Mumia's freedom. 
  Please read more at www.mumia.com .

The Cuban 5 have been unjustly jailed in the US since 1998.  The Cuban 5 
worked to expose Cuban Miami-based terrorist organizations by documenting 
their plots to bomb places in Cuba and other countries. The Miami-based 
terrorist groups in the past have killed and injured hundreds with 
explosives in hotels and planes.  The US government has refused to prosecute 
those exposed Miami terrorists and instead has protected those terrorists!  
For their heroic work, the Cuban 5  were ironically persecuted and were 
jailed for the outrageous charge of "espionage conspiracy".  This past 
August, the Cuban 5 won an appeal for a new trial, BUT they still remain in 
jail and continue to be cruely denied visits from their family members. The 
Cuban 5 must be freed. Please read more at www.freethecuban5.com .

You can help Free Mumia and Free the Cuban 5 by pledging for my marathon 
run. Your check can be made out to either of these support organizations:

For Mumia, checks are made out to "NBUF" with a memo saying for "Mumia 
Organizing".
For the Cuban 5, checks are made out to "IFCO/The Popular Education 
Project".
Checks written in my name will be divided evenly between these 
organizations.

Send your pledges to me at:
Angel F. Gonzalez
3977 Sedgwick Avenue #18 C
Bronx, New York   10463

The training has been rough ... BUT ... for this important cause, I will try 
to go the extra mile.  (At 53 years, it ain't easy!)

With your pledge, you can help carry me across the finish line.  Your 
generosity will help to promote my t-shirt message, FREE MUMIA & FREE THE 
CUBAN 5, throughout the 26 miles in New York City and among thousands on 
November 6.

Thank you.

Para la justicia y la libertad,
Angel F. Gonzalez

to go the extra mile.  (At 53 years, it ain't easy!)

Para la justicia y la libertad,

Post ID:3854
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-10-28 11:53:37
Subject:Both Vieques PPs Need our Support!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

DOWNLOAD THE OCTOBER EDITION OF EL COQUI LIBRE; ProLibertad's newsletter:
http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclOctober2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

DEMAND MEDICAL TREATMENT FOR JOSE VELEZ ACOSTA!!

At the same time that the FBI/U.S. government has assassinated Filiberto 
Ojeda, is trying to arrest Antonio Camacho Negron for no good reason, one of 
our 5 Puerto Rican Political Prisoners is being denied medical treatment for 
a serious ailment.

Vieques Political Prisoner Jose Velez Acosta has been EXTREMELY ILL for 
almost a month.  He has been bleeding profusely from his rectum, feels pain 
in his colon/kidney area, and has lost his appetite.

He has been given various medications, but has not undergone any medical 
examinations.  He has a Colonoscopy scheduled, but has not undergone the 
procedure.

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is urging all our allies and supporters to 
download a PDF format copy of the following letter and mail it out to Warden 
Tracy Johns of USP Coleman I and demand that Jose Velez Acosta receive the 
medical attention he deserves!!

Mail out the letter or fax it to the Prison Fax: 352-689-6012  and if you 
want call the warden personally at Phone: 352-689-6000

http://www.prolibertadweb.com/JoseVelezMedicalLetter.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

DEMAND PROPER TREATMENT FOR JOSE PEREZ GONZALEZ

Vieques Political Prisoner Jose Perez Gonzalez was moved to USP Atlanta over 
a month and half ago and has been kept in inhumane conditions.

He is being kept in a cell, made for two people, with three other inmates.  
The other inmates are sick with TB, the linens they are being given are 
soiled and stained with bodily fluids.

He is also being denied his personal belongings, fresh water, toothbrushes 
and many other personal amenities.  He is being kept in the cell for 23 
hours  a day, with only an hour for recreation.

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is urging all our allies and supporters to 
download a PDF format copy of the following letter and mail it out to Warden 
Zenk demand that Jose Perez Gonzalez be treated properly and that he be 
transferred to a better penitentiary.

Mail out the letter or fax it to the Prison Fax: 404-331-2403 And if you 
want to call the Warden at Phone: 404-635-5100

http://www.prolibertadweb.com/JPGSupportLetter.pdf

DEMAND MEDICAL TREATMENT FOR JOSE VELEZ ACOSTA!!

DEMAND PROPER TREATMENT FOR JOSE PEREZ GONZALEZ

Vieques Political Prisoner Jose Perez Gonzalez was moved to USP Atlanta over 
a month and half ago and has been kept in inhumane conditions.

He is being kept in a cell, made for two people, with three other inmates.  
The other inmates are sick with TB, the linens they are being given are 
soiled and stained with bodily fluids.

He is also being denied his personal belongings, fresh water, toothbrushes 
and many other personal amenities.  He is being kept in the cell for 23 
hours  a day, with only an hour for recreation.

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is urging all our allies and supporters to 
download a PDF format copy of the following letter and mail it out to Warden 
Zenk demand that Jose Perez Gonzalez be treated properly and that he be 
transferred to a better penitentiary.

Mail out the letter or fax it to the Prison Fax: 404-331-2403 And if you 
want to call the Warden at Phone: 404-635-5100

http://www.prolibertadweb.com/JPGSupportLetter.pdf

Post ID:3858
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-10-30 11:51:17
Subject:Antonio Camacho Needs HELP!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
ProLibertad@...
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________________

DOWNLOAD THE OCTOBER EDITION OF EL COQUI LIBRE; ProLibertad's newsletter:
http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclOctober2005.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

ANTONIO CAMACHO NEGRON NEEDS OUR FINANCIAL SUPPORT!!

Antonio Camacho Negron�s father has passed away and Antonio needs our help 
to bring one of his children to Puerto Rico for the funeral and to see their 
family.  Antonio doesn�t have money and needs our support.

A bank account has been established with Banco Popular; the account number 
is 447315851.  The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is calling on our allies and 
supporters to send a donation so that Antonio can bring his child to Puerto 
Rico.  He really needs our financial support!!

_______________________________________________________________________________

DEMAND MEDICAL TREATMENT FOR JOSE VELEZ ACOSTA!!

At the same time that the FBI/U.S. government has assassinated Filiberto 
Ojeda, is trying to arrest Antonio Camacho Negron for no good reason, one of 
our 5 Puerto Rican Political Prisoners is being denied medical treatment for 
a serious ailment.

Vieques Political Prisoner Jose Velez Acosta has been EXTREMELY ILL for 
almost a month.  He has been bleeding profusely from his rectum, feels pain 
in his colon/kidney area, and has lost his appetite.

He has been given various medications, but has not undergone any medical 
examinations.  He has a Colonoscopy scheduled, but has not undergone the 
procedure.

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is urging all our allies and supporters to 
download a PDF format copy of the following letter and mail it out to Warden 
Tracy Johns of USP Coleman I and demand that Jose Velez Acosta receive the 
medical attention he deserves!!

Mail out the letter or fax it to the Prison Fax: 352-689-6012  and if you 
want call the warden personally at Phone: 352-689-6000

http://www.prolibertadweb.com/JoseVelezMedicalLetter.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

DEMAND PROPER TREATMENT FOR JOSE PEREZ GONZALEZ

Vieques Political Prisoner Jose Perez Gonzalez was moved to USP Atlanta over 
a month and half ago and has been kept in inhumane conditions.

He is being kept in a cell, made for two people, with three other inmates.  
The other inmates are sick with TB, the linens they are being given are 
soiled and stained with bodily fluids.

He is also being denied his personal belongings, fresh water, toothbrushes 
and many other personal amenities.  He is being kept in the cell for 23 
hours  a day, with only an hour for recreation.

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is urging all our allies and supporters to 
download a PDF format copy of the following letter and mail it out to Warden 
Zenk demand that Jose Perez Gonzalez be treated properly and that he be 
transferred to a better penitentiary.

Mail out the letter or fax it to the Prison Fax: 404-331-2403 And if you 
want to call the Warden at Phone: 404-635-5100

http://www.prolibertadweb.com/JPGSupportLetter.pdf

Post ID:3860
Sender:"FreetheCuban5 LibertadparalosCinco" <freethecuban5@...>
Post Date/Time:2005-10-30 14:39:09
Subject:Nov. 6th for the Cuban 5 and Mumia
Message:

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5
http://www.freethecuban5.com
Freethecuban5@...
Free the Cuban 5 Hotline: 718-601-4751

******************************************************************************
Download The Project Oct. Edition Newsletter:
http://www.freethecuban5.com/JF5October2005.pdf

******************************************************************************
THE CUBAN 5 AND MUMIA ATTHE NYC MARATHON!!

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5 is proud to support Angel
Gonzalez, long time Puerto Rican Activist, who is running the NYC Marathon
on Sunday Nov. 6th for the FREEDOM OF POLITICAL PRISONER MUMIA ABU JAMAL AND
THE CUBAN 5!!

We ask that people send pledges to Angel Gonzalez and to join the Popular
Education Project to
Free the Cuban 5 on Nov. 6th on Sunday Nov. 6th at E116th St. and 1st Ave.
at a community table to distribute information on the Cuban 5 and Mumia Abu
jamal!!

JOIN US AS WE MAKE THE NYC MARATHON 2005 ALL ABOUT POLITICAL PRISONERS!!

A statement fromm Angel Gonzalez:

Let me hear from you, Familia y Amigos:

On Nov. 6, I am running the New York City Marathon.  I will run to raise
awareness about Mumia Abu-Jamal and the Cuban 5.  They are six political
prisoners, who suffer unjustly in US jails and desperately need our support.

Mumia is a renowned African-American activist and journalist who was been
jailed since 1981 for allegedly shooting a police officer.  Evidence points
to his innocence and to racist manipulations throughout his trial.  We
cannot allow our political leader to remain in jail!  Mumia must not be
executed. Join the broad international movement calling for Mumia's freedom.
  Please read more at www.mumia.com .

The Cuban 5 have been unjustly jailed in the US since 1998.  The Cuban 5
worked to expose Cuban Miami-based terrorist organizations by documenting
their plots to bomb places in Cuba and other countries. The Miami-based
terrorist groups in the past have killed and injured hundreds with
explosives in hotels and planes.  The US government has refused to prosecute
those exposed Miami terrorists and instead has protected those terrorists!
For their heroic work, the Cuban 5  were ironically persecuted and were
jailed for the outrageous charge of "espionage conspiracy".  This past
August, the Cuban 5 won an appeal for a new trial, BUT they still remain in
jail and continue to be cruely denied visits from their family members. The
Cuban 5 must be freed. Please read more at www.freethecuban5.com .

You can help Free Mumia and Free the Cuban 5 by pledging for my marathon
run. Your check can be made out to either of these support organizations:

For Mumia, checks are made out to "NBUF" with a memo saying for "Mumia
Organizing".
For the Cuban 5, checks are made out to "IFCO/The Popular Education
Project".
Checks written in my name will be divided evenly between these
organizations.

Send your pledges to me at:
Angel F. Gonzalez
3977 Sedgwick Avenue #18 C
Bronx, New York   10463

The training has been rough ... BUT ... for this important cause, I will try
to go the extra mile.  (At 53 years, it ain't easy!)

With your pledge, you can help carry me across the finish line.  Your
generosity will help to promote my t-shirt message, FREE MUMIA & FREE THE
CUBAN 5, throughout the 26 miles in New York City and among thousands on
November 6.

Thank you.

Para la justicia y la libertad,
Angel F. Gonzalez





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

jamal!!

Organizing".

Project".

Send your pledges to me at:
Angel F. Gonzalez
3977 Sedgwick Avenue #18 C
Bronx, New York   10463

The training has been rough ... BUT ... for this important cause, I will try
to go the extra mile.  (At 53 years, it ain't easy!)

With your pledge, you can help carry me across the finish line.  Your
generosity will help to promote my t-shirt message, FREE MUMIA & FREE THE
CUBAN 5, throughout the 26 miles in New York City and among thousands on
November 6.

Thank you.

Para la justicia y la libertad,
Angel F. Gonzalez

_______________________________________________________________________________

ANTONIO CAMACHO NEGRON NEEDS OUR FINANCIAL SUPPORT!!

Antonio Camacho Negron�s father has passed away and Antonio needs our help
to bring one of his children to Puerto Rico for the funeral and to see their
family.  Antonio doesn�t have money and needs our support.

A bank account has been established with Banco Popular; the account number
is 447315851.  The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is calling on our allies and
supporters to send a donation so that Antonio can bring his child to Puerto
Rico.  He really needs our financial support!!

_______________________________________________________________________________

DEMAND MEDICAL TREATMENT FOR JOSE VELEZ ACOSTA!!

At the same time that the FBI/U.S. government has assassinated Filiberto
Ojeda, is trying to arrest Antonio Camacho Negron for no good reason, one of
our 5 Puerto Rican Political Prisoners is being denied medical treatment for
a serious ailment.

Vieques Political Prisoner Jose Velez Acosta has been EXTREMELY ILL for
almost a month.  He has been bleeding profusely from his rectum, feels pain
in his colon/kidney area, and has lost his appetite.

He has been given various medications, but has not undergone any medical
examinations.  He has a Colonoscopy scheduled, but has not undergone the
procedure.

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is urging all our allies and supporters to
download a PDF format copy of the following letter and mail it out to Warden
Tracy Johns of USP Coleman I and demand that Jose Velez Acosta receive the
medical attention he deserves!!

Mail out the letter or fax it to the Prison Fax: 352-689-6012  and if you
want call the warden personally at Phone: 352-689-6000

http://www.prolibertadweb.com/JoseVelezMedicalLetter.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

DEMAND PROPER TREATMENT FOR JOSE PEREZ GONZALEZ

Vieques Political Prisoner Jose Perez Gonzalez was moved to USP Atlanta over
a month and half ago and has been kept in inhumane conditions.

He is being kept in a cell, made for two people, with three other inmates.
The other inmates are sick with TB, the linens they are being given are
soiled and stained with bodily fluids.

He is also being denied his personal belongings, fresh water, toothbrushes
and many other personal amenities.  He is being kept in the cell for 23
hours  a day, with only an hour for recreation.

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is urging all our allies and supporters to
download a PDF format copy of the following letter and mail it out to Warden
Zenk demand that Jose Perez Gonzalez be treated properly and that he be
transferred to a better penitentiary.

Mail out the letter or fax it to the Prison Fax: 404-331-2403 And if you
want to call the Warden at Phone: 404-635-5100

http://www.prolibertadweb.com/JPGSupportLetter.pdf

Sender:"FreetheCuban5 LibertadparalosCinco" <freethecuban5@...>

Subject:Nov. 6th NYC Marathon for the Cuban 5 and Mumia
Message:

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5
http://www.freethecuban5.com
Freethecuban5@...

******************************************************************************
Download The Project NOVEMBER Edition Newsletter:
http://www.freethecuban5.com/JF5November2005.pdf

******************************************************************************
THE CUBAN 5 AND MUMIA ATTHE NYC MARATHON!!

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5 is proud to support Angel
Gonzalez, long time Puerto Rican Activist, who is running the NYC Marathon
on Sunday Nov. 6th for the FREEDOM OF POLITICAL PRISONER MUMIA ABU JAMAL AND
THE CUBAN 5!!

Education Project to Free the Cuban 5 on Nov. 6th on Sunday Nov. 6th at

at a community table to distribute information on the Cuban 5 and Mumia Abu
jamal!!

JOIN US AS WE MAKE THE NYC MARATHON 2005 ALL ABOUT POLITICAL PRISONERS!!

A statement fromm Angel Gonzalez:

Let me hear from you, Familia y Amigos:

awareness about Mumia Abu-Jamal and the Cuban 5.  They are six political
